KR1195856-B1	Recycled polymer modified additive for asphalt concrete, consists of process oil, tackifier, viscosity lowering agent, emulsifier, polymer modifier and water in specified amounts	GIL C J;  IL W L;  JUNG C K;  JUNG S W;  KYOUNG A L;  LEE C B;  YOUNG J O;  YUN W J	KYOUNG A L (KYOU-Individual);  DREAM ASCON CO LTD (DREA-Non-standard)	2012P78756	   NOVELTY - A recycled polymer modified additive consists of (in wt.%) process oil (20-50), tackifier (4-35), viscosity lowering agent (0.5-20), emulsifier (0.5-6), polymer modifier (10-40), and water (30-65). The viscosity lowering agent is chosen from microwax, stearate, oxidized wax, wax emulsion, stearic acid, plasticizer and vegetable oil. The emulsifier is chosen from cationic surfactant, anionic surfactant, nonionic surfactant and zwitterionic surfactant.    USE - Recycled polymer modified additive for asphalt concrete (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The recycled polymer modified additive is economically manufactured without affecting environment.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the following:    (1) recycled polymer modified additive; and    (2) asphalt concrete. A specialty additive is add-mixed with the RPET particles to form a homogenous blend of RPET carrier and specialty additive.    USE - For preparing value-added recycled polyethylene terephthalate polymer blend component, used for manufacturing flower pots and fence posts, and for manufacture of new products. The polymer blend material is mixed with additional polymeric material to form plastic containers.    ADVANTAGE - Since recycled polyethylene terephthalate is incorporated in a virgin polymer blend at a minimum level of about 10%, the polymer blend provides a much better additive-to-virgin polymer blend ratio in an injection molding operation, thereby providing a more homogenous dispersion of the additive. The blending and dispersion of the additive is inherently improved. The process allows the additive to be dispensed at a higher and more accurately controlled concentration during pellet-forming process, thus providing more consistency to the final blend. The incorporation of the polymer blend component during pellet-forming process also eliminates the need for additive blenders on the injection machine that is used to produce a container perform, thus reducing the complexity of that operation. USE - Manufacture of bulked continuous carpet                filament.    ADVANTAGE - The method manufactures bulked continuous                carpet filament with improved strength of recycled                PET polymer allowing to be run at higher speeds                through spinning machine.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) manufacturing carpet filament from clear                and colored recycled PET bottles which involves (A)                providing recycled PET bottles; (B) grinding                recycled PET bottles into a group of polymer                flakes, where the group of polymer flakes consists                of less than or equal to 10 wt.% colored polymer                flakes and balance clear polymer flakes; (C)                washing the group of polymer flakes; (D) providing                a color additive; (E) mixing the color additive                with group of polymer flakes to form a color                additive-polymer mixture comprising less than or                equal to 3 wt.% color additive; (F) melting the                color additive-polymer mixture to produce a polymer                melt; (G) providing an extruder that extrudes                material in different extrusion streams; (H)                reducing a pressure within extruder to 0-12                millibars; (I) passing the polymer melt through the                extruder so that the polymer melt is divided into                extrusion streams, each having a pressure of 0-12                millibars; (J) after passing the polymer melt                through the extruder, filtering the polymer melt                through greater than or equal to 1 filter; and (K)                after passing the polymer melt through the filter,                forming the polymer melt into bulked continuous                carpet filament; and    (2) manufacturing bulked continuous carpet                filament which involves (A) providing an extrusion                system that comprises (i) 1st extruder, (ii) 2nd                extruder, (iii) 3rd extruder, (iv) 4th extruder and                (v) pressure regulation system that maintains a                pressure within 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th extruders to                1-18 millibars; (B) using the pressure regulation                system to reduce a pressure within 1st, 2nd, 3rd,                and 4th extruders to 0-18 millibars; (C) while                maintaining the pressure within 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and                4th extruders to 1-18 millibars, passing a polymer                melt through the extrusion system so that (1) a 1st                portion of the melt passes through 1st extruder,                (2) a 2nd portion of melt passes through the 2nd                extruder, (3) a 3rd portion of melt passes through                3rd extruder, and (4) a 4th portion of melt passes                through 4th extruder, where the polymer melt                comprises 7-9 wt.% colored recycled PET, 2-3 wt.%                color additive and balance recycled clear PET; and                (D) forming the polymer melt into bulked continuous                carpet filament.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a cross-sectional view of                the exemplary multiple rotating screw (MRS) section                of the MRS extruder. The blend component comprises RPET carrier and a specialty additive.    USE - For preparing RPET polymer blend component for use in manufacturing new products e.g. plastic containers.    ADVANTAGE - The inventive method utilizes additive that enhances the processing or properties of ultimately produced plastic containers. It allows the additive to be dispensed at a higher or more accurately controlled concentration in the pelletizing operation, thus the blending and dispersion of the additive is inherently improved. It allows the additive to be dispensed at a higher and more accurately controlled concentration in the pelletizing operation, thus providing more consistency to the final blend. An incorporation of the inventive polymer blend component into conventional recycled polyethylene terephthalate extrusion systems insures a thorough, homogenous mixing of the specialty additive.  ONO T	IDEMITSU KOSAN CO LTD (IDEK-C)	2020172866	   NOVELTY - An additive has dynamic viscosity of 10-120 mm2/second at 100 degrees C, aniline point of (-20)-(3) degrees C, aromatic carbon content (%Ca) of 50-68% by ring analysis (n-d-M method), and pour point of (-10)-(25) degrees C.    USE - Additive used for recycling deteriorated asphalt for manufacturing recycled asphalt compound material (claimed) for constructing asphalt pavement.    ADVANTAGE - The additive has excellent regeneration effect of the deterioration-modified asphalt derived from the modified asphalt containing large amount of the modifying material such as the H-type polymer-modified asphalt, and is easy to ensure the safety at the time of handling.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for manufacture of recycled asphalt compound material, which involves mixing the additive with an asphalt waste material. The vitrimer-based monomer comprises a first unit rendering a high chain stiffness upon polymerization of the monomer, and a second unit comprising a photopolymerizable unit for photopolymerization of the monomer under a UV irradiation.    USE - The polymer is useful for additive manufacturing technology, preferably high performance and recyclable thermoset ink for 3-dimentinal or 4-dimentinal printing.    ADVANTAGE - The polymer: has high strength, stiffness, recovery stress energy storage, and reasonable recycling efficiency; and is printable using stereolithrography with high resolution. USE - Method of recycling additively manufactured material into reusable thermoplastic polymer used for forming pellets, sheets and films.    ADVANTAGE - The polymer can be efficiently recovered by recycling of additively manufactured material.  EP3094675-B1;  KR2348393-B1	Recovery of support materials used in additive            manufacturing process, involves forming solution of            water soluble support polymer and water by exposing            article, precipitating water soluble support polymer,            and removing remaining water	ALLEN S;  BAYER R;  DERMODY D L;  LEUGERS M A;  MATTEUCCI S T;  MOGLIA R S;  PYZIK A J;  LOEGES M A	DOW GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES LLC (DOWC-C);  DOW GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES INC (DOWC-C);  DOW GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES LLC (DOWC-C);  DOW GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES LLC (DOWC-C);  DOW GLOBAL TECHNOLOGIES LLC (DOWC-C)	2015421847	   NOVELTY - Recovery of support materials involves                providing precursor additive manufactured article                containing water soluble support polymer and                insoluble material, exposing the precursor additive                manufactured article to water such that the water                soluble support polymer is dissolved in the water                to form aqueous solution of the water soluble                support polymer and water, removing the final                additive manufactured article from the aqueous                solution, precipitating the water soluble support                polymer from the aqueous solution, and removing                remaining water.    USE - Recovery of support materials used in additive                manufacturing process used for producing                thermoplastic polymers used as water soluble                release layer for underlying support                structure.    ADVANTAGE - The method enables easy recovery of support                materials, and recycling of aqueous solution                containing salt.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Recovery of support materials involves                providing precursor additive manufactured article                containing water soluble support polymer and                insoluble material, exposing the precursor additive                manufactured article to water such that the water                soluble support polymer is dissolved in the water                to form aqueous solution of the water soluble                support polymer and water and finished additive                manufactured article, removing the final additive                manufactured article from the aqueous solution,                precipitating the water soluble support polymer                from the aqueous solution to form precipitate of                the water soluble support polymer, separating the                precipitate from the water, and removing water                remaining from the precipitate of the water soluble                support polymer. USE - A toy building element.    ADVANTAGE - The toy building elements can be manufactured by processing a resin comprising recycled ABS polymers. The addition of mechanically recycled ABS to virgin ABS in the molding process provides an increase in the relative Charpy v-notch value, thus, dispersion of polybutadiene spheres is improved when recycled ABS material is mixed with virgin ABS.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for manufacturing a toy building element which involves (a) providing and screening an ABS waste material, (b) recovering recycled ABS polymers from the screened ABS waste material by subjecting the ABS waste material of step (a) to grinding and/or a solvent dissolution recycling process, (c) obtaining a resin by mixing the recovered ABS polymers of step (b) with greater than or equal to 1 additive(s) and optionally greater than or equal to 1 ABS polymers selected from virgin ABS polymers, chemically recycled ABS polymers recovered from pyrolysis and chemically recycled ABS polymers recovered from chemical depolymerization, and (d) manufacturing the toy building element by processing the resin of step (c).    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a perspective view of the traditional box-shaped building brick.  WO2013028707-A3;  EP2748260-A2;  CN103987783-A;  US8889781-B2;  CN103987783-B;  EP2748260-A4;  EP2748260-B1	Thermoplastic composition useful for manufacturing molded articles, comprises a recycled thermoplastic, polymer toughener, reinforcing agent, virgin polyamide 66 and/or post industrial polyamide 66, and additives	LIMA A F;  WOOD B A	DU PONT DE NEMOURS&CO E I (DUPO-C);  DU PONT DE NEMOURS&CO E I (DUPO-C);  DU PONT DE NEMOURS & CO E I (DUPO-C);  DU PONT DE NEMOURS & CO E I (DUPO-C);  DU PONT DE NEMOURS & CO E I (DUPO-C)	2013C73650	   NOVELTY - A thermoplastic composition comprises: (a) 20-80 wt.% of a recycled thermoplastic comprising polyamide resin, polypropylene and mineral filler, where the recycled thermoplastic comprises at least 60 wt.% content of recycled polyamide; (b) 5-20 wt.% of polymer toughener; (c) 10-50 wt.% reinforcing agent; (d) 0-40 wt.% of virgin polyamide 66 and/or Post Industrial polyamide 66; and (e) 0-10 wt.% of additives selected from mold release, flow enhancers, thermal stabilizers, antistatic agents, blowing agents, lubricants, plasticizers, and colorant and pigments.    USE - The thermoplastic composition is useful for manufacturing molded articles.    ADVANTAGE - The thermoplastic composition cost-effectively manufactures a variety of molded thermoplastic parts.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A thermoplastic composition comprises: (a) 20-80 wt.% of a recycled thermoplastic comprising polyamide resin, polypropylene and mineral filler, where the recycled thermoplastic comprises at least 60 wt.% content of recycled polyamide selected from polyamide 66, polyamide 6, blends of polyamide 66 and polyamide 6, and copolymers having repeat units of polyamide 66 and polyamide 6; and at least 1 wt.% content of polyolefin, and where the recycled polyamide content is equal to the per cent nitrogen content as compared to the nitrogen content of a pure polyamide 66 standard, the nitrogen content being determined by a Nitrogen Combustion Analysis Determination Method; and the polyolefin content is as determined by subtraction of the polyamide content and mineral filler content, as determined from Nitrogen combustion analysis and Ash Analysis, respectively, from the total weight of recycled thermoplastic; (b) 5-20 wt.% of polymer toughener, where the polymer toughener consists essentially of at least 50-85 wt.% non-functionalized rubber and 15-50 wt.% of a functionalized rubber; (c) 10-50 reinforcing agent having a minimum aspect ratio of 3; (d) 0-40 wt.% of virgin polyamide 66 and/or Post Industrial polyamide 66; and (e) 0-10 wt.% of additives selected from mold release, flow enhancers, thermal stabilizers, antistatic agents, blowing agents, lubricants, plasticizers, and colorant and pigments; where the weight percents of (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e) are based on the total weight of the thermoplastic resin composition. "Reactive compatibilization of polypropylene and nylon", Polymer Plastics Technology and Engineering, Vol. 34, No. 4, 1995, pages 551-560	2053-0-0-0 ; 1145-0-0-0 ; 1013-0-0-0 			R00776 ; R00964 ; R00326 		KR2015084208-A;  KR1566265-B1	Modified asphalt concrete composition used for e.g. road pavement, comprises recycled aggregate, asphalt, polymer modifier and modified additive comprising surfactant, wax and vegetable oil, with respect to waste asphalt concrete	AHN J K	DAELIM ASCON CO LTD (DAEL-Non-standard)	201543407L	   NOVELTY - A modified asphalt concrete composition comprises 100-150 pts. wt. recycled aggregate, 10-20 pts. wt. asphalt, 10-20 pts. wt. polymer modifier and 2-10 pts. wt. modified additive with respect to 100 pts. wt. waste asphalt concrete. The modified additive comprises surfactant, wax and vegetable oil in weight ratio of 1:1:1.    USE - Modified asphalt concrete composition is used for road pavement and construction of water pipe.    ADVANTAGE - The product formed using the modified asphalt concrete composition has excellent durability, chemical resistance, abrasion resistance and UV stability.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for manufacture of modified asphalt concrete composition. Patent KR2015084208	KR003990    13 Jan 2014					368-0-0-0 ; 129411-0-0-0 ; 7200-0-0-0 ; 363-0-0-0 ; 79-0-0-0 ; 51-0-0-0 			R00708 ; R00806 ; R00479 ; R01725 ; R00610 ; R01020 		KR2008009335-A	Cold mix asphalt paving concrete composition for road pavement, has recycled additives having specific number of carbon atoms and specific pour point value for restoring viscosity	KIM H R	KIM H R (KIMH-Individual)	2008K86307	   NOVELTY - The composition has recycled additives having 15-40 carbon atoms, 7-96 Centistokes kinematics viscosity at 40 degree Celsius. A pour point of -15 to -40 degree Celsius is used as the recycled additives to restore viscosity. A synthetic polymeric modifier is manufactured using irregular copolymers of 10-75 weight percent butadiene polymer and 10-25 weight percent styrene polymer.    USE - Cold mix asphalt paving concrete composition for a road pavement.    ADVANTAGE - The composition restores viscosity, thus improving the pavement strength and preventing plastic deformation and formation of fatigue cracks. The utilization of the recycled additives and modifier improves the properties of crushed waste asphalt concrete, the constellation reconstitution and property of the used asphalt concrete and provides excellent package intensity. The used asphalt concrete can be recycled and the environmental contamination due to wastage can be prevented. 			A93 (Roads, building, construction flooring.);  Q41 (Road, rail, bridge construction (E01))	A11-C03;  A12-H;  A12-R;  A12-R09	E01C-019/00;  E01C-019/08	KR2008009335-A   28 Jan 2008   E01C-019/08   200864Pages: 5   	KR2008009335-A    KR001981    08 Jan 2008		KR001981    08 Jan 2008					368-0-0-0 ; 129411-0-0-0 			R00708 ; R00806 		US2003195278-A1;  WO2003087477-A1;  AU2003226038-A1;  US6844418-B2	Manufacture of polymer additive useful for improving properties of asphalt, comprises providing solid polymer feedstock comprising polypropylene, and thermally treating feedstock with inert gas purge, which is oxygen free	FORGAC J M;  MUZUMDAR A S;  SINGHANIA A K;  SWANSON A J	FORGAC J M (FORG-Individual);  MUZUMDAR A S (MUZU-Individual);  SINGHANIA A K (SING-Individual);  SWANSON A J (SWAN-Individual);  BP CORP NORTH AMERICA INC (BRPE-C);  BP CORP NORTH AMERICA INC (BRPE-C);  BP CORP NORTH AMERICA INC (BRPE-C)	2004032324	   NOVELTY - Manufacture of a polymer additive useful for improving the properties of an asphalt, comprises: (i) providing a predominantly solid polymer feedstock comprising at least5 wt.% polypropylene having a molecular weight of 1000-50000; and (ii) thermally treating the polymer feedstock in the presence of inert gas purge, which is oxygen free, at a pressure of 0.1-45 atmospheres and at 250-600degreesC for 1 minute to 48 hours.    USE - The method is for manufacture of a polymer additive useful for improving the properties of an asphalt (claimed), derived from at least one product of petroleum refining.    ADVANTAGE - The method provides an improved polymer additive which may be used to increase the high temperature viscosity of an asphalt, without deleteriously affecting the low-temperature viscosity of the asphalt. The polymer additive may also be used to improved the stiffness of certain asphalts. The polymer additive is produced from readily available polymer blends by thermal process. The invention also provides an environmentally acceptable method for recycle of post consumer carpet and bottles.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for an asphalt composition, useful for paving roads and sealing roofs, comprising asphalt and the polymer additive. The technical means related to the product is characterized in that the eco-friendly plastic product includes a load-bearing solid body, provided therein with wasted polarizer powders, recycled polymer granules retrieved and initially manufactured by a recycling system, and compatibility agent. The technical means related to the manufacturing method is characterized in comprising: applying a recycling operation to the wasted polarizers and using the recycled wasted polarizers as a major additive, next applying a grinding operation to the major additive to obtain wasted polarizer powders, then uniformly mixing and stirring the wasted polarizer powders with the recycled polymer granules and the compatibility agent to obtain a preparation material, and finally putting the preparation material into a plastic forming machine to proceed with the formation processing and the operation of outputting the load-bearing solid body, so as to manufacture eco-friendly plastic products. USE - The method is useful for manufacturing recycled synthetic wood.    ADVANTAGE - The method: reduces the social cost of the treatment of the coffee leaf, can have a new use as a recycled product, not as a waste, because the synthetic wood is manufactured using coffee leaf, sterilizing and storing the coffee leaf to reduce mold generated in the coffee leaf, reduces the cost required for recycling the coffee leaf, and it can be used as a synthetic wood by recycling the coffee leaf. The reducible colorant is water-insoluble in its non-reduced state but water-soluble in its reduced state. The inert liquid carrier is compatible with the thermoplastic molding composition.    USE - The additive composition is used for thermoplastic molding composition for manufacture of a molded article, e.g. bottle, preferably beverage bottle by admixing with the thermoplastic molding composition a reducible colorant material to form a colored thermoplastic molding composition; heating the colored thermoplastic molding composition; and molding the hot colored thermoplastic molding composition to form a molded article (claimed). The beverage bottles are used for carbonated soft drinks, carbonated water or beer.    ADVANTAGE - The invented polymer colorant additive composition exhibits good gas barrier properties and provides protection for the contents against ultra-violet light and has good recycling potential.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for a process for recycling a thermoplastic molded article comprising providing a thermoplastic molded article incorporating as colorant, a water-insoluble reducible colorant; subjecting the material of the molded article to reducing conditions to reduce the water-insoluble reducible color; contacting the reduced colorant with an aqueous medium to provide an aqueous solution containing reduced colorant and a colorant-depleted material of the molded article; and recovering the colorant-depleted material of the molded article for further recycling steps. providing a functional filler (F1) containing inorganic particulate, and coating having first compound including a terminating propanoic group or ethylenic group with at least two adjacent carbonyl groups; and combining the waste polymer and the functional filler to form a recycled polymer.    USE - For recycling polymer waste material such as post-consumer polymer waste material, useful for manufacturing article such as pipe or tubing (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The use of functional filler maintains and improves at least one unnotched Charpy impact property or at least one tensile property of a polymer composition, e.g. recycled polymer composition, optionally comprising at least two types of polymer composition, compared to the same polymer composition or recycled polymer composition which does not comprise both of the first and second compounds of the functional filler. The functional filler improves notched Charpy impact property of a molded component formed from the polymer composition. The use of functional filler does not ameliorate, reduce or prevent post-molding shrinkage of the molded component comprising injection molded components such as pipe or tubing.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the following:    (1) a functional filler (F2) comprising: inorganic particulate; and coating on the surface of the inorganic particulate, where the coating contains first compound including a terminating propanoic group or ethylenic group with one or two adjacent carbonyl groups, and second compound selected from fatty acids and/or their salts;    (2) use of the functional filler in a recycled polymer composition derived from at least one waste polymer, where the polymer is cleaned, e.g. solvent-free dry cleaned, by the process, where the waste polymer comprises mixture of at least two different polymer types;    (3) a polymer composition comprising: at least one polymer; and the functional filler (F1), with the provision that when at least one polymer is not recycled from polymer waste by the process (P1)/(P2), the coating additionally contains second compound selected from at least one fatty acid and/or salts of a fatty acid;    (4) a recycled polymer composition (C1), obtainable by the process (P1)/(P2); and    (5) an article of manufacture formed from either the polymer composition (C1); or the polymer composition, and the functional filler, and optionally a peroxide-containing additive, e.g. di-cumyl peroxide or 1,1-di(tert-butylperoxy)-3,3,5-trimethylcyclohexane, where the peroxide-containing additive is present in the coating. 			A35 (Other processing and general - including vulcanisation, welding of plastics and adhesive processes. 104471-0-0-0 K M; 104401-0-0-0 K M; 2021-0-0-0 K M; 1013-0-0-0 ; 1145-0-0-0 ; 15340-0-0-0 ; 129593-0-0-0 	115015701 K M; 115015702 K M		R01278 K M; R05243 K M; RA009X K M; RA009Z K M; R00122 K M; R04758 K M; R00326 ; R00964 ; R00476 ; R05050 	1278-S; 0122-S	WO2020055609-A1;  US2021245401-A1;  US11135744-B2;  US2021394399-A1	Recycling of additively manufactured article e.g. dental model, involves comminuting preformed article or recovered coating material into reactive particulate material by grinding such as cryo-milling, shredding and molding into new shape	POELMA J;  ROLLAND J P;  CURVERS R H N;  DESIMONE J M	CARBON INC (CARB-Non-standard);  CARBON INC (CARB-Non-standard)	202021924B	   NOVELTY - Recycling of additively manufactured articles involves providing a preformed article, or recovered coating material and comminuting preformed article or recovered coating material into a reactive particulate material by grinding such as cryo-milling, shredding, chopping, or pelletizing, and/or melt-pressing into a new shape. The article or coating material is produced by the process of light polymerizing a single-cure resin in an additive manufacturing (or coating) process. The resin comprises a reactive blocked prepolymer, optionally polymerized reactive blocking agents, optionally reactive blocking agent, a photoinitiator, optionally a reactive diluent, optionally a light absorber, optionally a solvent, optionally a radical polymerization inhibitor, optionally pigments and/or dyes, and optionally at least one filler. The preformed article or recovered coating material comprises at least 70 wt.%, 80 wt.% or 90 wt.% crosslinked polymer comprising comprises reactive blocked prepolymer.    USE - Recycling of additively manufactured articles such as dental models or recovered coating material into a regenerated resin for additive manufacturing.    ADVANTAGE - The method enables the effective recycling of additively manufactured articles.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Recycling of additively manufactured articles involves providing a preformed article, or recovered coating material and comminuting preformed article or recovered coating material into a reactive particulate material by grinding such as cryo-milling, shredding, chopping, or pelletizing, and/or melt-pressing into a new shape. The article or coating material is produced by the process of light polymerizing a single-cure resin in an additive manufacturing (or coating) process. The resin comprises a reactive blocked prepolymer, optionally polymerized reactive blocking agents, optionally reactive blocking agent, a photoinitiator, optionally a reactive diluent, optionally a light absorber, optionally a solvent, optionally a radical polymerization inhibitor, optionally pigments and/or dyes, and optionally at least one filler. The preformed article or recovered coating material comprises at least 70 wt.%, 80 wt.% or 90 wt.% crosslinked polymer. The crosslinked polymer comprises reactive blocked prepolymer. The reactive diluent and polymerized reactive blocking agents are included in light polymerized, crosslinked, and thermoset form. INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the following:    (1) light polymerizable resin;    (2) recyclable light-polymerizable resin; and    (3) manufacture of recyclable article. USE - The polymer composition is used in articles                (claimed), preferably for manufacturing products                for long-term use, such as boxes, trays, paint                pails or consumer goods, and for manufacturing in                the automotive industry, especially under the                bonnet applications.    ADVANTAGE - The polymer composition has increased melt                flow rate, reduced need for peroxides, increased                impact strength and stiffness relative to other                recycled PP and talc compositions.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the                following:    (1) a process of producing the polymer                composition, comprising (a) treating a mixed                polyolefin recyclate fraction with water without                added thermal energy, (b) treating the solution                obtained mixed polyolefin recyclate fraction from                step (a) in a washing step with an alkaline medium                at a temperature of at least 60 degrees C, (c)                sorting of the mixed polyolefin recyclate fraction                solution obtained from step (b) obtaining a mixed                polypropylene recyclate fraction, carrying out                steps (a) and (b) in the reverse order, (d)                treating the mixed PP recyclate fraction solution                obtained from the above steps at a temperature of                50-155 degrees C for at least 60 minutes, and (e)                adding the dried mixed PP recyclate fraction                obtained from step (d) to an extruder with the                addition of talc and additives, where the mix is                processed to obtain a recycled polypropylene and                talc material, and the step (e) is conducted at                200-250 degrees C, preferably 220-230 degrees C for                1-10 minutes; and    (2) articles comprising the polymer                composition, which are preferably formed by                injection molding.  LI Z;  SUN Y	UNIV DONGHUA (UYDG-C)	2008N85105	   NOVELTY - A manufacturing device of continuous electrostatic spun nanofiber felt has a dissolving kettle (1), a filter (2), a storage barrel (3), a metering pump (4), uniform distributor (5), a metal roller (7), aluminum-made sieve (11), a fiber receiving net (12), a winding drum (8), unwinding drum (9) and spinning solution recycling tank (10).    USE - Device is used for manufacturing electrostatic spun nanofiber felt.    ADVANTAGE - The device enables manufacture of electrostatic spun nanofiber felt with high productive efficiency.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A manufacturing device of continuous electrostatic spun nanofiber felt has a dissolving kettle (1), a filter (2), a storage barrel (3), a metering pump (4), uniform distributor (5), a metal roller (7), aluminum-made sieve (11), a fiber receiving net (12), a winding drum (8), unwinding drum (9) and spinning solution recycling tank (10). The felt is manufactured using a polymer spinning solution containing polymer, solvent and additive. The polymer is polyvinyl alcohol, polyethylene oxide, polyester, polycarbonate, polyurethane, polyacrylonitrile or polypropylene acid macromolecule. The additive is sodium chloride, lithium chloride or citric acid. The solvent is water, chloroform, dimethyl acetamide, dimethyl formamide or phenol. USE - Manufacture of ether compound used for preparing polymer used as silica scale-inhibiting agent. The material is exposed to a non-reacting gas, and a partially saturated gas exposed polymeric material is formed. The exposed material is decompressed, separated, foamed, and trimmed to produce finished foamed polymeric material and a scrap foamed polymer.    USE - For closed-loop manufacturing of foamed polymeric material from recycled materials, or foamed semi-crystalline polymeric products (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The method enables the optical formation of integral unfoamed skins of controllable depth and crystallinity on foamed polymeric material, suitable for applications. The method does not alter the chemistry of scrap material, and reuses the materials without using additives to form new foamed polymeric material.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The raw polymeric material containing 5-100% recycled pre-consumer polymer, recycled post-consumer polymer and scrap solid foamed polymer is interleaved with a gas-channeling unit. The interleaved material is exposed to a non-reacting gas soluble in the polymer at elevated pressure for a preset time so that the polymer contains a desired amount of gas, and a partially saturated gas exposed polymeric material is formed. The exposed polymeric material is decompressed, and separated from gas channeling unit. The exposed material is foamed at a temperature below the melt temperature of the polymeric material. The foamed material is trimmed to produce finished foamed polymeric material and a scrap foamed polymer.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The figure shows the flowchart for closed loop production of foamed polymer material.  See also references of WO 2004104072A2WO2004104072-A3  See also references of EP 1636008A4EP1636008-A4  See also references of WO 2004104072A2						KR2184015-B1	Manufacturing thermoforming tray, comprises e.g. forming extruded sheet by adhering surface layers to both surfaces of main layer, and thermoforming extruded sheet into predetermined shape to prepare thermoforming tray	KWON K;  SHIN J Y;  BYUN H	WOOJIN PLACOM CO INC (WOOJ-Non-standard)	2020B9244V	   NOVELTY - Manufacturing thermoforming tray, comprises (a) extruding the main layer-forming material contained in the first extruder to form a main layer containing recycled polypropylene for blocking oxygen, (b) forming a surface layer by extruding the surface layer-forming material contained in the second extruder, (c) forming an extruded sheet by adhering the surface layers to both surfaces of the main layer, and (d) thermoforming the extruded sheet into a predetermined shape to prepare a thermoforming tray. The thermoformed tray has a multilayer structure containing recycled polypropylene for blocking oxygen. The main layer-forming material includes a polymer resin composition, a recycled polypropylene sheet for blocking oxygen, a polyolefin resin, calcium carbonate, and a first additive. The surface layer forming material includes a polyolefin resin, calcium carbonate and a second additive. The first additive is moisture absorbent.    USE - The method is useful for manufacturing thermoforming tray.    ADVANTAGE - The thermoforming tray significantly reduces amount of carbon emissions to atmosphere, increases the consumer's desire to purchase by delivering the advanced sensibility of the thermoforming tray to the consumer, and reduces the amount of use of polyolefin resin and the generation of waste plastic by manufacturing a product using multilayer scrap containing an oxygen blocking agent.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Manufacturing thermoforming tray, comprises (a) extruding the main layer-forming material contained in the first extruder to form a main layer containing recycled polypropylene for blocking oxygen, (b) forming a surface layer by extruding the surface layer-forming material contained in the second extruder, (c) forming an extruded sheet by adhering the surface layers to both surfaces of the main layer, and (d) thermoforming the extruded sheet into a predetermined shape to prepare a thermoforming tray. The thermoformed tray has a multilayer structure containing recycled polypropylene for blocking oxygen. The main layer-forming material includes a polymer resin composition, a recycled polypropylene sheet for blocking oxygen, a polyolefin resin, calcium carbonate, and a first additive. The surface layer forming material includes a polyolefin resin, calcium carbonate and a second additive. The first additive is moisture absorbent. The second additive is antioxidant, UV stabilizer, heat resistance enhancer, calcium carbonate, dispersant, or moisture absorbent. The surface layers adhered to both surfaces of the main layer is not roll touched, so the surface layer is matte. The thermoforming is performed at 175-184 degrees C. The oxygen blocking recycled polypropylene sheet is recycled and used after manufacturing the packaging tray using polypropylene sheets for oxygen blocking, in which polypropylene is adhered to both sides of a sheet made of ethylene vinyl alcohol. The moisture absorbent included as the first additive to prevent reaction hydroxy group of the ethylene vinyl alcohol and moisture in the air through the cut surface of the cut scrap. Gel generated during molding                with general polyolefin-based polymer resin.                Polymer for extrusion sheet molding containing less                than or equal to 5 wt.% gel-free agent containing                an acid neutralizer and metal hydroxide, less than                or equal to 5 wt.% deodorant, and greater than or                equal to 5 wt.% other additives such as dyes and                inorganic substances to reduce sagging and odor                generation and molding defects. The composition                further comprises an additive for lowering melt                index, which is increased by inclusion of                polyolefin-based waste plastic, to 0.5 to 5 (g/10                minutes).    USE - The composition is useful for extrusion sheet                molding.    ADVANTAGE - The composition uses multi-layer waste plastic                material which is difficult to recycle is applied                to the production of extruded sheet products to                replace or recycle polyolefin resin, greatly                reduces the amount of carbon emission in the                atmosphere, is environmentally friendly, can be                applied to the manufacture of various plastic                products by producing various extruded sheets using                multi-layered sheet scrap treated as waste                plastics, dramatically lowers the production cost                of products through recycling of resources, and has                very economical advantage. USE - Recycling used vulcanized rubber products for vulcanizable material composition for manufacturing tire or other rubber product (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - Vulcanization can be chemically cleaved when the rubber grind is exposed to a shear force determined in the presence of a weak base and a polymer additive. The method reduces environmental impact of used tires and/or other rubber products while reducing the demand for fresh raw materials for rubber industry.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) vulcanizable material composition comprising rubber and/or synthetic rubber, and optionally greater than or equal to 1 rubber industry additives in which compound mixture is obtained by the recycling process; and    (2) preparing tire or other rubber product which involves vulcanizing a mixture of substances. AN 2010-E77459, XP002785882,relevantClaims[12,13|1-11|14,15],relevantPassages[&lt;pp&gt;A&lt;/pp&gt;];  DATABASE WPI Week 201643, Derwent World Patents Index; AN 2016-098843, XP002785883,relevantClaims[1-14],relevantPassages[&lt;pp&gt;A&lt;/pp&gt;];  "Rubber Industry Manual", vol. I, TAURUS OMIKK, pages: 394 - 411EP3743465-B1  Rubber Industry Manual, Volume I, Editor-in-Chief, Dr. Laszlo Bartha, Taurus Omikk, Budapest, 5.8, p. 394 to 411	129411-0-0-0 ; 368-0-0-0 ; 89837-0-0-0 ; 99998-0-0-0 ; 107324-0-0-0 			R00806 ; R00708 ; R01502 ; R01509 ; R01287 		WO2011019811-A1;  CA2768219-A1;  EP2464786-A1;  US2012152476-A1;  US8980059-B2;  US2015299958-A1;  CA2768219-C;  US9605383-B2;  EP2464786-A4	System, useful to make paper and paper product            involving virgin pulp fibers and recycled fibers,            comprises population of cellulose fibers dispersed in            aqueous solution and complexed with activator, and            tether-bearing particulate additive	JOGIKALMATH G;  KINCAID P D;  REIS L;  SOANE D;  KINCAID P;  SOANE D S;  BELL L D	NANOPAPER LLC (NANO-Non-standard);  NANOPAPER LLC (NANO-Non-standard);  NANOPAPER LLC (NANO-Non-standard);  JOGIKALMATH G (JOGI-Individual);  KINCAID P D (KINC-Individual);  REIS L (REIS-Individual);  SOANE D S (SOAN-Individual)	2011B76514	   NOVELTY - System comprises: a population of cellulose                fibers dispersed in an aqueous solution and                complexed with an activator; and a tether-bearing                particulate additive, where the addition of the                tether-bearing particulate additive attaches the                additive to the population of cellulose fibers by                the interaction of the activator and the                tether.    USE - The system is useful for paper making and                paper products (all claimed) involving virgin pulp                fibers and recycled fibers.    ADVANTAGE - The system: provides paper products with                increased strength and hydrophobicity; reduces the                water retention in the paper web and thus leads to                efficient drainage; and eliminates the requirement                for cooking the starch before using it, thus                eliminates the gelatinizing step, and decreasing                energy utilization.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included                for:    (1) manufacturing a paper product, comprising:                activating a population of cellulose fibers in a                liquid medium with an activator; preparing a                tether-bearing particulate additive, where the                tether-bearing particulate additive comprises a                tether capable of interacting with the activator;                and adding the tether-bearing particulate additive                to the activated population of cellulose fibers,                thus attaching the additive to the fibers by the                interaction of the activator and the tether;    (2) increasing the strength of a paper product                formed from a pulp slurry containing cellulose                fibers, comprising: adding an activator polymer to                the pulp slurry; forming complexes between the                activator polymer and the cellulose fibers;                preparing tether-bearing starch granules, where the                tether-bearing starch granules comprise a tether                polymer capable of interacting with the activator                polymer; and adding the tether-bearing starch                granules to the pulp slurry, where the starch                granules are attached to the cellulose fibers by                the interaction of the activator polymer and the                tether polymer, thus increasing the strength of the                paper product;    (3) a paper product formed by the above                methods; and    (4) a paper product comprising starch                granules, where the starch granules are attached to                cellulose fibers of the paper product by                interaction between activator polymer and tether                polymer, and the activator polymer is attached to                the cellulose fibers and the tether polymer is                attached to the starch granules. USE - Used in paper mills to reduce calcium                hardness.    ADVANTAGE - The environmental pollution from discharging                wastewater is reduced, water of paper mill is                saved, and the outflow of various additives and                fiber as raw material for paper making is prevented                thus saving energy in the processing. Improves the                dehydration property and the efficiency of polymer                additives in paper manufacture by removing fine                fractions in removal process of calcium                carbonate.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Controlling calcium hardness in                paper-processing water comprises adding sodium                carbonate or sodium hydrogen carbonate to                short-circulated white water and removing the                calcium carbonate precipitate from the paper                processing water. USE - The yarn is useful for relieving fatigue.    ADVANTAGE - The yarn has three-dimensional fabric, excellent elasticity, and durability; is comfortable and hygienic; and improves ride comfort, cushioning, and wrinkles of leather sheet; extends service life of fiber sheet. The method improves productivity, is economical and simple, saves raw materials and resources by recycling discarded polymer raw material, contributes in development of textile industry and demand generation by fusing product of automobile and textile sector, produces yarn with excellent quality and physical properties including reduced flammability and strain, abrasion resistance, compression strength, increased strength, light resistance, and shrinkability.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Manufacturing antimicrobial yarn, comprises (a) producing base polymer material by mixing (S1) 90-99 wt.% polybutylene terephthalate and 1-10 wt.% elastomer, and preparing antimicrobial additive by mixing 85-99 wt.% polyester and 1-15 wt.% silver powder, (b) introducing the raw material and antimicrobial additive mixture mixed in 90:10-99:1 ratio into an extruder, and manufacturing antimicrobial yarn by performing extrusion molding (S2) at greater than or equal to 200 degrees C, (c) cooling the obtained antimicrobial yarn, introducing the cooled yarn into a stretching tank, and stretching (S4) by increasing the temperature to greater than or equal to 80 degrees C, and (d) heat treating the yarn at 120-200 degrees C. An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for antimicrobial yarn prepared by the above method. The rescue asphalt soluble synthetic polymer emulsion asphalt binder comprises 25-49.9 wt.% straight asphalt, 5-20 wt.% resin, 5-10 wt.% solubilizer, 0.1-5 wt.% emulsifier and residual amount of water and 5 pts. wt. a functional additive. The functional additive includes 100 pts. wt. tetrachlorogold(III) acid, 5 pts. wt. manganese dioxide, 3 pts. wt. silica gel, 10 pts. wt. pozzolan, 3 pts. wt. surfactant, 1 pts. wt. bentonite, 40 pts. wt. hydroxyethyl acrylate and 3 pts. wt. ethylenediaminetetraacetate.    USE - The composition is useful for recycling rescue asphalt in aggregate generated from waste asphalt and as a permanent refining agent to re-dissolved or resistant to moisture due to improved binding to rescue asphalt.    ADVANTAGE - The composition allows polymer to adhere after easily dissolving the rescue asphalt contained in the waste asphalt aggregate, overcomes the difference in properties with the heated asphalt mixture, recycles asphalt aggregate at room temperature, thus saves energy cost, and is environmentally friendly by blocking the generation of asphalt fumes generated in the manufacturing process, and can be used on the wet surface made of aqueous system for repairing port holes, etc. generated during rain. USE - Used as a mixture of mineral-asphalt.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Mixture of mineral-asphalt comprises: mineral aggregate comprising gritty fractions, sand and filler to form a blend of mineral with a specific particle size, where the mineral aggregate is present at 92-94 wt/wt.%; asphalt modified polymer with a fine rubber e.g. 45/80-55 chloroprene having 6-8 wt/wt.% binder; polymer-fibrous-fiber material for stabilizing, strengthening and modifying asphalt mixtures that contains a high-quality fibers e.g. recycled carcass of automobile tires, where the polymer fiber is a polyester having a melting point not less than 200 degrees C, a length of 2-6 mm, and is present at 0.3-0.6 wt/wt.% based on mixture of asphalt; and multifunctional additives e.g. organosilicon compounds, preferably zycotherm as an adhesive that lowers the manufacturing temperature and incorporates mixed asphalt containing 0.05-0.3 wt/wt.% asphalt binder. The additive is made of an antioxidant, thermal stabilizer, ultraviolet stabilizer, antistatic agent, slipping agent or lubricant. Paraffin oil having naphthenes or paraffins is also provided.    USE - Resin composition.    ADVANTAGE - The resin composition improves recycling value by utilizing the spandex waste without any separate processing.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method for manufacturing resin composition, which involves:    (A) removing foreign material from spandex waste;    (B) constructing spandex waste bundle at a temperature of 70 degrees C;    (C) drying the spandex;    (D) mixing thermoplastic polymer and additive in spandex waste bundle;    (E) kneading the mixture at a temperature of 100-180 degrees C for 10-40 minutes;    (F) extruding the resin composition in an extruder at a temperature of 100-200 degrees C; and    (G) pelleting the resin composition.  KOSONEN H;  KINNUNEN A P;  NURMINEN A;  SURIKOWSKI E;  NOURMINEN A	UPM-KYMMENE CORP (UPMK-C);  UPM-KYMMENE CORP (UPMK-C);  UPM-KYMMENE CORP (UPMK-C)	2017867540	   NOVELTY - A filament (FIL1) is formed of composite                material comprising semi-crystalline polylactic                acid and chemical pulp of wood-based cellulose                fibers, where the amount of chemical pulp of                wood-based cellulose fibers has been selected such                that the composite material of the filament (FIL1)                has a complex viscosity ( eta asterisk) of greater                than or equal to 10000 Pa.s when determined at 0.1                Hz frequency and at 180 degrees C, such that upon                additive manufacturing by extrusion, composite melt                formed of the filament (FIL1) has a ratio of shear                storage modulus to shear loss modulus (G'/G'') of                greater than or equal to 1.0 at a temperature                (Tsub) of greater than or equal to 133 degrees                C.    USE - The filament (FIL1) is used in additive                manufacturing by extrusion (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The filament formed of composite material may                comprise chemical pulp of wood-based cellulose                fibers. Chemical pulp of wood based cellulose                fibers contains low amounts of lignin. Bleached                chemical pulp in particular is essentially lignin                free, having high brightness. The chemical pulp                comprises characteristics suitable for improving                the rheological behavior of a composite material                comprising semi-crystalline polylactic acid. The                filament is formed of composite material where the                material components are of non-recycled material.                Each material component may be non-recycled                material, independently of each other. A                non-recycled polymer material in this context                refers to virgin polymer material, such as                polylactic acid and/or polypropylene. A                non-recycled fiber material in this context refers                to freshly manufactured chemical pulp of wood-based                cellulose fibers from a pulp mill. Non-recycled                material typically has higher grade of purity than                recycled material.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) manufacturing a three-dimensional                composite product (PROD1) according to a model with                an additive manufacturing system by obtaining a                model of a composite product on an additive                manufacturing system, the model defining a shape of                a three-dimensional composite product; supplying a                filament (FIL1) defined above comprising                semi-crystalline polylactic acid and chemical pulp                of wood-based cellulose fibers to a heater unit                (HU1) on the additive manufacturing system, such                that a part of the filament (FIL1) at a time is fed                to the heater unit (HU1); heating each part of the                filament (FIL1) fed to the heater unit (HU1) to a                processing temperature (TEXIT) higher than the                melting temperature (Tm) of the semi crystalline                polylactic acid, thus forming portions of composite                melt (MLT1) corresponding to the parts of the                filament (FIL1) fed to the heater unit; dispensing                a portion of the composite melt (MLT1) at a time                from a nozzle (100) having a hole width (W0); and                controlling the dispensing operation such that                portions of the composite melt adhere together on a                platform (PLT0) according to the model, thus                forming the three-dimensional composite product                (PROD1), where the amount of chemical pulp of                wood-based cellulose fibers in the filament has                been selected such that the composite material of                the filament has a complex viscosity eta asterisk                of greater than or equal to 10000 Pa.s when                determined at 0.1 Hz frequency and at 180 degrees C                temperature, such that upon additive manufacturing                by extrusion, composite melt formed of the filament                has a ratio of shear storage modulus to shear loss                modulus G'/G'' of greater than or equal to 1.0 at a                temperature Tsub of greater than or equal to 133                degrees C; and    (2) a product obtainable according to the                method of (1). The functional fabric satisfies the                following test standards: (1) reaching level 4                phenol yellowing test; (2) passing at least 60                hours of QUV (ASTM G154) test, in which the                appearance of the fabric is normal and no cracks;                (3) passing at least four weeks of water                decomposition resistance test, in which the test                conditions are 70C temperature and 95% relative                humidity; and (4) passing at least one                certification of Global Recycle Standard (GRS) and                Recycled Claim Standard (RCS). A sandwich molding is performed to a skin material by making the pulverized powder into a core material.    USE - Recycle method of coated ABS/PA6 polymer-alloy-resin material for bumper of vehicle.    ADVANTAGE - Obtains impact resistance equivalent to a virgin material to a sandwich-shaped object without requiring an impact-resistant improvement additive. Reduces cost since the apparatus and process for peeling and removing coating film become unnecessary.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows the flowchart of the manufacturing method of a bumper. (Drawing includes non-English language text). Testing.);  A13 (Polymers of aromatic mono-olefins; including polystyrene.);  A82 (Coatings, impregnations, polishes - excluding textile finishing.);  A95 (Transport - including vehicle parts, tyres and armaments.);  Q17 (Vehicle construction, fittings, propulsion arrangements (B60J-K, B60R, B60V-W));  X22 (Automotive Electrics)	A04-C03;  A05-F03;  A07-A04E;  A11-A04;  A11-C03A;  A12-T04D;  X22-J11	B29B-017/04	JP2008246779-A   16 Oct 2008   B29B-017/04   200878Pages: 8	JP2008246779-A    JP089499    29 Mar 2007		JP089499    29 Mar 2007					395-0-0-0 ; 129411-0-0-0 ; 368-0-0-0 			R00817 ; R00806 ; R00708 		WO2006053907-A1;  FR2878250-A1;  EP1817366-A1;  CN101061165-A;  EP1817366-B1;  DE602005005852-E;  JP2008520791-W;  ES2303281-T3;  DE602005005852-T2;  US2009203868-A1;  US7759458-B2	Purification of vinyl chloride polymer comprising            compound of heavy metal used for flexible or rigid            articles involves dissolving the polymer in solvent            followed by treating with additive; centrifuging and            separating	FASSIAU E;  LEPERS J;  LANNOY M;  LEPERS J C	SOLVAY SA (SOLV-C);  SOLVAY BELGE SA (SOLV-C);  SOLVAY SA (SOLV-C);  SOLVAY SA (SOLV-C)	2006364075	   NOVELTY - Purification of vinyl chloride polymer (PVC)                comprising at least one compound of a heavy metal                involves: i) dissolving the PVC in a solvent; ii)                treating the resultant solution with at least one                additive that adsorbs or forms complexes with the                compound of the heavy metal; iii) centrifuging the                resultant solution to precipitate the adsorbed or                complexed compound of the heavy metal; and iv)                separating the precipitate from the PVC                solution.    USE - For purification of vinyl chloride polymer                comprising at least one compound of a heavy metal                (claimed) useful in the manufacture of varied                flexible or rigid articles, e.g. tarpaulins, coated                fabrics and other components for the interior of                trim of vehicles, pipes, window frames or                electrical cables processing polymeric                insulation.    ADVANTAGE - The process is carried out continuously or                batchwise and often makes possible to depigment the                PVC to be recycled, thus it has found that carbon                black, pigments and fillers also removed at the                same time as the heavy metal compounds in an                proportional manner. The process can operate in a                closed loop, without generating contaminating                discharges, given that both the solvent, on one                hand, and the adsorbent/chelating agent and the                optional other additives used, on the other hand,                are recycled and reused in the process; and also                can be operate under an inert atmosphere to avoid                any risk of explosion. KURIAN J V;  NUGENT R W	DU PONT DE NEMOURS & CO E I (DUPO-C);  DU PONT DE NEMOURS & CO E I (DUPO-C)	1995240637	      A process for forming a shaped article from a nylon polymer comprises (a) melting the polymer, (b) adding at least 5 ppm of a water-soluble additive selected from Mg, Ca and Zn salts of 2-14C dicarboxylic acids which are free of fluoride, and (c) forming the compsn. into an article. Also claimed is a polymeric compsn. comprising a nylon polymer and at least 5 ppm of the above water-soluble additive.    USE -   The process is used for the mfr. of fibres e.g. fully-drawn yarns, tows for staple prodn. and bulked-continuous filament yarns for use as carpet yarns, and injection moulded articles.    ADVANTAGE -   The fibres have fewer visible spherulites with small spherulite size providing a more uniform structure and therefor improving finish pickup and dye uniformity. As a moulding resin, the process provides a decrease in cycle time while maintaining the clarity of the nylon compsn. A more uniform crystal structure is obtd. when using recycled nylon possibly contg. contaminants. 		   (JP9500417-W)      A process for forming a shaped article from a nylon polymer comprises (a) melting the polymer, (b) adding at least 5 ppm of a water-soluble additive selected from Mg, Ca and Zn salts of 2-14C dicarboxylic acids which are free of fluoride, and (c) forming the compsn. into an article. Also claimed is a polymeric compsn. comprising a nylon polymer and at least 5 ppm of the above water-soluble additive.    USE -   The process is used for the mfr. of fibres e.g. fully-drawn yarns, tows for staple prodn. and bulked-continuous filament yarns for use as carpet yarns, and injection moulded articles.    ADVANTAGE -   The fibres have fewer visible spherulites with small spherulite size providing a more uniform structure and therefor improving finish pickup and dye uniformity. As a moulding resin, the process provides a decrease in cycle time while maintaining the clarity of the nylon compsn. A more uniform crystal structure is obtd. when using recycled nylon possibly contg. contaminants. USE -   The process is used for the mfr. of fibres e.g. fully-drawn yarns, tows for staple prodn. and bulked-continuous filament yarns for use as carpet yarns, and injection moulded articles. 8770-0-0-0 USE	9531F7301 U				WO2018204904-A1;  US2019300427-A1	Method for manufacturing asphalt briquette or            pellet, involves obtaining recycled asphaltic limestone            powder followed by densifying recycled asphaltic            limestone powder by applying specific and high pressure            to obtain briquette or pellet	HORTON J D	HORTON J D (HORT-Individual);  HORTON J D (HORT-Individual)	201887807K	   NOVELTY - An asphalt briquette or pellet manufacturing                method involves obtaining recycled asphaltic                limestone powder less than 2380 microns in size                with a mean size of less than 150 microns, followed                by densifying the recycled asphaltic limestone                powder by applying specific and high pressure,                resulting in the formation of a briquette or                pellet.    USE - Method for manufacturing asphalt briquette or                pellet that is utilized in fuel source, which is                stabilized for shipping and storage, as specialized                fuel at calcined limestone using facilities,                proximity cement manufacturers, roofing                manufacturers, lignite coal using power plants and                circulating fluidized bed boiler systems (all                claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The method enables manufacturing asphalt                briquette or pellet in simple and eco friendly                manner by turning the large volumes of recycled                asphaltic limestone powder into useful                compositions.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for the                following:    (1) an asphalt briquette or pellet    (2) a fuel source comprising the asphalt                briquette in combination with either a bio-mass or                coal fines    (3) a method for burning fuel, comprising                burning a fuel source to generate energy, where the                fuel source comprises the asphalt briquette as a                stand-alone fuel briquette with no additives    (4) a pellet combined into a polymer related                product selected from polymer pultruded or extruded                shapes.  NOROZE GHALAHTAKE M	CAMACHO RECYCLING SLU (CAMA-Non-standard)	2014B13956	   NOVELTY - The mortar comprises a self-regenerating cementing matrix for replacing cement, a super plasticizer additive, an anti-shrinkage additive, and an additive including dispersible polymer powder based on polyvinyl acetate. The self-regenerating cementing matrix includes 80% of a filler from any type of glass, preferably soda lime containing silica (50%), 8% of Portland cement, 8% of calcium oxide, and 4% of reactive metakaolin. A pigment aggregate is optionally included for providing clear and homogeneous shade color.    USE - Mortar for stabilizing any type of land, forest roads, public parks and protected areas, and for manufacturing building material.    ADVANTAGE - The mortar allows proper soil stabilization based on fractions of micronized rejection of recycling glass, and provides any changes and modifications to adapt different needs. AN 1980-54393C	829-0-0-0 			R00835 		WO200262924-A1;  US2002156333-A1;  AU2002243796-A1	Degradation of polymers of disulfide plastics, for            recycling consumer products, involves adding reducing            agent to polymers of degradable plastics, and producing            degradation products	ROSEN O;  KARMALI R A	ROSEN O (ROSE-Individual);  KARMALI R A (KARM-Individual);  ROSEN O (ROSE-Individual);  ROSEN O (ROSE-Individual)	2003018609	   NOVELTY - The degradation of polymers of disulfide                plastics involves adding a reducing agent to                polymers of degradable plastics, at mild conditions                for fracturing the chemicals bonds in the plastics,                and producing a variety of monomers and degradation                products.    USE - For degrading polymers of disulfide plastics                (claimed), for disposing and recycling plastics                produced for commercial and consumer products such                as products for controlled release of chemicals,                oral drug delivery products, automobile products,                gardening products, consumer products, health                products, substrates suitable for attachment and                growth of living cells, construction products,                adhesive products, adsorbent articles, flammable                products, lubricants, bags, netting, rope,                coatings, filters, containers, packaging, clothing,                and paper goods, for recycling littered products                such as drink containers, labels, food packaging,                printed matter, construction material and vehicle                supplies.    ADVANTAGE - The degradation process is rapid and                cost-effective. The degradable plastic products are                made into instantly degradable non-toxic and                hydrolitically degradable polymers produced by                reacting monomer with non-toxic modifier which is                compatible with the polymer. The modifier is                non-volatile and non-toxic material. Since the                plastic products are recovered, the process is                environmental friendly. The recovered monomers are                preserved and reused. Hence, the manufacturing cost                of plastic monomers from crude oil and natural gas                is lowered. The degradable polymers can be                processed within a time frame in which products                made from the materials, after use, can be readily                recycled by decomposition of the polymer into                monomeric units.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for                recovering a monomer from the degradable plastic                material formed from monomer(s) and from a                non-toxic modifier or an additive,                comprising:    (1) vulcanizing the plastic material in a                reservoir;    (2) washing the material to remove additives                from the surface of the material;    (3) exposing the washed material to a reducing                agent under conditions sufficient to fracture the                chemical bonds to form one or more intermediate                products;    (4) heating the material in presence of                catalyst mixture to a temperature, and for a time                sufficient to depolymerize the plastic material to                form monomer; and    (5) removing the monomer from the                mixture. 			A35 (Other processing and general - including vulcanisation, welding of plastics and adhesive processes.  SEDRAN E (SEDR-Individual)	2007603473	   NOVELTY - The tie-rod (TA) including formwork locking accessories is made of is made of recycled plastic material such as synthetic resin or polymer such as synthetic resin or polymer.  CSATARI LASZLA	JAGER INVEST KERESKEDELMI SZOLGALTATO ES (JAGE-Non-standard);  JAGER INVEST KERESKEDELMI SZOLGALTATO (JAGE-Non-standard);  JAGER INVEST KERESKEDELMI SZOLGALTATO ES (JAGE-Non-standard)	201573922S	   NOVELTY - Polymer blend for preparing homogenous polymer                agglomerate, comprises polyamide, polyolefin, glass                fiber reinforced plastic and/or resin and a small                molecular compatibilizing additive as components,                and compatibilizing polymers and/or                property-modifying polymers as optional components,                and optionally other additives commonly used in                plastics industry.    USE - The polymer blend is useful for preparing                homogenous polymer agglomerate, and product which                is selected from different profiles prepared by                injection molding, industrial floor tiles or grass                grids, safety mats prepared by blowing technology,                for use in standing workplaces, anchors, cast                films, e.g. flood prevention plastic sheeting, or                plastic sheets, e.g. construction shuttering                panels, plastic tubes and hoses (all                claimed). Polymer blends and                agglomerates provide base materials for                manufacturing products with high-quality                properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) a process for preparing homogenous polymer                agglomerate, where polyamide, polyolefin, glass                fiber reinforced plastic and/or resin and a small                molecular compatibilizing additive as components,                and compatibilizing polymers and/or                property-modifying polymers serve as optional                components, and optionally other additives commonly                used in plastics industry are converted into                homogenous polymer agglomerate at a constant                temperature falling in the range of 130-170 degrees                C;    (2) homogenous polymer agglomerate prepared by                the process; or homogenous polymer agglomerate                prepared from polymer blend; and    (3) product which is partially or completely                prepared from the polymer blend or the polymer                agglomerate.  US20140024778-A1   ;  US8450382-B2   MBA POLYMERS INC (MBAP-Non-standard)   RIISE B,  ALLEN L E,  RAU R C	WO2015177580-A3  SHTARKE L.:          "Ispolzovanie promyshlennykh i bytovykh otkhodov          plastmass.", LENINGRAD ''KHIMIYA,          1987,relevantClaims[1-3, 6-8, 10-14]	1013-0-0-0 ;  ROSEN O (ROSE-Individual)	2004373388	   NOVELTY - Degradation of polymers of disulfide plastics involves adding a reducing agent to the polymers at mild conditions for fracturing the chemical bonds in the degradable plastics; and producing a variety of monomers and degradation products.    USE - Degradation of polymers of disulfide plastics (claimed) to prepare degradable compositions containing amino-sulfenyl, oxygen-sulfenyl or disulfide moieties. Also for disposal and recycling of plastics produced for commercial and consumer products e.g. products for controlled release of chemicals, oral drug delivery products, automobile products, gardening products etc. and recycling of littered products such as drink containers, labels, food packaging, printed matter, construction material and vehicle supplies.    ADVANTAGE - The method is environmentally acceptable, cost-effective and rapid. The reclamation of waste polymers does not contribute pollutants to the atmosphere. The method provides reusable monomers at a cost lower than the cost of manufacturing fresh plastic monomers from crude oil and natural gas; provides a step of removing interfering complex chemical additives from the plastic products and by optimizing the reaction conditions for the fracturing of the chemical bonds within the polymer; introduces new chemical monomer formulation which sustain instant degradability properties while retaining the useful mechanical properties of plastics for commercial application thus facilitates the process industry-wide at economically attractive terms while remaining environmentally friendly; overcomes problems of scaling and satisfies production capacity requirements by employing up to two moderately sized depolymerization reactors operating simultaneously under similar process conditions; and recovers and preserves monomers and other chemicals for reuse instead of destroying.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for recovering a monomer from a degradable plastic material formed at least from the monomer and from a non-toxic modifier or an additive involving:    (a) vulcanizing the plastic material in a reservoir;    (b) washing the plastic material to remove additives from the surface of the plastic material;    (c) exposing the washed plastic material to reducing agent to fracture the chemical bonds forming at least one intermediate product;    (d) heating in the presence of a catalyst the mixture formed in step (c) to depolymerize the plastic material to form monomer; and    (e) removing the monomer from the mixture.  HARDER J R (HARD-Individual);  CONOCOPHILLIPS CO (CONO-C);  CONOCOPHILLIPS CO (CONO-C);  CONOCOPHILLIPS CO (CONO-C);  CHEVRON PHILLIPS CHEM CO LP (CPCH-C)	2000364869	   NOVELTY - A polymeric composition comprises a                polyolefin, a first and a second phosphite, a                hindered phenol and water.    USE - In food packaging, electronic components,                automobile parts, fibers, fabrics and medical                equipments.    ADVANTAGE - The polymers obtained have improved color,                stability and melt strength of recycled                polyolefins. DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A composition (1) comprises: (a) a polyolefin                (2); (b) an arylalkyl diphosphite (3) of formula                (I); (c) a second phosphite (4) selected from (3)                which is different from (b) or a triarylphosphite                of formula (II); (d) a hindered phenol (5); and (e)                water. INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for: (A)                Blending (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e); (B) a process                to reduce the hygroscopic nature and improve the                hydrolytic stability of phosphites which comprises                blending (3) and (4); (C) a process to improve the                melt strength on recycle of a polyolefin which                comprises (A); and (D) an article manufactured from                a polymer obtained from (C). The yellow soil (in mass%) (50-95) and reforming binding material (5-20) are added, and subjected to thermal wake polymerization process using polymer resin at 100-220 degrees C. Then, the additives (0-30) are added to the obtained tar-sludge reforming binding material, agitated at 100 degrees C or more and melted. The obtained mixed material is injected into mold, pressurized and cooled using water, to obtain yellow soil block.    USE - Manufacture of yellow soil block.    ADVANTAGE - The yellow soil block is manufactured efficiently, and has excellent freezing and thawing resistance.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The tar sludge generated in industrial site from cokes is subjected to oil-removal and processed, to obtain yellow soil. The yellow soil (in mass%) (50-95) and reforming binding material (5-20) are added, and the obtained tar sludge material is subjected to thermal wake polymerization process using polymer resin at state of low viscosity and 100-220 degrees C in order to improves the reforming quality. Then, the additive (0-30) such as waste-burnt ash, mine refuse, waste concrete recycling aggregates, dredged soil, slag, sand, waste molded sand and/or magnetism pulverized component are added to the obtained tar-sludge reforming binding material, agitated at 100 degrees C or more, melted and softening is measured at predetermined amount. The obtained mixed material is injected into mold, pressurized, cooled using water and the forming material is taken away at predetermined time, to obtain yellow soil block.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows the flowchart illustrating manufacturing method of yellow soil block. (Drawing includes non-English language text) 			A93 (Roads, building, construction flooring.);  L02 (Refractories, ceramics, cement - includes manufacturing methods, limes, soil preparation for (road) building, magnesias and slags, cements, mortars, concretes, abrasives, thermal or acoustic insulation (non)oxide ceramics and ceramic composites, but not brick making, concrete mixers or casting or pottersâ€™ wheels (C04).);  P64 (Working cement, clay, stone (B28).) Patent KR2007105704	KR038230    27 Apr 2006			KR792527-B1 -- KR99068759-A   ;  KR2005077552-A   ;  KR247328-B1   							FR2895411-A1	Preparing a mixture of plastic and additives, comprises dissolving the plastic in an organic solvent, introducing additives in the form of wet cake after/during dissolution, precipitating the plastic in solution by water injection		SOLVAY & CIE (SOLV-C)	2007692927	   NOVELTY - Preparation of a mixture containing a plastic and additives, comprises dissolving the plastic in an organic solvent, introducing the additives into the solution after or during dissolution, precipitating the plastic in solution by water injection, where at least one of the additives is introduced into solution in the form of a wet cake.    USE - The plastic is useful for the manufacture e.g. of canvas cover, fabric coatings and other elements for vehicles, pipes, window frames or electric cables with polymeric insulation.    ADVANTAGE - The process is simple to execute, using polymers in classical commercial form (powder or granules) that can be recycled.
