 SAI J;  SAKO T	KEIZAI SANGYOSHO SANGYO GIJUTSU SOGO KEN (KEIZ-C)	2002044479	   NOVELTY - Manufacture of a carbonate ester from an alcohol and carbon dioxide includes the following processes. (1) the alcohol and carbon dioxide are reacted in the presence of a metal catalyst to give the carbonate ester; (2) the reaction liquid from step 1 is cooled; (3) water is removed from the reaction liquid; (4) the dehydrated reaction liquid is recycled to step (1).    USE - The carbonate esters are used as substances such as raw materials for polycarbonates; additives for increasing the octane rating of petrol and gasoline; diesel additives for reducing particulates in exhaust gas; alkylating agents; carbonylating agents; and solvents.    ADVANTAGE - Use of carbon dioxide reduces the toxicity and corrosiveness compared with the reaction with phosgene, and reduces the high pressures, toxicity and byproducts associated with the reaction with carbon monoxide. The system gives higher yields, and the catalyst retains its activity for longer, than in systems using reaction with carbon dioxide in the presence of catalyst and dehydrating agent, without needing separation steps for the dehydrating agent. The back reaction is suppressed, and the reaction is suitable for continuous operation. A PVB composite sheet (10) is manufactured using polyethylene (PE) protecting material sheet (20), ethylene vinyl acetate (EVA) and fabric material sheets, foaming PE, EVA and fabric material sheets. The glass is pulverized, and the pulverized material is mixed with polymer, filler, additive, wood dust, resin, pigment, plasticizer and lubricant. The mixture is passed through an extruder and a filtering net to filter and remove impurity.    USE - Method for manufacturing a PVB double complex waterproof protecting material sheet that is utilized in civil engineering applications for covering a concrete outer wall of an underground structure. Uses include but are not limited to a railway, a subway, an electric power conduit pipe, a cable tunnel and a road structure.    ADVANTAGE - The method enables re-utilization of the safety glass for manufacturing of the adhesive film. The utilization of the PE protecting material sheet enables improvement of durability, shock resistance, elasticity and drainage of the underground structure. The material sheet increases tensile strength of the wall of the underground structure.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A polyvinyl butyral (PVB) double complex waterproof protecting material sheet manufacturing method involves manufacturing an adhesive film from recycled safety glass. A PVB composite sheet is manufactured using polyethylene (PE) protecting material sheet, ethylene vinyl acetate (EVA) protecting material sheet, non-woven fabric protecting material sheet, foaming PE protecting material sheet, foaming EVA protecting material sheet and non-woven fabric protecting material sheet. The recycled safety glass is pulverized to form recycle scrap of the safety glass. The pulverized scrap crushed material is mixed with polymer, filler, additive, wood dust, resin, pigment, plasticizer and lubricant. The mixture is passed through an extruder and a filtering net to filter and remove lubricant impurity. An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for a PVB double complex waterproof protecting material sheet.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a cross-sectional view of a PVB double complex waterproof layer protecting material sheet. A04-G02E4;  A04-G07;  A10-E02;  A12-R01A;  A12-R07	B32B-027/18;  B32B-027/30	KR2011076238-A   06 Jul 2011   B32B-027/18   201224Pages: 9   	KR2011076238-A    KR132892    29 Dec 2009		KR132892    29 Dec 2009					1013-0-0-0 ; 829-0-0-0 			R00326 ; R00835 		US2005187306-A1;  US7297721-B2	Preparation of food-grade polyethyleneterephthalate for manufacturing bottles comprises adding post-consumer recycled polyethyleneterephthalate flakes to virgin raw materials and subjecting to autoclaving and solid state polymerization	KULKARNI S T	KULKARNI S T (KULK-Individual);  FUTURA POLYESTERS LTD (FUTU-Non-standard)	2005655623	   NOVELTY - Preparation of a high-molecular weight food-grade polyethyleneterephthalate (PET) comprises adding post-consumer recycled PET (PCRPET) flakes to virgin pure terephthalic acid (PTA), isophthalic acid (IPA), monoethylene glycol (MEG), and additives in an esterification reactor to obtain a prepolymer heel; subjecting to autoclaving to yield an amorphous melt; and then subjecting to solid state polymerization.    USE - For preparing a high-molecular weight food-grade PET for manufacturing PET bottles for use in food contact application (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The re-polymerized PET obtained from a maximum of 50% of post-consumer recycled PET bottle flakes has similar properties to the PET produced from virgin raw materials. Flakes are subjected to the minimum processing time so that quality does not suffer. The overall processing time of the invention remains the same as the processing time of virgin materials. No extra time is taken by flakes for their reaction.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Preparation of a high-molecular weight food-grade polyethyleneterephthalate comprises processing by adding post-consumer recycled PET flakes to the paste form of virgin pure terephthalic acid, isophthalic acid, monoethylene glycol, and additives in the esterification reactor to obtain an esterified material; retaining 20-30% of the esterified material in the esterification reactor and filtering the rest of the esterified material as a prepolymer heel of uniform quality; transferring the pre-polymer into a prepoly reactor while maintaining a temperature of 240-255degreesC for a maximum period of 60 minutes to achieve an intrinsic viscosity (I.V.) of 0.3 dl/g; charging the material into an autoclave at 284-300degreesC to achieve a degree of polymerization of 100-110 to obtain an amorphous polymer resin/melt; subjecting the amorphous polymer resin/melt to solid state polymerization to obtain food-grade crystalline PET; and preferably continuing the process cycle by adding an appropriate quantity of PCRPET flakes, PTA, IPA and MEG to the esterified material and performing the steps of transferring, charging and solid state polymerizing to obtain continuous production of crystalline food-grade PET resin.  GOERRISSEN H;  MAC KEE G E;  NIESSNER N;  WEBER M;  MC KEE G E	BASF AG (BADI-C);  BASF AG (BADI-C);  BASF AG (BADI-C);  BASF AG (BADI-C)	2000304619	   NOVELTY - The use in products for the garden or animal keeping of non-ABS (acrylonitrile butadiene styrene) thermoplastic molding materials containing (A) 1-48 wt.% emulsion polymer with a Tg below 0 degreesC in at least one phase and a particle size of 50-1000 nm, (B) 1-48 wt.% amorphous or partly crystalline polymer, (C) 51-98 wt.% polycarbonate and (D) optional additives etc.    USE - For the production of profiles, sheet, tubes and film for use in articles for the garden or for animal keeping (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - Polycarbonate-based molding materials with high stability, chemical resistance and resistance to yellowing, good scratch resistance, impact strength and dimensional stability (especially under thermal stress), high resistance to UV and heat ageing (with good retention of surface gloss), good fire resistance, a high resistance to swelling, low permeability to liquids and gases and good recycling properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The use of thermoplastic molding materials other than ABS for the manufacture of molded products and semi-finished products for the garden or for animal keeping is claimed. These materials contain (A) 1-48 wt.% mono- or multi-phase emulsion polymer(s) with a glass transition temperature (Tg) below 0 degreesC in at least one phase and an average particle size (d50) of 50-1000 nm, (B) 1-48 wt.% amorphous or partly crystalline polymer(s), (C) 51-98 wt.% polycarbonate and (D) 0-47 wt.% normal additives and/or fibrous fillers and/or particulate fillers.    An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for molded products (or housings for such products) made from these materials for the garden or for animal keeping, especially garden buildings, equipment, accessories and furniture, electric fencing and cages or transport containers for small animals. USE - Recycling of articles/recovered coating material e.g. dental models.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Recycling of additively manufactured articles or recovered coating material involves (a) providing a preformed article, or recovered coating material, where the article or coating material is produced by light polymerizing a single cure resin comprising a reactive blocked prepolymer (i), 1-5 wt.% crosslinker (ii), a photoinitiator (iii), optionally a reactive diluent (iv), optionally a light absorber (v), optionally pigments and/or dyes (vi), and optionally at least one filler (vii), in an additive manufacturing or coating process, the preformed article or recovered coating material comprising at least 70 wt.%, 80 wt.%, or 90 wt.% crosslinked polymer comprising reactive blocked prepolymer, reactive diluent in light polymerized, and thermoset form, (b) comminuting the preformed article or recovered coating material into a particulate material e.g. by grinding such as cryo-milling, shredding, chopping, or pelletizing, and (c) combining the 1-20 wt.%, 2-25 wt.%, or 4-30 wt.% particulate material with a reactive blocking agent or reactive capping agent to form a mixture, and heating the mixture to 40-90 degrees C, 60-100 degrees C, or 70-120 degrees C, or more for a time sufficient to form a regenerated reactive prepolymer. INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the following:    (1) recyclable light-polymerizable resin useful for additive manufacturing;    (2) manufacture of recyclable article by additive manufacturing; and    (3) sustainable manufacturing method, which involves (a) shipping a recyclable light-polymerizable resin to at least one user, (b) collecting articles produced from the resin (e.g., by additive manufacturing, such as by bottom-up or top-down stereolithography) back from at least one user, and (c) processing the articles to recover a regenerated reactive prepolymer. The polymer additive is selected from                polyethylene naphthalate (PEN), polytrimethylene                naphthalate (PTN), and in-situ formed PEN and                PTN.    USE - As a polymeric composition for making heat                sealable film or sheet (claimed) for sealing                containers for packaging food stuffs and                beverages.    ADVANTAGE - The polymer additive like PEN/PTN in the                polymer composition provides heat sealing of the                films or sheets at lower temperatures, thus                preventing the degradation of the material. The                naphthalene moiety also imparts UV barrier and heat                resistance to the heat seal film. The incorporation                of the PTN additionally provides resistance to gas                permeation. The addition of nano additives like                nano silica/nano clay helps in marginally improving                the crystallinity as well as barrier property. The                composition also prevents chips agglomeration, thus                facilitating drying without lump formation. The                addition of antiblocking agent in the heat seal                film application avoids sticking and facilitates                trouble free unwinding of the heat seal film roll.                The PET-PEN/PTN copolymer resin composition makes                optically clear heat sealable film or sheet with                sufficient seal strength for monolayer or for                multilayer application.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the                following:    (1) making copolyester resin for manufacture                of heat sealable films or sheets involving mixing                virgin terephthalic acid, monoethylene glycol in                paste optionally with post consumer recycled                polyethylene terephthalate (PCRPET), and                isophthalic acid in an esterification reactor and                adding nucleating agent, polycondensation catalyst,                color toners and heat stabilizers; carrying out the                esterification reaction at 245-265 degrees C to                obtain a prepolymer; adding clear fast reheat                (CFRH) additive to the prepolymer; transferring an                esterified prepolymer to the polyreactor; adding                the polymer additive for lowering the melting point                of the composition; subjecting the prepolymer                containing the polymer additive to polycondensation                at 265-284 degrees C to obtain a molten amorphous                polymer; extruding molten amorphous polymer to form                chips; drying and pre-crystallizing the amorphous                chips; and subjecting the resultant chips to solid                state polymerisation to attain an intrinsic                viscosity (I.V.) of greater than 0.55 dl/g;                and    (2) method for making heat sealable films or                sheets involving subjecting the polymeric                composition to extrusion to form a heat sealable                film or sheet. 			A23 (Polyamides; polyesters. (including polycarbonates, polyesteramides); alkyds; other unsaturated polymers.);  A92 (Packaging and containers - including ropes and nets.)  US2015291788-A1;  MX2014010026-A1;  JP5956614-B2;  EP2817372-B1;  CN104245839-B;  EP2817372-B8;  ES2613497-T3;  BR112014020283-A2;  US2017335099-A1;  MX356432-B;  US2019144665-A1;  US10294364-B2;  BR112014020283-B1	Polyhydroxyalkanoate composition for e.g. durable            component, contains polyhydroxyalkanoate component            comprising copolymer, thermoplastic polymer, mixture of            biodegradable polymers, filler, plasticizer and            additive	CARFAGNINI A;  BELLOMO L;  GARFAGNINI A	SOFTER SPA (SOFT-Non-standard);  SOFTER SPA (SOFT-Non-standard);  SOFTER SPA (SOFT-Non-standard);  CARFAGNINI A (CARF-Individual);  BELLOMO L (BELL-Individual);  SOF TER SPA (SOFT-Non-standard);  SABIO SRL (SABI-Non-standard);  SABIO SRL (SABI-Non-standard)	2013M80648	   NOVELTY - A polyhydroxyalkanoate composition comprises                25 wt.% component (I) comprising hydroxyalkanoate                copolymer including poly(3-hydroxybutyrate)                homopolymer, 5-40 wt.% thermoplastic polymer as                component (II) chosen from thermoplastic                polyurethane (IIa), acrylic polymer (IIB), which is                an acrylic block copolymer (IIb1) and/or an acrylic                terpolymer (IIb2), mixture of 5 %wt or less                biodegradable polymers, 0-40 wt.% filler, 0-20 wt.%                plasticizer and additive. The total content of                component (I) and component (II) is 40 wt.% in the                polyhydroxyalkanote composition.    USE - Polyhydroxyalkanoate composition is used for                manufacturing durable component containing more                than 40 wt.% non-fossil carbon, and articles (all                claimed). Uses include but are not limited to                automotive component, household appliance,                furniture and electronic component, sport                equipments and toys.    ADVANTAGE - The polyhydroxyalkanoate composition has                excellent ultraviolet-ray stability, durability and                esthetic property, and is biodegradable and                recycled.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A polyhydroxyalkanoate composition comprises                25 wt.% polyhydroxyalkanoate component (I)                comprising hydroxyalkanoate copolymer including 5                wt.% or less poly(3-hydroxybutyrate) homopolymer,                5-40 wt.% thermoplastic polymer as                non-polyhydroxyalkanoate component (II) chosen from                a thermoplastic polyurethane (IIa), an acrylic                polymer (IIB), which is an acrylic block copolymer                (IIb1) with a core comprising butadiene-based                and/or acrylic-based rubber and is crosslinked, and                acrylic terpolymer (IIb2) comprising glycidyl                and/or maleic groups, mixture of 5 %wt or less                biodegradable polymers based on ASTM D6400, 0-40                wt.% filler, 0-20 wt.% plasticizer and 0-10 wt.%                additive. The total content of component (I) and                component (II) is 40 wt.% in the                polyhydroxyalkanote composition. 			A23 (Polyamides; polyesters.  MAC KEE G E;  NIESSNER N;  GUENTHERBERG N;  WEBER M;  MC KEE G E	BASF AG (BADI-C);  BASF AG (BADI-C);  BASF AG (BADI-C)	2000294093	   NOVELTY - The non-acrylonitrile-butadiene-styrene (ABS) thermoplastic molding materials contain (A) 1-48 wt% emulsion polymer with a Tg below 0degreesC in at least one phase and a particle size of 50-1000 nm, (B) 1-48 wt% amorphous or partly crystalline polymer, (C) 51-98 wt% polycarbonate and (D) optional additives or fillers.    USE - For the production of semi-finished products, molded parts, tubes, profiles, sheet and film for use in housings and covers for filters, pumps and motors (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - Polycarbonate-based molding materials with high stability, chemical resistance and resistance to yellowing, good scratch resistance, impact strength and dimensional stability (especially under thermal stress), high resistance to UV and heat ageing (with good retention of surface gloss), good fire resistance, a high resistance to swelling, low permeability to liquids and gases and good recycling properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The use of thermoplastic molding materials other than ABS for the production of housings and covers (or the corresponding semi-finished products) for filters, pumps and motors is claimed. These materials contain (A) 1-48 wt% mono- or multi-phase emulsion polymer(s) with a glass transition temperature (Tg) below 0degreesC in at least one phase and an average particle size (d50) of 50-1000 nm, (B) 1-48 wt% amorphous or partly crystalline polymer(s), (C) 51-98 wt% polycarbonate and (D) 0-47 wt% normal additives and/or fibrous and/or particulate fillers. An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for housings and covers for filters, pumps and motors made from these materials, especially housings and covers used in manufacturing and processing industries, agriculture, food production and processing, medicine and laboratory equipment.. The foam is compressed for molding in the form of desired thermoformed and recyclable objects. The obtained material is added with additive, where the additive is plasticizers, colorants or pigments, lubricants, crosslinkers, preservatives, fillers, thickeners, stabilizers and natural or synthetic polymers.    USE - Method for preparing biodegradable and recyclable material used for manufacturing thermoformed objects (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The method enables to prepare biodegradable and recyclable material in cost-effective manner, and with high productivity and quality. USE - For the production of semi-finished products, profiles, tubes, film and sheet for use in the manufacture of housings (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - Polycarbonate-based molding materials with high stability, high resistance to yellowing, high resistance to chemicals (high swelling resistance), good scratch resistance, impact strength and dimensional stability (especially under thermal stress), high resistance to UV, heat aging and weathering (with good retention of surface gloss), good fire resistance, good antistatic properties, low permeability to liquids and gases and good recycling properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The use of thermoplastic materials other than ABS as molding materials for the production of housings (or semi-finished products for such housings) for electrical equipment containing small transformers is claimed.    These materials contain:    (A) 1-48 wt% mono- or multi-phase emulsion polymer(s) with a glass transition temperature (Tg) below 0 degrees C in at least one phase and an average particle size (d50) of 50-1000 nm,    (B) 1-48 wt% amorphous or partly crystalline polymer(s),    (C) 51-98 wt% polycarbonate, and    (D) 0-47 wt% normal additives and/or fibrous fillers and/or particulate fillers.    An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for housings made from this material for electrical equipment containing small transformers, especially power packs or battery charging equipment. The material processing system comprises material size reducer (104), and material control system (102) configured to force received material through material processing system. The material control system comprises fan and movable control plate positioned adjacent to fan. The additive manufacturing filament is continuous and have an approximately uniform diameter. The material control system and material size reducer are contained within material processing system housing comprising a dehumidifying element.    USE - Recycler device for producing additive manufacturing filament from received material comprising previously manufactured object, preferably from acrylonitrile butadiene styrene, polyethylene, high density polyethylene, low density polyethylene, nylon, and polymer foam, or ferrous metal, non-ferrous metal,composite, resin-based material, and in-situ material or their combination (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The recycler device facilitates a significant reduction of wasted logistical mass, as well as a reduction in the volume of trash storage, and converts materials such as old parts, trash, or other waste into a usable form, such as a filament. R00901 ; R00843 		US2016082652-A1;  WO2016044837-A1;  EP3194169-A1;  CA2962090-A1;  JP2017528347-W;  EP3238916-A1;  EP3194169-A4;  RU2017113607-A;  RU2017118906-A;  EP3238916-B1;  JP6601920-B2;  US10725451-B2	Manufacturing system for creating object from modular assembly containing multiple manufacturing processes used for recycler device, has additive device to perform additive process to accelerate build completion of produced object	SNYDER M;  DUNN J;  KEMMER A;  CHEN M;  DUNN YA	MADE IN SPACE INC (MADE-Non-standard);  MADE IN SPACE INC (MADE-Non-standard);  MADE IN SPACE INC (MADE-Non-standard);  MADE IN SPACE INC (MADE-Non-standard)	201617488L	   NOVELTY - The system (100) has an additive manufacturing device (104) to perform at least one additive manufacturing process and to include a prefabricated component during additive process to accelerate build completion of a produced object. The prefabricated component has a bulk volume of same material to be applied during the additive manufacturing process. The additive manufacturing process comprises at least one of a polymer-based additive manufacturing process and a metal casting additive manufacturing process.    USE - Manufacturing system for creating object from modular assembly containing multiple manufacturing processes used for recycler device.    ADVANTAGE - Manufacturing systems include one or more devices which separate created portions from associated build tables by enabling assembly of the good and easy removal by a user. The enclosed area are filtered, temperature and humidity-controlled and monitored in order to protect people and equipment near the system and ensure that goods are created in ideal environmental conditions. Air filtration and cleaning ensure safe operations for both terrestrial and non-terrestrial versions. The manufacturing system is aware of the current resource usage of each component as well as of the overall system inside and of the predicted future utilization so it can create multiple goods or portions of goods for one or more customers in order to optimize completion time and utilization of the overall device. The system ensures fast and uncomplicated maintenance procedures. The environmental control regulates temperature, humidity, and air quality within additive manufacturing device, thus preventing outgassing and contamination of the environment during operation. The on-site production of more complex goods is facilitated in a safe and streamlined manner with respect to space applications.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for the following:    (1) a manufacturing system for producing an object; and    (2) a method for creating object from modular assembly containing multiple manufacturing processes.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows the perspective view of a self-contained goods manufacturing system including an additive manufacturing system.  JP3755444-B2	Additive for used-paper regeneration, comprises condensate formed by reacting urea with amine compounds and components such as oxyethylene oxypropylene copolymer or polyvinyl alcohol	TAMAI T;  ASAKURA K;  TADA F	NIPPON OILS & FATS CO LTD (NIOF-C)	2004249690	   NOVELTY - An additive comprises (a) condensate obtained by reacting urea at ratio of 0.1-1.5 times mole with amine compound (I) or reacting urea at ratio of 0.1-1.5 times mole with amine compound, which is obtained by reacting 10-24C aliphatic monocarboxylic acid and compound (II) and (b) components such as oxyethylene oxypropylene copolymer, polyvinyl alcohol or component having 8-22C hydrocarbon group or 1-piece acyl group and it is nonionic surfactant.    USE - For used-paper regeneration and for manufacturing recycled paper (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The additive for used-paper regeneration prevents pollution/stain of apparatus and recycled paper in the paper making process. The recycled paper with excellent oil absorption property and bulk property is obtained.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The additive comprises (a) condensate obtained by reacting urea at ratio of 0.1-1.5 times mole with amine compound of formula (I) or reacting urea at ratio of 0.1-1.5 times mole with amine compound, which is obtained by reacting 10-24C aliphatic monocarboxylic acid and compound of formula (II) and (b) components such as oxyethylene oxypropylene copolymer having molecular weight of 1,200-12,000, polyvinyl alcohol having average degree of polymerization of 300-3000, component having 8-22C hydrocarbon group or 1-piece acyl group and it is nonionic surfactant formed by adding oxyalkylene chain having molecular weight of 200-1,000 and/or cationic polymer. The ratio of (a) condensate and (b) components are 99:1-60:40 (a:b).    R1 = 10-24C alkyl group or alkenyl group;    R2 = hydrogen atom, 10-24C alkyl group, or alkenyl group;    R3, = 1-4C alkylene group;    R4, R5 = hydrogen atom, 1-4C hydroxyalkyl group or 1-3C alkyl group;    R6 = hydrogen atom, 1-4C hydroxyalkyl group, 1-24C alkyl group or alkenyl group;    n = 0 or 1; and    R4 = hydrogen atom, when n = 0.    An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for manufacture of recycled paper. 			F09 (Paper-making production of cellulose, chemical treatment of wood - including chipboard and fibre-board (D21).) USE - Manufacture of additive metal component used for article (claimed) e.g. medical implant and aerospace component.    ADVANTAGE - The method provides component by utilizing the minimal usage of the adhesives, or no little adhesive and reduced amount of ceramic powder to trim scrap which is recycled to form new sheets. The masking-layer in the metallic component allows easier post-sintering removal of temporary supports that reduce distortion of the components during sintering.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for article, which is sintered to form a monolithic metal component comprising two or more powder-filled thermoplastic composite components, in which at least one component is formed from planar thermoplastic composite sheet material. M22-H02;  M22-H03B;  M22-H03E;  M22-H03F;  M22-H03G;  A10-E05B;  A12-W12F;  D09-C01;  P53-C03;  P53-U40	B22F-001/00;  B22F-003/105;  B22F-003/24;  B22F-005/00;  B22F-007/02;  B29C-064/147;  B33Y-070/00;  B33Y-030/00;  B33Y-080/00;  B22F-010/20;  B33Y-010/00;  B22F-010/10;  B22F-010/70;  B22F-010/00	US2020016653-A1   16 Jan 2020   B22F-001/00   202009Pages: 16   English;  US11203062-B2   21 Dec 2021   B22F-001/00   202104   English	US2020016653-A1    US033105    11 Jul 2018;   US11203062-B2    US033105    11 Jul 2018	US11203062-B2 Previous Publ. Patent US2020016653	US033105    11 Jul 2018										EP818474-A2;  JP10017616-A;  JP10101725-A;  JP10101731-A;  JP10101733-A;  JP10101873-A;  JP10195134-A;  JP10195234-A;  KR98009295-A;  AU9851081-A;  US6022928-A;  US6210581-B1;  US6274681-B1;  US2002016419-A1;  JP3271238-B2;  JP3289615-B2;  CN1341668-A;  AU200234377-A;  US6417288-B2;  AU752379-B;  JP3371320-B2;  JP3371322-B2;  JP3371323-B2;  US6545070-B1;  CN1178221-A;  JP3446513-B2;  JP3470516-B2;  US2004054093-A1;  CN1490348-A;  EP818474-B1;  CN1542023-A;  CN1542029-A;  DE69732199-E;  AU782770-B2;  DE69732199-T2;  CN1155625-C;  CN1150221-C;  AU2005237160-A1;  CN1249099-C;  AU2005237160-B2;  CN100335540-C;  CN100339404-C;  EP2258732-A1;  TH31049-A;  VN10008223-B;  TH27322-R0;  IN9701886-I1;  EP818474-A3;  KR533306-B1	High molecular weight polyelectrolyte manufacture            by sulphonating waste poly:styrene resin, optionally            containing a halogenated fire retardant, in an            alicyclic solvent	INAGAKI Y;  NOGUCHI T;  WATANABE H;  KUROMIYA M;  KUROMIYA Y;  INAGAKI S;  YASUHITO I;  TSUTOMU N;  HARUO W;  MIYUKI K;  AND T M	SONY CORP (SONY-C);  SONY CORP (SONY-C);  INAGAKI Y (INAG-Individual);  NOGUCHI T (NOGU-Individual);  WATANABE H (WATA-Individual);  KUROMIYA M (KURO-Individual);  SONY CORP (SONY-C);  INAGAKI Y (INAG-Individual);  NOGUCHI T (NOGU-Individual);  WATANABE H (WATA-Individual);  KUROMIYA M (KURO-Individual);  SONY CORP (SONY-C);  SONY CORP (SONY-C)	1998065265	   NOVELTY - A method of manufacturing a poly-electrolyte                comprises sulphonating a polystyrene resin, which                is dissolved or dispersed in a solvent comprising                an alicyclic compound. Also claimed are: (1) a                method of sulphonating aromatic polymers; and (2) a                method of disposing of plastic containing halogen                flame retardant.    USE - To recycle wasted plastics, e.g. foamed                styrene polymers, which may contain halogenated                fire retardants. Polyelectrolytes based on                styrene/conjugated diene copolymers containing                ionic groups are used as a polymer coagulant for                disposing of waste water (claimed), and also as a                cement additive, a dispersant for inorganic                pigments, a conductive agent for an electronic                copying machine, an anti-static agent, a                scale-preventive agent, a dispersant for emulsion                polymerisation and an aqueous glue. Resins of                molecular weight 600,000 or higher may be used as a                coagulant, an absorbing resin, an ion exchange                resin, a chelate resin, a paper strength enhancer,                a surface sizing agent for paper or a                superplasticiser for coal slurry.    ADVANTAGE - A halogen-free polyelectrolyte is generated                from waste polymer without producing large amounts                of toxic waste materials. The polyelectrolytes have                higher molecular weights, (produced by                crosslinking), they may be recovered in a                water-free state and water need not be added to the                reaction system, and the solvent is recycled.                Separation of halogenated fire retardants is                efficient as they are not sulphonated and remain in                organic solution while the water-soluble polymers                may be extracted and separated quickly into an                aqueous solvent. Gel formation during sulphonation                is prevented when the polystyrene contains rigid                conjugated diene units, which prevent sulphone                crosslinking. The presence of a radical-scavenging                inorganic pigment prevents crosslinking via                conjugated diene units. When an alicyclic                unsaturated hydrocarbon is present during                sulphonation, it is sulphonated to form a                surfactant, which improves the ease of dispersion                of the product slurry. 		   (JP10017616-A)   NOVELTY - A method of manufacturing a poly-electrolyte                comprises sulphonating a polystyrene resin, which                is dissolved or dispersed in a solvent comprising                an alicyclic compound. Also claimed are: (1) a                method of sulphonating aromatic polymers; and (2) a                method of disposing of plastic containing halogen                flame retardant.    USE - To recycle wasted plastics, e.g. foamed                styrene polymers, which may contain halogenated                fire retardants. Polyelectrolytes based on                styrene/conjugated diene copolymers containing                ionic groups are used as a polymer coagulant for                disposing of waste water (claimed), and also as a                cement additive, a dispersant for inorganic                pigments, a conductive agent for an electronic                copying machine, an anti-static agent, a                scale-preventive agent, a dispersant for emulsion                polymerisation and an aqueous glue. Resins of                molecular weight 600,000 or higher may be used as a                coagulant, an absorbing resin, an ion exchange                resin, a chelate resin, a paper strength enhancer,                a surface sizing agent for paper or a                superplasticiser for coal slurry.    ADVANTAGE - A halogen-free polyelectrolyte is generated                from waste polymer without producing large amounts                of toxic waste materials. The polyelectrolytes have                higher molecular weights, (produced by                crosslinking), they may be recovered in a                water-free state and water need not be added to the                reaction system, and the solvent is recycled.                Separation of halogenated fire retardants is                efficient as they are not sulphonated and remain in                organic solution while the water-soluble polymers                may be extracted and separated quickly into an                aqueous solvent. Gel formation during sulphonation                is prevented when the polystyrene contains rigid                conjugated diene units, which prevent sulphone                crosslinking. The presence of a radical-scavenging                inorganic pigment prevents crosslinking via                conjugated diene units. When an alicyclic                unsaturated hydrocarbon is present during                sulphonation, it is sulphonated to form a                surfactant, which improves the ease of dispersion                of the product slurry. Class A13, AN 77-12314Y,          XP002107523,relevantClaims[1-66],relevantPassages[&lt;pp&gt;A&lt;/pp&gt;];  DATABASE WPI          Section Ch Week 7707, Derwent World Patents Index; Class          A13, AN 77-12314Y,          XP002107523,relevantClaims[1-66],relevantPassages[&lt;pp&gt;A&lt;/pp&gt;]	368-0-0-0 ; 36-0-0-0 ; 138286-1-0-0 ; 686-0-0-0 ; 2211-0-0-0 ; 2-1-0-0 ; 104-0-0-0 USE; 514-0-0-0 USE			R00708 ; R00913 ; R00035 ; R01966 ; R05085 ; R01514 		EP3715410-A1;  WO2020200730-A1;  CA3134650-A1;  CN113631651-A;  BR112021016514-A2;  IN202117048681-A;  US2022162430-A1;  KR2419364-B1;  CA3134650-C	Composition used to pipes and pack food and other            goods, fibers, automotive components, and great variety            of manufactured ,comprises recycled polymer composition            comprising recycled polypropylene and heterophasic            propylene copolymer	RUEMER F;  BORAGNO L;  SCHIESSER S;  DREILING G;  HOLLSTEN C;  LIEDAUER S;  OLLIKAINEN A;  PEZARD T	BOREALIS AG (BORA-C);  BOREALIS AG (BORA-C);  BOREALIS AG (BORA-C)	2020958056	   NOVELTY - Composition comprises a recycled polymer                composition (RPC) and a heterophasic propylene                copolymer (HECO), the composition is obtained by                blending, where(a) the RPC comprises at least 80                wt.% recycled polypropylene, and (b) the                heterophasic propylene copolymer (HECO) has (b1) a                xylene cold soluble (XCS) fraction determined at 25                degrees C according to ISO 16152 in 5-18 wt.%, and                (b2) a melt flow rate MFR2 (230 degrees C/2.16 kg)                measured according to ISO 1133 in 0.05-1.5 g/10                minutes, where further (c) the weight ratio between                the HECO and the RPC of ((HECO)/(RPC)) is of 1.1-7                wt.%, and (d) the percentage by weight of the HECO                together with the RPC of ((HECO)+(RPC)) is at least                85 wt.%, based on the weight of the                composition.    USE - The composition is useful for pipe (claimed),                which is used in packaging for food and other                goods, fibers, automotive components, and a great                variety of manufactured articles.    ADVANTAGE - The composition: has favorable                price/performance ratio, high versatility of                materials and a very broad range of possible                modifications, which allows tailoring of end-use                properties in wide range of applications; utilizes                chemical modifications, copolymerization, blending,                drawing, thermal treatment and combination of                techniques convert common-grade polyolefins into                valuable products with desirable properties; led to                huge amounts of polyolefin materials being produced                for consumer applications; eco-friendly; and led to                legislation on disposal, collection and recycling                of polyolefins.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included                for:    (1) producing the composition, comprising the                HECO, the RPC and the optional additives (AD) are                mixed, preferably melt mixed, thus obtaining the                composition; and    (2) use of the heterophasic propylene                copolymer as compatibilizer for the RPC in the                pipe, comprising the heterophasic propylene                copolymer HECO has the XCS fraction, and the melt                flow rate, where the HECO, the RPC and AD are                blended to form a composition being part of the                pipe. One jet contains a polyisocyanate component, the other contains a reagent that forms a polymer through reaction with the polyisocyanate.    USE - To deposit a three-dimensional formation on a substrate, using jets to carry the reagents which are to be mixed and set. Very diverse objects can be produced e.g. casings, gear wheels, models and prototypes especially. The method simplifies and economizes considerably in comparison with cited earlier laser stereo lithographic processes. Micron-sized objects can be formed e.g. on printed sheet. Braille characters can be printed.    ADVANTAGE - Excess material on the formation, is avoided. During construction the object produced is continuously visible, for practical purposes. Solid objects, sheets or layers can be produced, in an automatically-controlled operation. Because there is no excess, there is no reworking required, and no material has to be recycled. 		   (DE19937770-A1)   NOVELTY - Two jets, of less than 1, 000 micro,m diameter droplets, are combined. One jet contains a polyisocyanate component, the other contains a reagent that forms a polymer through reaction with the polyisocyanate.    USE - To deposit a three-dimensional formation on a substrate, using jets to carry the reagents which are to be mixed and set. Very diverse objects can be produced e.g. casings, gear wheels, models and prototypes especially. The method simplifies and economizes considerably in comparison with cited earlier laser stereo lithographic processes. Micron-sized objects can be formed e.g. on printed sheet. Braille characters can be printed.    ADVANTAGE - Excess material on the formation, is avoided. During construction the object produced is continuously visible, for practical purposes. Solid objects, sheets or layers can be produced, in an automatically-controlled operation. Because there is no excess, there is no reworking required, and no material has to be recycled. ADVANTAGE - Polycarbonate-based molding materials with high stability, high resistance to yellowing, high resistance to chemicals (high swelling resistance), good scratch resistance, impact strength and dimensional stability (especially under thermal stress), high resistance to UV, heat ageing and weathering (with good retention of surface gloss), good fire resistance, low permeability to liquids and gases and good recycling properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The use of thermoplastic materials other than ABS as molding materials for the production of outdoor play equipment or housings or parts for such equipment is claimed. These materials contain (A) 1-48 wt.% mono- or multi-phase emulsion polymer(s) with a glass transition temperature (Tg) below 0 degreesC in at least one phase and an average particle size (d50) of 50-1000 nm, (B) 1-48 wt.% amorphous or partly crystalline polymer(s), (C) 51-98 wt.% polycarbonate and (D) 0-47 wt.% normal additives and/or fibrous fillers and/or particulate fillers.    An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for play equipment or housings or parts for such equipment made from these materials, especially children's play equipment, play houses, garden scenery, climbing scenery, model building articles, garden toys or toy vehicles.  OSORIO RINCON W;  DE LA CRUZ MESA R;  MILLAN VIVAS R;  GARCIA A V M;  OSORIO R W;  DE LA CRUZ M R;  MILLAN V R I	GARCIA ALARCON V (ALAR-Individual);  OSORIO RINCON W (RINC-Individual);  DE LA CRUZ MESA R (MESA-Individual);  MILLAN VIVAS R (VIVA-Individual);  GARCIA A V M (GARC-Individual);  OSORIO R W (OSOR-Individual);  DE LA CRUZ M R (DCRU-Individual);  MILLAN V R I (MILL-Individual)	201522224V	   NOVELTY - The method involves introducing laterite into a vessel where the laterite is pulverized and dehydrated at a temperature of approximately 250 degrees C. The dehydrated and pulverized heated laterite is transferred into a heated mixing device and powdered polymers are introduced into the heated mixing device. The laterite and the polymers are mixed under controlled heating until reaching the melting temperature of the polymers. A resulting mixture is poured into a brick mold and pressure of approximately 1500 pound/square inch (psi) is applied until the mixture is cooled and cured.    USE - Method for manufacturing brick composed of fused mixture of laterite, polymers and aggregates, for use in construction, electrical insulation, thermal insulation and waterproofing.    ADVANTAGE - The brick that is obtained is fabricated at a low cost because the brick is fabricated by the usage of raw materials such as polymers and laterite that are abundant waste and are recyclable. The material obtained by the fused combination of these two components is highly resistant to other substances such as acids and alkalis and provided with an excellent properties in terms of resistance. And ensures ecological recycling of waste materials discarded as garbage and not suitable for other recycling applications and is recycled and reused as raw material. Hence the brick is made ideal for usage in construction due to the improved properties and the excellent resistance to flammability. The usage of naturally occurring laterite and inexpensive recycled waste polymers makes unnecessary to use higher quality and more expensive, virgin materials. The construction material obtained from compaction processes is dimensionally stable and susceptible to a variety of high quality finishes. The resulting material is provided with a homogeneous structure that makes resistant to high mechanical loads. The material is provided with a high durability, excellent wear resistance and resistance to breakage and impact as a result of the energy absorbing qualities of polymers, good machinability in the processes of drilling, sawing and turning, excellent barrier properties due to low water absorption, excellent resistance to transmission of electrical current and heat conduction and compactable with cement, concrete, additives, colorants, glass and wood with excellent resistance to flammability and self-extinguishing characteristics.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows an isometric view of a complex-shaped brick. Portland cement, 600-1200 pts. wt. recycled fine aggregate, 600-1200 pts. wt. recycled coarse aggregate, 1-10 pts. wt. water reducing agent, 0.01-3 pts. wt. antifoaming agent and 50-140 pts. wt. hollow beads for filling the entrained air generated by recycled fine aggregate and/or recycled coarse aggregate. The water reducing agent includes polycarboxylic acid. The antifoaming agent includes silicone- or alcohol-based antifoaming agent. The composition further comprises 1 pts. wt. functional additive comprising 100 pts. wt. binder, 12 pts. wt. titanium tetra isopropoxide, 0.3 pts. wt. platinum ions, 12 pts. wt. polyphenylmethylsiloxane, 40 pts. wt. polydimethoxysilane, 5 pts. wt. polychlorinated phosphonitrile, 3.8 pts. wt. isotope, 2 pts. wt. vinyl acetate, 0.1 pts. wt. zinc hydroxide and 0.1 pts. wt. oxirane polymer, where the functional additive is nitrogen oxide, organic halogen compounds and odor gases present in the atmosphere.    USE - The concrete composition is useful for construction work.    ADVANTAGE - The composition improves physical properties by removing the entrained air generated during concrete production and replacing it with a hollow bead instead of the embedded air. The hollow beads have excellent bonding strength with cement and have the effect of increasing the low freeze-thaw resistance according to the use of recycled aggregate by being evenly dispersed in the concrete.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A concrete composition comprises 350 pts. wt. Portland cement, 600-1200 pts. wt. recycled fine aggregate having particle diameter of 0.1-5 mm, 600-1200 pts. wt. recycled coarse aggregate having a particle diameter 5-25 mm, 1-10 pts. wt. water reducing agent, 0.01-3 pts. wt. antifoaming agent and 50-140 pts. wt. hollow beads for filling the entrained air generated by recycled fine aggregate and/or recycled coarse aggregate. The water reducing agent includes polycarboxylic acid-based water reducing agent. The antifoaming agent includes silicone- or alcohol-based antifoaming agent. The density of the hollow beads is 0.90-1.20 g/cm3. The composition further comprises 1 pts. wt. functional additive comprising 100 pts. wt. binder, 12 pts. wt. titanium tetra isopropoxide, 0.3 pts. wt. platinum ions, 12 pts. wt. polyphenylmethylsiloxane, 40 pts. wt. polydimethoxysilane, 5 pts. wt. polychlorinated phosphonitrile, 3.8 pts. wt. isotope, 2 pts. wt. vinyl acetate, 0.1 pts. wt. zinc hydroxide and 0.1 pts. wt. oxirane polymer, where the functional additive is nitrogen oxide, organic halogen compounds and odor gases present in the atmosphere. An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for manufacturing the concrete composition. A portion or all of dehydration solvent used in the dehydration process, is distilled. Thus, the dehydrated product is manufactured.    USE - For manufacturing dehydrated product used as raw material for forming cement additive, polymer dispersion, concrete admixture, calcium carbonate, carbon black, ink, scale preventing agent , dispersant for plaster-water slurry, dispersant for coal-water slurry and thickener.    ADVANTAGE - Since the dehydration solvent is recycled effectively, the manufacturing cost of dehydrated product is reduced efficiently. The quality of the dehydrated product is improved.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The dehydrated product is esterified product of (meth)acrylic acid and alcohol. The alcohol is represented by formula: R1O(R2O)nH, where R1 is 1-30C hydrocarbon, R2O is 2-18C oxyalkylene group, and n is average addition number-of-moles of oxyalkylene group, which is preferably 0-300. USE - Master batch composition or bio-assimilation                masterbatch is used to transform the polyethylene                structure into low molecular weight, hydrophilic                intermediates.    ADVANTAGE - A bio-assimilation masterbatch is used to                transform the polyethylene structure into low                molecular weight, hydrophilic intermediates that                will subsequently undergo microbial                bio-assimilation in both aerobic and anaerobic                environments. This process transfers the inherent                carbon in the polyolefin, both virgin and recycled                hydrocarbon, into the natural background of the                environment. A significant amount of this carbon is                utilized in cell wall growth and the creation of                biomass. The antioxidants are combined as a                synergistic package optimized for the required life                and service condition of the article. The active                ingredients are formulated within a suitable                polymer carrier resin to produce a bio-assimilation                masterbatch that can be introduced into the polymer                at the point of conversion to the final                article.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method                of manufacturing a polymer-based article, which                involves: (a) mixing a set of additives with a                carrier resin to form a masterbatch; and (b) mixing                the master batch with a host polymer to form an                end-use polymer.    (4) manufacturing a completely recyclable roofing sheet, preferably the above mentioned roofing sheet, comprising (a) providing the carrier inlay with a melting temperature, and (b) depositing the bituminous covering layer having a softening temperature on carrier inlay, where the steps (a) and (b) are carried out at a production temperature, which is smaller than the melting temperature of the carrier inlay and greater than the softening temperature of the bituminous covering layer; and    (5) completely recycling the above mentioned roofing sheet, comprising (i) providing the roofing sheet with the bituminous covering layer having a softening temperature and the carrier inlay with the melting temperature, and (ii) melting the roofing sheet at a recycling temperature, which is less than 230 degrees C. DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the following:    (1) preparation of phosphorylated graphene oxide additive, which involves reacting phosphoric acid and graphite oxide at 50 degrees C for 12 hours, washing with water until the pH is 4-5, and drying at 70 degrees C. The usage amount of phosphoric acid is 70-90 ml with respect to 1 g graphite oxide; and    (2) preparation of suspension of aqueous drilling fluid formulation, which involves preparing a suspension composition comprising 319 g water, 6 g bentonite, 0.6 g potassium hydroxide, 34 g potassium chloride, 1.7 g diazo group-containing polymer, 4 g low-molecular weight polyanionic cellulose polymer, 4 g starch, 2.4 g graphite oxide/phosphorylated graphene oxide, and 26 g drilling fluid, stirring at low speed for 5 minutes, aging, placing obtained product in a hot-roller oven, pressurizing at 100 psi and 275 F for 16 hours, removing, cooling, and performing rheological testing and API filter test of obtained drilling fluid. USE - For making an adhesive material to replace                asphalt in manufacturing roof shingles and                pavement; and for making bio-based adhesive for                coating or to replace or serve as an additive for                asphalt, sealant, and polymers in manufacturing                building or paving materials (claimed); and for                ultraviolet-light-blocking coating.    ADVANTAGE - The adhesive material is manufactured using                recycled agricultural byproducts (preferably waste                cooking oils, and a powdered material), which is                recycled coal-fired power plant waste, and fly ash.                The method is environmentally friendly; and                produces bio-based adhesive material at low cost                with improved durability of the bioasphalt, such as                penetration and softening point.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method                (M2) of making a bio-based adhesive for a coating                or to replace or serve as an additive for asphalt,                sealant, or polymers in manufacturing building or                paving materials, involving: forming a mixture of                oil comprising fatty acids, and a powdered material                operable to facilitate polymerization of the oil;                maintaining the oil-to-powdered-material weight                ratio in the mixture to 0.00001-1 and 1-20;                polymerizing the oil and creating the adhesive by                heating the mixture to a reaction temperature of                greater than 55 degrees C; maintaining the reaction                temperature until the oil is polymerized; and                injecting air into the mixture while polymerizing                the oil. USE - The polymer is useful: for coating a surface, manufacturing 3D article and recycling coating or formed article; and in films, coatings or shaped articles (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The polymer can be: easily degraded and recycled without the use of chemicals, but by appropriately selecting the conditions that induce a retro-cycloaddition reaction; can be produced by polymerization in melt phase with very less quantity of solvent or no solvent at all, thus eliminating the cost and environmental consequences of using a solvent, and further improving the compatibility of the reaction with equipment normally used for extrusion, compression molding or 3D printing.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Polymer comprising recurring units obtainable by cycloaddition reaction of at least one monomer of formula (A) comprising at least two optionally substituted anthracenyl rings (AnR) and optionally at least one monomer (B) comprising at least two moieties are able to react in a cycloaddition reaction with the optionally substituted AnR of monomer (A), is new.    W1 = bond, atom or -O-, -C(O)-, -NH-, -S-, -SO2-, -C(CH3)2- or -C(CF3)2-, more preferably -O-, -C(O)- or -SO2-, or aromatic, aliphatic of cycloaliphatic moiety, where the moiety optionally comprising one or several optionally substituted anthracenyl rings (AnR), the moiety optionally comprising at least one atom or moiety comprising -O-, -C(O)-, -NH-, -S-, -SO2-, -C(CH3)2- or -C(CF3)2- and the moiety optionally comprising one or several groups R;    R = halo or alkyl, optionally branched, preferably 1-18C alkyl (optionally substituted by one or several halo); and    a = 0 or 1-18, preferably 0.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for:    (1) coating (M1) a surface, comprising applying the monomer (A) and optionally the monomer (B), optionally in combination with at least one solvent and/or additive to the surface and irradiating the surface at a wavelength of 300-600 nm, preferably 350-400 nm, or applying the monomer (A) and optionally the monomer (B), optionally in combination with at least one solvent and/or additive to the surface and heating the surface at a temperature of 60-25 degrees C, preferably 65-200 degrees C;    (2) manufacturing (M2) a three-dimensional (3D) article, comprising preparing a polymer formulation (F) comprising the monomer (A), at least one solvent, optionally the monomer (B) and optionally at least one additive, and printing layers of the 3D article from the polymer formulation (F); and    (3) recycling (M3) a coating or a formed article comprising the polymer, comprising submitting the coating or formed article to UV irradiation at a wavelengths lower than 300 nm, or submitting the coating or formed article to heating at a temperature of 100-500 degrees C. The                material (M) has particle size of d50 of 20-100 mu                m, as measured by laser scattering in isopropanol,                and comprises at least one semi crystalline polymer                or copolymer (P). The component (P) has melting                temperature of 230 degrees C or more. The portion                bed temperature (Tb) is lesser than the processing                temperature (Tp). The glass transition temperature                (Tm), portion bed temperature (Tb) and melting                temperature (Tm) of the component (P) satisfy                specific relation.    USE - Additive manufacturing process used for                forming three-dimensional article (claimed). Uses                include but are not limited to implantable device,                medical device, dental prostheses, brackets and                complex shaped components used in aerospace                industry and under-the-hood components in                automotive industry.    ADVANTAGE - The method provides the three-dimensional                article having excellent mechanical properties such                as stiffness, compression strength, impact                strength, tensile and flexural strength, elongation                at break and heat distortion. The powder can be                reused in laser sintering three-dimensional                printing process, without impacting the appearance                and mechanical performances of the resulting                printed article. By reducing the temperature of the                portion bed (Tb), the polyphenylene sulfide has                excellent stability, longevity and recyclability,                and reduces the energy consumption during the                printing process.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Additive manufacturing process involves                applying successive layers of a powdered polymer                material (M) at portion bed of a selective laser                sintering printer, heating the layer of powdered                polymer material (M) to be printed at a processing                temperature (Tp), and selectively sintering each                layer prior to deposition of the subsequent layer,                and maintaining the printed portion and unsintered                material (M1) at portion bed temperature (Tb) until                the three-dimensional article is completed. The                material (M) has particle size of d50 of 20-100 mu                m, as measured by laser scattering in isopropanol,                and comprises at least one semi crystalline polymer                or copolymer (P). The component (P) has melting                temperature (Tm) of 230 degrees C or more. The                portion bed temperature (Tb) is lesser than the                processing temperature (Tp). The melting                temperature (Tm) and glass transition temperature                (Tm) of component (P) are measured by differential                scanning calorimetry at 20 degrees C/minute                according to ASTM D3418. The glass transition                temperature (Tm), portion bed temperature (Tb) and                melting temperature (Tm) of the component (P)                satisfy the relation: Tg not less than Tb not less                than Tm-40 degrees C. The processing temperature                (Tp) is in the range of (Tm-40 degrees C)-(Tm)                (excluding Tm-40 degrees C and Tm). INDEPENDENT                CLAIMS are included for the following:    (1) recycled powder material; and    (2) blend of powder materials. R05086 ; R01278 ; R01359 ; R01778 ; R05085 		CN101220148-A;  CN101220148-B	Manufacturing of poly(p-phenylene terephthalamide) resin for continuous producing by low-temperature pre-polycondensation reaction, pumping the solution, adding polyethylene pyrrolidone, washing, dehydrating and drying	CAO Y;  ZHOU Z;  YOU X;  LIU Z	JIANGSU HAOCHENG LEATHER NEW MATERIAL CO LTD (JIAN-Non-standard);  JIANGSU HAOCHENG LEATHER NEW MATERIAL CO (JIAN-Non-standard)	2009A36041	   NOVELTY - Manufacturing of poly(p-phenylene terephthalamide) resin, involves low-temperature pre-polycondensation reaction with para-phenylene diamine and paraphthaloyl chloride in solvent system; pumping the solution along with prepolymer; extruding the reaction mixture and adding polyethylene pyrrolidone; washing polymer extruded using ice water; and dehydrating and drying the polymer to obtain straw-colored polymer powder of poly(p-phenylene terephthalamide).    USE - Manufacturing of poly(p-phenylene terephthalamide) resin for continuous producing (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The poly(p-phenylene terephthalamide) produced by the invention has simple and stable technology. The product of the invention has fine vivid color and luster, strong intensity, high modulus, stable performance, and good spinnability.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Manufacturing of poly(p-phenylene terephthalamide) resin, involves (1) dissolving para-phenylene diamine and 50-95% paraphthaloyl chloride in solvent system for low-temperature pre-polycondensation reaction; (2) dissolving the remaining 5-50% paraphthaloyl chloride in solvent to prepare into 30-70% solution, pumping it along with prepolymer into pre-polycondensation reaction screw extruder; (3) extruding the reaction mixture, adding macromolecule additive polyethylene pyrrolidone; (4) washing polymer extruded using ice water, processing the washing liquid using calcium carbonate and calcium hydroxide to be neutral, recycling the solvent; (5) dehydrating and drying the polymer to obtain straw-colored polymer powder of poly(p-phenylene terephthalamide) with logarithmic viscosity number of 4-7.5 dl/g. USE - The process is useful for manufacturing a biodegradable synthetic polymeric material, preferably plastic bag.    ADVANTAGE - The process: utilizes degrading substances that allow to work with recycled and/or original material from different sources, and thus provides the biodegradable polymeric material which is environmental friendly and has low- or high-density, and whose lifespan can be programmed; is industrial process, which ensures the maintenance of the physical and mechanical properties required by the polymer during its manufacture and then in its commercial performance, e.g. the conservation of properties e.g. elongation, hardness and strength comparable to non-degradable conventional materials; and utilizes degrading organic additive for the recycled synthetic polymer and/or original material which potentializes its decomposition in normal environmental conditions.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for:    (1) a polymer degrading substance A, comprising 15-23 wt.% betaine, 10-17 wt.% cassava (yuca) starch, 10-15 wt.% carrot carotene, 35-48 wt.% water, and 0.001-10 wt.% carbon monoxide in relation to the weight of the total degrading substance;    (2) a polymer degrading substance B, comprising 8-15 wt.% cassava (yuca) starch, 18-22 wt.% betaine, 4-9 wt.% maize glucose and 40-58 wt.% water in relation to the weight of the total degrading substance;    (3) a polymer degrading substance A and B, where the volume mixture ratio between the polymer degrading substance A and the polymer degrading substance B is 28% A and 70% B up to 70% A and 28% B and completing a volume with a carboxylic acid comprising formic acid, acetic acid and/or propanoic acid; and    (4) a biodegradable, synthetic polymeric material, comprising 89-98.8% a polymer and an additive comprising a substance A containing 15-23 wt.% betaine, 10-17 wt.% cassava (yuca) starch, 10-15 wt.% carrot carotene, 35-48 wt.% water, and 0.001-10 (preferably 0.1-5) wt.% carbon monoxide in relation to the weight of the total degrading substance and a substance B containing 8-15 wt.% cassava (yuca) starch, 18-22 wt.% betaine, 4-9 wt.% maize glucose in relation to the weight of the total degrading substance and 40-58 wt.% water and carboxylic acid comprising formic acid, propanoic acid and/or acetic acid. RANDALL D K;  RANDALL D J	ALCAN INT LTD (ALCN-C);  ALCAN INT LTD (ALCN-C)	1991058085	      Metal stannate prod. is pptd. by addn. of solid metal oxide, hydroxide or carbonate to an aq. stannate soln. Pref. oxides, hydroxides and carbonates are those of Zn, Mg, Ca, Ba or Bi and aq. soln. is sodium or potassium stannate in a stoichiometric excess. Aq. starting soln. is partic. obtd. by heating cassiterite under pressure with alkali soln. Amts. of solid reagent utilised is stoichiometrically no more than the amt. of tin in soln. GEBAUER M;  PFITZNER R;  BEER H;  BURKHARDT K	LEUNA-WERKE GMBH (VELW-C)	1996231678	      A process is claimed for processing waste plastics (I) for raw materials recycling by the method described in DE4329458-A1. This comprises melting (I) (previously freed from metals and rough impurities) in an extruder (A) and heating to more than 400 C by friction and external heating, maintaining a temp. of more than 400 C over the entire length of the extruder, transferring to a stirred reactor (B) and subjecting to further de-compsn. at more than 400 C. Cleavage gases etc., are removed via degassing systems on (A) and/or (B), suitable additives are added to (A) and/or (B) in the case of plastics contg. halogen and/or with a greater tendency to coke prodn., and reactive gases may be injected into (B). The novelty is that low-mol. wt. by-prods. of highly variable quality from the prodn. of standard polymers, i.e., ''slack'' (II), is added to material (I) (except in the case of acrylic resin, esp. PMMA): (a) at the inlet to extruder (A) in amts. of 0.1-5 wt.% and at 150-230 C; and/or (b) at the inlet to reactor (B) in amts. of 0.1-5 wt.% and 230-280 C; and/or (c) at the outlet from (B) in amts. of up to 50 wt.% at 150-230 C.    USE -   Used for recycling raw materials from waste plastics and mixts. thereof.    ADVANTAGE -   Provides an economical and environmentally sensible use for low mol.wt. by-prods. from the mfr. of polymers. USE - For manufacture of polyelectrolyte (claimed) useful as coagulant for waste water treatment, an additive for cement, a material for fluidizing coal slurry, dispersant for inorganic pigment, material for reinforcing paper, a surface sizing material for paper, conductive material for an electronic copying machine, a destaticizer, a scale preventive material, dispersant for emulsion polymerization and aqueous glue.    ADVANTAGE - The method produces polyelectrolyte containing no halogen compound; prevents discharge of a large quantity of toxic wastes; provides a water-soluble polyelectrolyte having larger molecular weight; enable a solvent used in a sulfonating reaction of aromatic polymers to be recovered in a state where no water is contained and to form an efficient sulfonating system by recycling the solvent; and separates halogen flame retardant containing plastic waste.  BEURICH H;  WAHL F	BENCKISER-KNAPSACK GMBH (BENC-C)	1987065627	      In prodn. of paper, 0.01-1%, on wt. dry substance, of cationic polymer (I) claimed in DE3432569 is added to the pulp in dewatering stage and/or to improve retention. (I) are prods. obtd. by reacting polyacrylonitrile or acrylonitrile copolymer with a polyamine in presence of an alcohol or polyol using an S-contg. catalyst.    Agent for accelerating dewatering, dry-strengthening, and improving retention capacity for use in paper mfr., contg. a (I) is claimed. Pref. (I) is added as 4-20% aq. soln.    ADVANTAGE -   (I) have high activity, additives to improve dry strength are not needed; increased strength permits use of short fibred or poorer quality stock, including recycled paper, to obtain sheets of good strength; (I) are free from toxic impurities as only small amt. of S-contg. catalyst is required in prepn. of (I). ADVANTAGE -   (I) have high activity, additives to improve dry strength are not needed; increased strength permits use of short fibred or poorer quality stock, including recycled paper, to obtain sheets of good strength; (I) are free from toxic impurities as only small amt. of S-contg. catalyst is required in prepn. of (I). USE - The gel-like support material (A) is used in                an additive manufacturing method of a                three-dimensional article (claimed), and as an                actuator for robotics, a gasket, a mechanical piece                for automotive/aeronautics, a piece for electronic                devices, a package for the encapsulation of                components, a vibrational isolator, and an impact                isolator or a noise isolator.    ADVANTAGE - The method provides three-dimensional article                with complex shape, easily removes the used                support, is easy to implement, and recycles the                support.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method                for additive manufacture of a three-dimensional                article made of a cured material using a 3D printer                and the gel-like support material (A), comprising                (i) printing at least one part of a curable                precursor of a cured material to provide a printed                part of the curable composition, (ii) printing at                least one part of the gel-like support material (A)                for providing a supporting structure for preventing                distortions and collapses within printed parts of                the curable composition, where steps (i) and (ii)                are done simultaneously or successively in any                order, (iii) optionally repeating step (i) and/or                step (ii), and (iv) allowing the curable                composition to cure, optionally by heating to                obtain the three-dimensional article comprising a                cured material. The                butadiene-styrene polymerizate is prepared using an                electron donor additive (ED) comprising at least                two heteroatoms, aliphatic potassium alkoxide, an                organolithium initiator, and a chain-end modifier                chosen from compounds containing oxygen atom(s) and                silicon atom(s). The polybutadiene polymerizate is                prepared in the presence of a catalyst complex of                an organoaluminum compound with neodymium                compounds, using branching agent(s) containing tin                atom(s).    USE - Polymer composition used in rubber mixtures                for producing tire used for truck (all                claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The polymer composition has excellent wear                resistance, resistance to multiple bending,                elasticity, elastic-hysteresis properties, and                frost resistance, and low-content of vinyl groups,                and is manufactured with reduced energy consumption                associated with the recovery of a recycled solvent.                The rubber mixture containing the polymer                composition has excellent elasticity, and frost                resistance, and stably produces tires with                high-quality, high-adhesion to wet road surface,                and low-rolling resistance.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the                following:    (1) preparation of polymer composition, which                involves mixing butadiene-styrene polymerizate and                polybutadiene polymerizate at a weight ratio of 1:1                in a device equipped with a stirrer at 70-100                degrees C for 20-40 minutes; and    (2) rubber mixture, which comprises the                polymer composition and an addition additive. USE - Composition is used for manufacturing java agricultural containers by injection for multiple uses.    ADVANTAGE - The composition overcomes the disadvantages of the aforementioned container as it develops improvements in polymeric compositions in the manufacturing process and allows to massify the production of structurally resistant containers and with significant advantages in the reduction of production costs, and contributes to the recycling of PET by reducing environmental effects.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM os included for obtaining a mixture of a composition for the manufacture of jaba agricultural containers by injection for multiple uses, which involves incorporating a 100 wt.% polyethylene terephthalate (PET) mixer and 0.1-10% w/w with respect to the total weight of terephthalate polyethylene ( PET), of one impact additive selected from the group consisting of Polycarbonate, polypropylene, HDPE, LDPE, polystyrene and a functional polymer Amplify GR216 or mixtures, leave mixing for a time between 5-20 minutes, then unloading the mixture in a hopper, and preheating the mixture in a heating container at a temperature between 50-90 degrees C for a time between 30-60 minutes, heating the mixture in the decathiation container at a temperature between 150-250 degrees C, for a time between 5-20 minutes, cooling the mixture in a cooling tank from there, leaving in the form of strands through the water towards drying, and allowing to dry and through a pull the resulting composition is cut by cutting roller. 			A32 (Polymer fabrication - such as moulding, extrusion, forming, laminating, spinning.);  A18 (Addition polymers in general.);  A23 (Polyamides; polyesters. (including polycarbonates, polyesteramides); alkyds; other unsaturated polymers.);  A92 (Packaging and containers - including ropes and nets.);  T01 (Digital Computers)	A04-F05;  A04-G01E;  A05-E04E;  A08-M01B;  A08-M09B;  A10-E03;  A10-E23;  A11-A03;  A11-A04;  A12-P01B;  A12-W04;  T01-F07	C08L-023/06;  B29C-045/00	MX2017010589-A1   07 Mar 2019   C08L-023/06   201955Pages: 17   Spanish	MX2017010589-A1    MX010589    17 Aug 2017		MX010589    17 Aug 2017					790-0-0-0 ; 1145-0-0-0 ; 368-0-0-0 ; 621-0-0-0 ; 1013-0-0-0 			R00843 ; R00964 ; R00708 ; R00338 ; R00326 		CN102489188-A;  CN102489188-B	Polysulfone absorbent blending film used for            recycling oil gas, is obtained by defoaming            film-forming liquid under vacuum, coating on glass            plate with scraper, dipping in deionized water bath gel            and drying	HUANG W;  WANG W	UNIV CHANGZHOU (UNCZ-C)	2012J07470	   NOVELTY - A polysulfone absorbent blending film is                obtained by defoaming film-forming liquid under                vacuum, coating on a glass plate with scraper,                dipping in deionized water bath gel and drying in                air. The defoaming film-forming liquid is obtained                by dissolving polysulfone in a solvent, adding                additive at constant temperature, and subjecting                polymer solution to water bath stewing until the                solution does not contain bubbles. The polysulfone                absorbent blending film has two layers of porous                polysulfone as supporting surface layer and inner                portion filled with absorbent.    USE - Polysulfone absorbent blending film is used                for recycling oil gas.    ADVANTAGE - The polysulfone absorbent blending film has                excellent permeation flux and separation effect,                and can be manufactured efficiently by simple                method without affecting the environment.
