 US2022348734-A1	Process for recycling waste used for forming e.g.            recycled thermoplastic polymer, involves dissolving            thermoplastic polymer waste and/or thermoplastic            copolymer waste in solvent, heating, cooling, treating            obtained supernatant, and drying	COTE R;  AND C	POLYSTYVERT INC (POLY-Non-standard);  POLYSTYVERT INC (POLY-Non-standard);  POLYSTYVERT INC (POLY-Non-standard);  POLYSTYVERT INC (POLY-Non-standard);  POLYSTYVERT INC (POLY-Non-standard)	202035960P	   NOVELTY - Process for recycling waste which is                thermoplastic polymer waste and/or thermoplastic                copolymer waste, involves dissolving thermoplastic                polymer waste and/or thermoplastic copolymer waste                in suitable solvent, heating obtained mixture under                acidic conditions, cooling the mixture to obtain a                supernatant comprising thermoplastic polymer in                solution and/or thermoplastic copolymer in solution                and a solid waste residue and optionally heating                the mixture under acidic conditions in the presence                of a reducing agent, separating the obtained                supernatant, optionally treating the obtained                supernatant with a filtration aid to remove                insoluble gels, contacting the supernatant                comprising dissolved thermoplastic polymer with a                portion (s1) of non-solvent to obtain precipitated                thermoplastic polymer, and optionally drying the                washed or twice-washed thermoplastic polymer and/or                washed or twice-washed thermoplastic copolymer to                obtain dried thermoplastic polymer and/or dried                thermoplastic copolymer.    USE - Process for recycling waste e.g. thermoplastic                polymer waste and/or thermoplastic copolymer waste                or polystyrene waste and/or polystyrene copolymer                waste such as post-industrial or post-consumer                thermoplastic polymer waste and polystyrene waste                obtained from industrial or domestic polymer waste                e.g. high impact polystyrene waste,                styrene-butadiene block copolymer waste,                styrene-butadiene random copolymer waste or Kraton                (RTM: styrenic block copolymer) waste used for                manufacturing recycled thermoplastic polymer and/or                thermoplastic copolymer and recycled polystyrene                and/or recycled polystyrene copolymer for preparing                mixture (all claimed). Uses include but are not                limited to cabinet materials, electric appliances,                insulation boards and packaging materials.    ADVANTAGE - The method enables recycling of waste which is                thermoplastic polymer waste and/or thermoplastic                copolymer waste with improved purity and reduced                degree of contamination.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Process for recycling waste which is                thermoplastic polymer waste and/or thermoplastic                copolymer waste, involves dissolving the                thermoplastic polymer waste and/or thermoplastic                copolymer waste in a suitable solvent to obtain a                mixture of liquid and solids, heating the mixture                under acidic conditions, cooling the mixture to                obtain a supernatant comprising thermoplastic                polymer in solution and/or thermoplastic copolymer                in solution and a solid waste residue and                optionally heating the mixture under acidic                conditions in the presence of a reducing agent,                separating the supernatant comprising dissolved                thermoplastic polymer and/or dissolved                thermoplastic copolymer from the solid waste                residue, optionally treating the obtained                supernatant with a filtration aid to remove                insoluble gels, contacting the supernatant                comprising dissolved thermoplastic polymer and/or                dissolved thermoplastic copolymer with a portion                (s1) of non-solvent to obtain precipitated                thermoplastic polymer and/or precipitated                thermoplastic copolymer and a portion (w1) of waste                solution, separating the precipitated thermoplastic                polymer and/or precipitated thermoplastic copolymer                from the portion (w1) of waste solution, washing                the precipitated thermoplastic polymer and/or                precipitated thermoplastic copolymer with a portion                (s2) of non-solvent to obtain a washed                thermoplastic polymer and/or washed thermoplastic                copolymer and a portion (w2) of waste solution,                separating the washed thermoplastic polymer and/or                washed thermoplastic copolymer from the portion                (w2) of waste solution, optionally washing the                washed thermoplastic polymer and/or washed                thermoplastic copolymer with a portion (s3) of                non-solvent to obtain a twice-washed thermoplastic                polymer and/or twice-washed thermoplastic copolymer                and a portion (w3) of waste solution, optionally                separating the twice-washed thermoplastic polymer                and/or twice-washed thermoplastic copolymer from                the portion (w3) of waste solution, and optionally                drying the washed or twice-washed thermoplastic                polymer and/or washed or twice-washed thermoplastic                copolymer to obtain dried thermoplastic polymer                and/or dried thermoplastic copolymer. INDEPENDENT                CLAIMS are included for the following:    (1) process of recycling waste which is                polystyrene waste and/or polystyrene copolymer                waste, which involves dissolving the polystyrene                waste and/or polystyrene copolymer waste in cymene,                xylene or ethylbenzene to obtain a mixture;    (2) recycled polystyrene copolymer, which is                obtained by recycling the polystyrene copolymer                waste by the above treatment with a solvent and a                non-solvent and comprises less than 0.5 wt.%,                preferably less than 0.1 wt.% additive(s) and                cymene, xylene, toluene and/or benzene;    (3) use of recycled polystyrene copolymer for                preparing mixture comprising 10 wt.% or more,                preferably 80 wt.% or more recycled polystyrene                copolymer and a virgin polystyrene and/or a virgin                polystyrene copolymer;    (4) usage method of recycled polystyrene                copolymer, which involves mixing the recycled                polystyrene copolymer with a virgin polystyrene                and/or a virgin polystyrene copolymer;    (5) recycled thermoplastic polymer and/or                recycled thermoplastic copolymer, which is prepared                by recycling thermoplastic polymer waste and/or                thermoplastic copolymer waste; and    (6) use of recycled thermoplastic polymers                and/or recycled thermoplastics copolymers for                preparing a mixture comprising 10 wt.% or more,                preferably 80 wt.% or more recycled thermoplastic                polymers and/or recycled thermoplastics copolymers                and a virgin thermoplastic polymer and/or a virgin                thermoplastic copolymer. USE - For wrapping asphalt concrete.    ADVANTAGE - Flow resistant or drainable additive for wrapping asphalt concrete is simply and uniformly produced without causing any damage to the device for its production. It is uniformly mixed in practical use, and the adhesive force between asphalt and aggregate is also increased.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method of manufacturing the additive granule, which involves: storing cellulose single yarn produced by grinding and melting natural pulp, recycled paper or disposed paper in a first cellulose fiber storage tank (3); storing measured mineral powder in a mineral powder tank (10); storing measured aqueous solution produced by dissolving water soluble polymer in lower alcohol or water, in aqueous solution storage tank (8); mixing micro-cellulose single yarn, mineral powder, aqueous solution in a double paddle mixer (5) and delivering to a second cellulose fiber storage tank (14); delivering the mixture in the second cellulose fiber storage tank to a pellet machine by screw conveyor (15) and pelletizing; drying the formed pellet in a cold chamber (18), while collecting dust by using cyclone (25), and; delivering the dried pellet to storage chamber and packaging into a certain unit. Patent KR2001025392	KR080066    22 Dec 2000			;  KR389136-B1 -- JP10167792-A   NIPPON ELECTRIC GLASS CO (NIUM)   IMAI K;  KR99011444-A   KOREA HIGHWAY CORP (KOHI-Non-standard);  LEE G H (LEEG-Individual)   OK C G;  KR99084150-A   KOREA CHEM CO LTD (KCCK)   KANG B D,  YOON G J,  LEE B G,  SOHN J R;  KR2000002469-A   HANBON IND CO LTD (HANB-Non-standard);  KR2000013590-A   YOON J D (YOON-Individual)   YOON J D;  KR2000018174-A   SS IND JH (SSIN-Non-standard)   KWON N							GB2467392-A;  EP2216365-A1	Composite material for producing wood-plastic type composite used for constructing building or packaging products contains at least one polymer and filler material such as de-inking residue (DIR) having predetermined moisture content	CHRISTMAS P	SALVTECH LTD (SALV-Non-standard);  SALVTECH LTD (SALV-Non-standard)	2010J92854	   NOVELTY - The composite material contains at least one polymer material and filler material. The filler material is DIR with moisture content of 6 percent or below. The 10 to 80 percent of the composite material is consists of DIR, and the rest is filler material. At least one polymer material is selected from virgin plastics such as one or mixture of low density polyethylenes e.g. linear low density polyethylene (LLDPE), low density polyethylene (LDPE), high density polyethylene (HDP), polypropylene (PP) and Polyvinylchloride(PVC) and recycled plastics.    USE - Composite material for producing wood-plastic type composite used for constructing building or packaging products.    ADVANTAGE - Produces composite material that are made from mixture of recycled products. Ensures particle size of the composite material by effectively mixing its DIR and polymer material contents. Can be used as effective replacement for existing chipboard or oriented strand board (OSB) material.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The composite material contains at least one polymer material and filler material. The filler material is DIR with moisture content of 6 percent or below. The 10 to 80 percent of the composite material is consists of DIR, and the rest is filler material. At least one polymer material is selected from virgin plastics such as one or mixture of low density polyethylenes e.g. linear low density polyethylene (LLDPE), low density polyethylene (LDPE), high density polyethylene (HDP), polypropylene (PP) and Polyvinylchloride(PVC) and recycled plastics. The recycled plastics can be one of mixture of mixed waste plastics(MWP's) having lightweight mixed waste plastics (LMWP's) selected from LLDPE, HDP, PP and PVC. Chemical additives are added to affect the color, flow properties, strength, water resistance and/or fire resistance of the final composite material. An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for a manufacturing method for producing composite material. Each stiffening insert (12) over-molded on one of tank body walls is formed of polymer material reinforced with continuous fibers. The insert is preferably in form of a reinforcement loop around the tank body.    USE - Fluid tank for use in motor vehicle. Uses include but are not limited to pollution control liquid for selective catalytic reduction (SCR) systems, diesel fuel additive, windshield washer fluid, engine coolant, etc.    ADVANTAGE - By replacing the metal insert with an insert made of polymer material, mechanical strength of the tank can still be improved while considerably reducing the overall weight. Omits need for depositing an anti-corrosion protection layer as well as design constraints linked to the use of steel inserts. Enables to reassemble the interface for fixing to the body in a zone higher than the joint plane of the tank. Increases the useful volume of the tank, by optimizing the thickness of the insert-wall assembly of the tank. Facilitates recycling of the tank, since it is no longer necessary to dismantle the steel inserts at the end of the vehicle's life.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for a manufacturing method of a fluid tank.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows the perspective view of a fluid tank. USE - The invention deals with process preparing paper or paper board.    ADVANTAGE - (I) has improved initial wet strength and dry strength (claimed). (I) has very high conductivity of at least 1500 mu S. The process avoids deleterious effects of cellulosic suspensions with high conductivity and containing recycled cellulosic material. (I) exhibits improved mechanical properties such as tensile index values.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Preparing paper or paper board (I) comprises providing a cellulosic suspension comprising cellulosic fibres and optionally fillers, and then dewatering the cellulosic suspension on a wire or mesh to form a sheet and drying the sheet, in which a strength additive is: included in the cellulosic suspension; or applied to the formed sheet; and a polymer comprising, a synthetic polymeric component, and a protein component containing a polysaccharide binding domain protein, where the cellulosic suspension: further comprises recycled cellulosic material; and/or has a conductivity of at least 1500 mu S (micro Siemens).  WO2001034091-A2   		8781-0-0-0 ; 49004-0-0-0 			R00444 ; R00800 		WO2017035676-A1	Manufacture of geomembrane from rubber particles involves preparing masterbatch of composition containing e.g. medium density polyethylene and rubber particles, preparing geomembrane base material, extruding, thermolaminating, and casting	BROITMAN ROJAS F;  PALZA CORDERO H C;  PIZARRO VALENZUELA F A;  VALDES BULNES C	UNIV CHILE (UYCH-Non-standard);  REUTILIZA SPA (REUT-Non-standard)	2017173245	   NOVELTY - A geomembrane is manufactured from rubber particles by preparing masterbatch by melt mixing process in a batch or a continuous mixing equipment using composition containing 25-85 wt.% medium density polyethylene (MDPE), 25-85 wt.% rubber particles, e.g. from waste tires obtained by grinding rubber, and 25-85 wt.% additives or compatibilizing resin; preparing geomembrane base material (final blend) by MDPE melt blending process and masterbatch, where the composition of the final blend is 50-70 wt.% MDPE and 30-50 wt.% premix; and carrying out extrusion, thermolamination, and casting in melt.    USE - Manufacture of geomembrane from rubber particles, e.g. off-road tires (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The formulation allows to obtain a technical improvement of the formulation of black polyethylene geomembranes, allowing the recovery and the use of carbon black and recycled rubber, in particular the rubber contained in mining tires. The waste tire particles contain the carbon black and the antioxidants that the geomembrane needs in its formulation, allowing the replacement of expensive additive by a recycled element that currently has no use and creates enormous environmental and economic problems. In addition, the properties of both materials can be combined; on the one hand, excellent chemical resistance of the polyethylene (anticorrosive material) and, on the other hand, the flexibility of the tire rubber (material of recognized elasticity) whose elastomeric character can also deliver properties of additional and improved mechanical strength of the developed material. Recycling of rubber, e.g. from end-of-life tires, gives these wastes a high added value that increases environmental sustainability of an industry which uses the geomembrane made from the waste materials of that particular industry.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A geomembrane is manufactured from rubber particles by preparing masterbatch by melt mixing process in a batch or a continuous mixing equipment using composition containing 25-85 wt.% medium density polyethylene (MDPE), 25-85 wt.% rubber particles, e.g. from waste tires obtained by grinding rubber, and 25-85 wt.% additives or compatibilizing resin; preparing geomembrane base material (final blend) by MDPE melt blending process and masterbatch, by which another controlled topology polymer matrix is incorporated, which considerably improves cavitation of rubber particles and percolation of polyethylene matrix by decreasing thickness of matrix ligament and increasing entanglement density of the material, where melt-mixing process is performed in a batch or continuous mixing equipment, and the composition of the final blend is 50-70 wt.% MDPE and 30-50 wt.% premix; and carrying out extrusion, thermolamination, and casting in melt. INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) geomembrane manufactured from rubber particles, e.g. off-road tires; and    (2) formulation which allows to considerably increase the size of the rubber particle out of use, further increase the elongation at the breaking point, and in turn, the compatibility, being in the first property superior to commercial geomembranes, comprising blend of 50-70 wt.% MDPE, 10-25 wt.% rubber particles, and 10-25 wt.% controlled topology polymer matrix. introducing at least one                stream of olefin monomer having hydrogen                concentration of 0-70 mol.% into a subsequent                polymerization zone; and removing polymer product                having polydispersity of 5-20. The polymerization                of olefin monomer is carried out in more than one                polymerization zone. The amount of hydrogen gas                provided to the reactor vessels is adjusted to                maintain a constant melt flow rate for polymer                product.    USE - As olefin polymerization process useful for                producing polymer product (claimed), particularly                polymerization or copolymerization of ethylene and                alpha-olefins such as propylene, butene-1,                pentene-1, 4-methylpentene-1, and hexene-1.    ADVANTAGE - The process allows a polyolefin polymerization                plant to be configured to produce a range of                polymer melt indexes more consistently and on                target than prior art processes. The process                provides the ability to practice a staged H2                reactor configuration with improved flexibility to                control block copolymer ratios while optimizing                reactor volume use through the ability to switch in                and out required feed and vapor offtake nozzles                along the reactor. The production split is                controlled by controlling the volume of reactor in                each H2 concentration, as well as the concentration                in each zone.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An olefin polymerization process involves:                introducing at least one stream of olefin monomer                having hydrogen concentrations of 0-70 mol.% into a                first polymerization zone; introducing at least one                stream of olefin monomer having hydrogen                concentrations of 0-70 mol.% into a subsequent                polymerization zone; and removing a polymer product                having a polydispersity of 5-20 from the last                polymerization zone, where the amount of hydrogen                gas provided to the reactor vessels by the recycle                gas feed system is adjusted to maintain a constant                melt flow rate for the polymer product. The                polymerization of olefin monomer is carried out in                more than one polymerization zone of at least one                reactor, where the polymerization process is                carried out in an apparatus comprising: a) at least                one reactor vessel to which olefin monomer and                catalyst components can be added and which contain                an agitated bed of forming polymer particles, b) at                least one valve-controlled liquid feed port in the                reactor vessels through which catalyst components                and quench liquid are added, where the catalyst                components and quench liquid are added directly                into and onto the bed of forming polymer particles,                c) a recycle gas feed system connected to at least                one valve-controlled gas feed port in the reactor                vessels through which olefin monomer and quench                liquid are provided to the reactor vessels, d) one                to n valve-controlled ports located underneath the                polymer bed through which the olefin monomer and                hydrogen gas are introduced to the reactor vessels,                where n is three quarters of the total number of                valve-controlled liquid feed ports for the monomer                and where n is three quarters of the total number                of valve-controlled gas feed ports for the hydrogen                gas; e) a take-off barrier situated at the exit end                of the reactor through which solid polymer product                is removed; f) a device for removing solid polymer                product from the take-off barrier; g) a finishing                apparatus for adding suitable additives to the                solid polymer product; and h) an extruder for                incorporating the additives into the polymer by                heating and mechanical shear and extruding the                heated polymer through a die to form discrete                pellets, where the recycle gas feed system                comprises: 1) a unit for removing reactor off-gases                along the top of the reactor; 2) a first separator                for separating the quench liquid, polymer fines and                catalyst components are separated from                polymerization monomer and hydrogen; and 3) a                second separator for separating the polymerization                monomer and hydrogen into separate recycle                streams.  EP3303478-A4;  EP3587499-A1	Polymeric composition for e.g. modified asphalt, rheological modifiers, and roofing asphalt comprises random copolymer containing distinct monomers in which a monomer is biorenewable oil, and another monomer is a thermoplastic polymer	KURTH T;  TABATABAEE H;  KUHLS T;  TABATABAEE H A	CARGILL INC (CRGI-C);  CARGILL INC (CRGI-C);  CARGILL INC (CRGI-C)	201676532M	   NOVELTY - A polymeric composition comprises random copolymer containing distinct monomers in which 1st monomer is biorenewable oil, and 2nd monomer is a thermoplastic polymer.    USE - A polymeric composition for modified asphalt, compaction aid additives, rheology modifiers for enhanced high and low temperature asphalt performance, rheology modifier with enhanced storage stability, rheology modifier with enhanced oxidative aging stability, compaction aid additive rheology modifier for enhanced low temperature performance while minimizing reduction in modulus at high temperature ranges, rejuvenator agent, and/or recycling agent, and for use in hot mix, warm mix, and cold mix asphalt applications, roofing asphalt, and coatings (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The composition accelerates dispersion and provides more uniformity when incorporated into asphalt, even with lower shearing and blending time requirements. The modifier system provides a polymer with enhanced performance characteristics (in terms of elasticity and modulus), but with higher workability and lower melting points, enabling use of lower blending temperature, shorter blending times, and lower agitation levels, if necessary.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) modified asphalt comprising 60-99.9 wt.% asphalt binder and 0.1-40 wt.% asphalt modifier which contains 1-75 wt.% thermoplastic polymer and balance biorenewable oil;    (2) preparation of modified asphalt which involves manufacturing asphalt modifier by heating vulcanized biorenewable oil to temperature exceeding that of the melting point of the thermoplastic polymer, adding thermoplastic polymer to biorenewable oil, and agitating thermoplastic polymer with biorenewable oil to obtain a homogeneous blend, and blending asphalt modifier into an asphalt binder;    (3) preparation of modified asphalt which involves simultaneously blending biorenewable oil and thermoplastic polymer into asphalt binder; and    (4) preparation of modified asphalt which involves blending vulcanized biorenewable oil and thermoplastic polymer into asphalt binder. [retrieved on 20181017],relevantClaims[1-15|1-15|1-15],relevantPassages[&lt;pp&gt;W&lt;/pp&gt;]	368-0-0-0 ; 129411-0-0-0 ; 7553-0-0-0 			R00708 ; R00806 ; R00614 		US2020305540-A1;  US11445778-B2	Manufacture of footwear e.g. shoe product,            involves cutting nonwoven fabric or woven fabric into            pieces, joining cut with adhesive, placing last with            cut in mold, assembling sole comprising discarded            organic material, and removing last	CASTRO R J E	CASTRO R J E (CAST-Individual)	202097098H	   NOVELTY - Manufacture of footwear involves melting the                recycled polyesters flakes, adding the pulverized                organic waste material, incorporating staple                fibers, obtaining nonwoven fabric, incorporating                the continuous filaments into the organic waste                material, passing to the elaboration unit to create                woven fabrics, cutting a nonwoven fabric or woven                fabric into different cutting pieces, detailing the                nonwoven fabric or woven fabric using colored                polyester threads, joining the pieces of nonwoven                fabrics and cutting woven fabrics, assembling the                cut (2), mixing resin of different polymers, drying                in an oven, fusing waste into single resin to                obtain an organic polymer, incorporating the                organic polymer pellet, incorporating the sole into                the cut, joining the cut with aqueous adhesive,                placing the last with the cut in a mold, assembling                and incorporating the sole, and removing the last                and incorporating the laces. The sole comprises                discarded organic material.    USE - Manufacture of footwear e.g. shoe product                (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The method produces environmentally-friendly                footwear.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Manufacture of footwear involves (a) crushing                the recycled polyester flakes, supplying into a                machine, melting the recycled polyesters flakes,                adding the pulverized organic waste material such                as sargassum and scrap waste, pouring the coffee                waste and Agave gabazo, (b) incorporating staple                fibers, transferring the organic waste to a                machine, obtaining nonwoven fabric comprising                recycled polyester fibers of sargassum particles,                coffee waste and A.gabazo by punching process, (c)                incorporating the continuous filaments comprising                recycled polyester of plastic bottles into the                organic waste material, passing to the elaboration                unit which is flat or circular woven machine to                create woven fabrics comprising recycled polyester                fibers of sargassum particles, coffee waste and                A.gabazo, (d) cutting a nonwoven fabric or woven                fabric into different cutting pieces, lining (1)                and tongue with ornament template and antibacterial                comfort template and by hand with blade, hydraulic                press using soft with defined designs, laser                machine or computerized machine with knives, (e)                detailing the nonwoven fabric or woven fabric which                is a portion of the cut with embroidery using                colored polyester threads, (f) joining the pieces                of nonwoven fabrics and cutting woven fabrics,                lining with aqueous adhesive, stitching cut and                lining with a surface seam, (g) joining the tongue                with the stitching process to the cut and lining,                (h) assembling the cut, (i) assembling the last                with vaporizer, holding it firmly, (j) mixing a                resin of different polymers, drying in an oven with                linear movement at 30-40 degrees F and with a band                movement of 15-20 seconds, manipulating the coffee                residue, sargassum and A.gabazo to achieve moisture                of 5-15%, mixing the polymer resin separately to                achieve 3 types of polymer by adding from 5-90%                organic matter to coffee residue, sargassum and                A.gabazo, fusing each waste into a single resin to                obtain an organic polymer which is a biodegradable                pellet, (k) incorporating the organic polymer                pellet in manufacturing machines of soles through                an extruder, filling an aluminum mold with the                design of the sole and characteristics which are                chosen, injecting pellet, melting a sole of                existing polymers for everyday and commercial use                of the sole of shoe such as PVC resin,                thermoplastic rubber, styrene butadiene,                thermoplastic polyurethane, injected ethyl vinyl                acetate and molded polyurethane soles rubber or                rubber and expanded ethyl vinyl acetate, (l) adding                the inert load of powdered organic matter fibers,                mixing when adding polymer pellets for injection of                soles, (m) incorporating the sole into the cut,                joining the cut with aqueous adhesive using                pre-drying and applying pressure with a hydraulic                press to the joint between cut and sole, (n)                incorporating the sole into the cut by polymer                injection, placing the last with the cut in a mold,                in which a thermoplastic polymer is injected                directly into the cut, cooling, unmolding, (o)                assembling and incorporating the sole,                manufacturing footwear with direct-cut or strobel                injection, direct injection to the cut or lattice                and direct injection to the cut or embellished with                pre-cut sole formed or strobel with glued sole or                lattice with glued preformed sole, and (p) removing                the last and incorporating the laces. The organic                waste particles are trapped in the staple fibers                and polyester filaments, when extruded from the                machine. The assembling process (h) is performed                using (i) template by joining the template of                nonwoven fabric or woven fabric to the cut by                stitching without joining the back, (ii) strobe by                joining the cut and plant plate throughout the                lower edge, (iii) adding a seam in the inferior                edge of the cut and inserting a thread for the                subjection of the cut to the last, (iv) traditional                mounted by thermoforming the tip, clasps and heel,                (v) mounted type glove, in which the shovel, lower                portion of the cut joins the upper part of the cut                known as floreta, cooked with 1.0 or 1.2 mm thread,                and (vi) driver process by splicing the sole with                the cut fixed with sight stitching and                incorporating the flowerpot with tissue to the                shovel. The thermoplastic polymer is additive or                inert loads to improve the properties and saving of                the polymer, and the charges provide volume without                reaction or reaches melting point to avoid mixing                of polymers, in which inert or loads are used                having melting point more than injection                thermoplastic. The footwear is manufactured using                materials obtained from recycled polyesters flakes,                pulverized organic waste comprising a sargassum, a                coffee waste, and a post-consumption A.gabazo and                post-industrial fibers comprising an inert load.                The sole comprises discarded organic material                comprising sargassum, coffee and/or agave mixed                with polymers and glued with                environmentally-friendly adhesives. An INDEPENDENT                CLAIM is included for shoe product.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a schematic view of the                upper portion and lower portion of the                footwear. Patent US2020305540	MX003392    25 Mar 2019		036/084000	;  US11445778-B2 -- US20160302508-A1   ;  US20180327564-A1   ;  CN102677190-B   PUNING YUANHUI CHEM FIBER CO LTD (PUNI-Non-standard)   MA T;  CN103305960-B   FUJIAN SANDA FIBER CO LTD (FUJI-Non-standard)   ZHANG H,  ZHANG X;  CN202843090-U   JIANGSU QIYING HOME TEXTILE CO LTD (JIAN-Non-standard)   LIU X,  CHEN T,  YU H,  CHEN J;  KR1033212-B1   ERA IND CO LTD (ERAI-Non-standard)   GYU S H,  IN Y,  KWANG H L,  SEOK K L;  KR1361242-B1   PLUSPOLY INC (PLUS-Non-standard)   BON C K,  DONG H Y,  HYUN D O;  US4018646-A   JOHNSON & JOHNSON (JOHJ)   RUFFO A P,  GOYAL P K;  US5346934-A   CHRISS H T (CHRI-Individual)   CHRISS H T;  WO2014209752-A1   ABENGOA BIOENERGY NEW TECHNOLOGIES INC (ABEN-Non-standard)   NGUYEN Q A;  WO2010125545-A3   ADAM G H (ADAM-Individual);  SKOOG H (SKOO-Individual)   ADAM G H,  SKOOG H		368-0-0-0 ; 395-0-0-0 ; 129411-0-0-0 ; 1013-0-0-0 ; 829-0-0-0 ; 1145-0-0-0 ; 621-0-0-0 ; 192545-0-0-0 ; 90356-0-0-0 ;  ; 89827-0-0-0 			R00708 ; R00817 ; R00806 ; R00326 ; R00835 ; R00964 ; R00338 ; R24078 ; R01852 ; R01541 ; R01278 		WO2004107834-A1;  DE10325101-A1;  EP1629704-A1;  KR2006004981-A;  CN1799294-A;  JP2006526890-W;  EP1629704-B1;  DE602004003698-E;  DE602004003698-T2;  IN200502237-P2;  TW200508422-A;  JP4392019-B2;  IN244700-B;  CN1799294-B;  TW350860-B1;  MY134649-A	Micro-blind vias filling method for PCB manufacture, involves removing portion of acidic copper electrolyte from galvanic bath and adding hydrogen peroxide to removed electrolyte portion	OEZKOEK A;  ROELFS B O;  IGEL O;  GENTH H;  MATEJAT K;  ROELFS B;  OZKOK A;  MATEJAT K J;  ROELFS O	ATOTECH DEUT GMBH (AQOR-C);  ATOTECH DEUT GMBH (AQOR-C);  ATOTECH DEUT GMBH (AQOR-C);  ATOTECH DEUT GMBH (AQOR-C)	2005048423	   NOVELTY - A portion of an acidic copper electrolyte is removed from a galvanic bath comprising copper metal salt and organic additives, after operating bath using current of density of 0.5-10 A/dm2. The hydrogen peroxide is added to removed portion and ultraviolet rays are irradiated onto removed portion. The removed portion is recycled and added to the bath and additives destroyed by oxidation treatment are replaced.    USE - For filling micro-blind vias with metal during manufacture of the printed circuit board.    ADVANTAGE - The micro-blind vias is filled effectively without treating the electrolyte by physical separation or physical separation of oxidiation products from the organic additives.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The electrolyte contains 8-60 g/l copper, 40-300 g/l sulfuric acid and 20-150 mg/l chloride and the organic additives comprises brightening and the wetting agents along with polymers that form carbon dioxide upon ultraviolet irradiation. The hydrogen peroxide is added so as to reduce the total concentration of organic compounds from 1000-1500 mg/l to 50-300 mg/l. The ultraviolet rays are irradiated at wavelength of 200-550 nm with irradiation power of 0.5-20 W per litre of the bath, preferably 1-5 W per litre of the bath. The bath is operated using inert soluble anodes without redox system. The electrolyte portion before passing through the bath, is passed through the metal dissolution column containing copper metal in the form of pellet, anode material, rod or particle.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The figure shows a graph of the relation between copper and hydrogen peroxide concentration. 			A85 (Electrical applications.);  L03 (Electro-(in)organic - chemical features of conductors, resistors, magnets, capacitors and switches, electric discharge lamps, semiconductor and other materials, batteries, accumulators and thermoelectric devices, including fuel cells, magnetic recording media, radiation emission devices, liquid crystals and basic electric elements. Growing of single crystals of semiconductors and their doping are included, but semiconductor devices, where the manufacture is not claimed are excluded. Electrography, electrophotography, magnetography, electrolysis, electrophoresis, power plant, X-ray and plasma-techniques, ion exchange resins, polyelectrolytes, electroplating, metal electrodeposition, electroforming, anodising, electrolytic cleaning, cathodic protection and electrolytic or electrothermic production or refining of metals are all covered elsewhere (Sections G, J, K and M).);  DE19801687-A1;  BR9903648-A;  US6310140-B1;  EP930336-B1;  DE59907324-G	Thermoplastic elastomers useful for manufacture of            automobile parts	RAETZSCH M;  REICHELT N;  HESSE A;  BUCKA H;  STOLP M;  RADUSCH H;  RADUSCH R	BOREALIS AG (BORA-C);  PCD-POLYMERE GMBH (PCDP-Non-standard);  BOREALIS AG (BORA-C);  BOREALIS GMBH (BORA-C);  BOREALIS GMBH (BORA-C)	1999396942	   NOVELTY - Thermoplastic elastomers (I) with good                colorability, high strength and elasticity, have                embedded elastomer particles with an average                diameter of 0.05-5 microns and are obtained by                reacting (co)polypropylene and elastomeric 4-12                carbon olefin co- and/or terpolymer with                unsaturated monomer(s) and optionally free radical                thermal initiator in the melt, with addition of                conventional additives and processing aid before                and/or after reaction.    USE - The thermoplastic elastomers (I) and blends                with usual polyolefins, are used in the automobile                industry, preferably for hose connectors, air                suction ducts, pipe joints and sealing profiles, in                the domestic appliance industry, preferably for                connectors and sealing profiles, in the                construction sector, preferably for window seals,                sealing profiles for partitions, expansion joints,                in the installation sector and in medical                technology, preferably for tubing, seals, syringes                and plungers (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - Elastomers are easy to process, can be                recycled, and have excellent colorability, in                contrast with certain strongly colored polymer                alloys, and much higher strength than certain                existing thermoplastic elastomers with excellent                colorability.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - New thermoplastic elastomers (I) with embedded                elastomer particles having average diameter of                0.05-5, preferably 0.1-1 micron are obtained by                reacting mixtures of 20-80, preferably 40-60 wt.%                propylene homopolymer(s) (homoPP) and/or propylene                copolymer(s) (coPP) and 80-20, preferably 60-40                wt.% elastomeric 4-12 carbon (C) olefin co- and/or                terpolymer(s) with 0.10-4.0, preferably 0.2-1.5                wt.% of specified unsaturated monomer(s) and 0-4.0,                preferably 0.2-1.5 wt.% of specified free radical                thermal initiator(s) (with respect to total                polymers) in the melt, with addition of 0.01-2.5                wt.% stabilizer(s), 0.1-1 wt.% antistatic(s), 0.2-3                wt.% pigment(s), 0.05-1 wt.% nucleating agent, 5-40                wt.% filler and/or reinforcement additives, 2-20                wt.% flame retardant and/or 0.01-1 wt.% processing                aid (all with respect to total polymers) before                and/or after reaction.    INDEPENDENT CLAIM are also included for the                following:    (a) high strength polymer blends; and    (b) preparation of the elastomers.  CHAO W;  XIAOJI Z;  LI L;  WEI C;  ZHANG X	UNIV MANCHESTER (UYMH-C);  UNIV MANCHESTER (UYMH-C)	201885696H	   NOVELTY - The apparatus (300) has a layer providing unit                (310) with a retractable bed provided in a chamber                (315) and a roller or a scraper for providing a                first layer from a second material with particles                having a second composition. A concavity defining                unit (320) defines a first concavity in an exposed                surface of the first layer. The concavity defining                unit has a vacuum apparatus with a vacuum nozzle.                The vacuum apparatus removes a portion of the                second material by vacuum suction to define the                first concavity in the exposed surface of the first                layer. A depositing unit (330) deposits a portion                of the first material in the first concavity. The                depositing unit has a printing head with a                deposition nozzle having an orifice. A levelling                unit (340) levels the deposited first material in                the first concavity. A first fusing unit (350)                fuses some of the particles of the levelled first                material in the first concavity by partially                melting particles to form a first portion of the                layer of the article.    USE - Apparatus such as powder bed fusion apparatus                and selective laser melting (SLM) apparatus for                additive manufacturing of portion of article from                first material such as metal, ceramic, glass and                polymer.    ADVANTAGE - The contamination of the second material can                be reduced while the steps required during the                additive manufacturing process can be reduced.                Since the first composition and the second                composition are different, the removal of the                second material is facilitated and the consumption                of the first material is reduced. Since                cross-contamination of the first material and the                second material is reduced, the reuse or recycling                of the first material and the second material is                improved. The second laser beam does not melt the                materials, and heats up the material to manage the                thermal distributions over the entire article to                balance the heat such that the distortions and                thermal stresses can be reduced.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a process                of additive manufacturing of portion of article                from first material.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows the schematic view of the                apparatus for additive manufacturing of portion of                article from first material.  WO2015151834-A1   NAT INST ADVANCED IND SCI &                  TECHNOLOGY (NIIT);  CMET INC (CMET-Non-standard)   OKANE T,  IMAMURA S,  KAJINO S,  OOBA Y,  KATOU Y,  SUZUKI K,  DAICHO Y,  MIYANO H							JP2005139137-A	Manufacture of organic acid having high melting point comprises adding monocarboxylic acid to solution containing ammonium salt of organic acid in copresence of alcohol	ISOYA A	AJINOMOTO KK (AJIN-C);  MITSUBISHI CHEM CO LTD (MITU-C)	2005390534	   NOVELTY - Organic acid is manufactured in a multistage process containing reactive crystallization process during which a monocarboxylic acid is added to solution containing ammonium salt of organic acid. Precipitate of organic acid is produced during the process. The monocarboxylic acid is added in copresence of an alcohol.    USE - For manufacture of organic acid having high melting point such as dicarboxylic acid such as succinic acid used as raw material for polymers (biodegradable polyester and polyamide), pharmaceuticals, foodstuffs and cosmetics, and tricarboxylic acid such as citric acid used as food additive.    ADVANTAGE - Organic acid is efficiently manufactured from ammonium salt of organic acid. Stable running of the crystallization tank is enabled, since viscosity inside the tank is lowered. The amount of ammonium salt of organic acid recovered is improved, therefore the recycle amount is reduced and the energy consumed during the process is reduced greatly. The removal of impurities such as saccharides is easily carried out.  CN110461906-A;  EP3592797-A1;  US2020032060-A1;  JP2020509140-W	Blend for e.g. manufacturing molded article,            comprises polymer comprising anthracene-based moiety            and recurring units e.g. polyphenylene and            polycarbonate, and/or optionally polymer containing            pyrrole-dione-based or azatricyclo-based moiety	FLANAGAN J S;  JEOL S;  KWAN K S;  KERCHER D;  POLLINO J;  BOOHER M;  BUCH M	SOLVAY SPECIALTY POLYMERS USA LLC (SOLV-C);  SOLVAY SPECIALTY POLYMERS USA LLC (SOLV-C);  SOLVAY SPECIALTY POLYMERS USA LLC (SOLV-C);  SOLVAY SPECIALTY POLYMERS USA LLC (SOLV-C)	201871899W	   NOVELTY - A blend comprises at least two distinct                polymers chosen from polymer(s) (P1) comprising                recurring units (U1) chosen from poly(aryl ether                sulfone), poly(aryl ether ketone),                poly(amideimide), polyphenylene, poly(etherimide)                and polycarbonate, and at least one                anthracene-based moiety (I), and optionally                polymer(s) (P2) comprising recurring units (U2)                chosen from poly(aryl ether sulfone), poly(aryl                ether ketone), poly(amideimide), polyphenylene,                poly(etherimide) and polycarbonate, and at least                pyrrole-2,5-dione-based moiety (II) or                azatricyclo-based moiety (III).    USE - Blend is used for forming polymer adduct for                coating surface and manufacturing molded article                (all claimed) e.g. stent, self-healing material and                medical implant.    ADVANTAGE - The blend can efficiently undergo                cycloaddition under certain stimuli due to the                presence of anthracene moieties, and provides                polymer adducts with improved properties with                respect to the existing polymer blends. The polymer                adducts are reversible under certain                light/temperature stimuli and hence can be                effectively used in applications in which it is                important to adapt the polymer structure to                specific conditions, provide coatings that can be                easily repaired by self-healing, and can be                prepared efficiently under mild conditions without                rearrangement and randomization of the polymer                repeat units. The coating or molded article                comprising the adduct can be recycled                efficiently.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A blend comprises at least two distinct                polymers chosen from polymer(s) (P1) comprising                recurring units (U1) chosen from poly(aryl ether                sulfone), poly(aryl ether ketone),                poly(amideimide), polyphenylene, poly(etherimide)                and polycarbonate, and at least one                anthracene-based moiety of formula (I), and                optionally polymer(s) (P2) comprising recurring                units (U2) chosen from poly(aryl ether sulfone),                poly(aryl ether ketone), poly(amideimide),                polyphenylene, poly(etherimide) and polycarbonate,                and at least pyrrole-2,5-dione-based moiety of                formula (II) or azatricyclo-based moiety of formula                (III).    W' = bond, O, C(O), S, SO2, C(O)NH, C(O)O,                O-C(O)-O, NH- C(O)NH-, NH-C(O)-O, imino-containing                moiety or imido-containing moiety;    R' = halo, or optionally branched alkyl,                preferably 1-18C alkyl optionally substituted with                one or more halo;and    n = 0 or 1-9, preferably 0.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the                following:    (1) polymer adduct, which is obtained by                exposing the polymer (P1) to UV light at a                wavelength of 300-600 nm, preferably 350-400 nm, or                by heating the blend at a temperature of 60-250                degrees C, preferably 65-200 degrees C;    (2) method for coating surface, which involves                applying the polymer (P1) and the blend, optionally                in combination with one or more solvents and/or                additives, to a surface, and irradiating the                surface at a wavelength of 300-600 nm, preferably                350-400 nm or heating the surface at a temperature                of 60-250 degrees C, preferably 65-200 degrees                C;    (3) manufacture of molded article, which                involves applying the polymer (P1) and the blend,                optionally in combination with one or more solvents                and/or additives, to a mold, and irradiating the                mold at a wavelength of 300-600 nm, preferably                350-400 nm, or heating the mold at a temperature of                60-250 degrees C, preferably 65-200 degrees                C;    (4) method for recycling coating or molded                article comprising the polymer adduct, which                involves submitting the coating or molded article                to UV irradiation at a wavelength of lower than 300                nm, or submitting the coating or molded article to                heating at a temperature of 100-500 degrees C;                and    (5) polymer (P1), which comprises poly(aryl                ether sulfone) comprising recurring units of                formula (IV-1), and at least one moiety (I),                preferably terminal group(s) of formula (V).    R1 = halo, alkyl, alkenyl, alkynyl, aryl,                ether, thioether, carboxylic acid, ester, amido,                imido, alkali or alkaline earth metal sulfonato,                alkyl sulfonato, alkali or alkaline earth metal                phosphonato, alkyl phosphonato, amino and/or                quaternary ammonium;and    i = 0-4. USE - For manufacturing a polymer electrolyte for use as a coagulant for waste water treatment, an additive for cement, a material for fluidizing coal slurry, dispersant for inorganic pigment, a material for reinforcing paper, a surface sizing material for paper, a conductive material for an electronic copying machine, a destaticizer, a scale preventive material, dispersant for emulsion polymerization, and aqueous glue.    ADVANTAGE - The method is capable of manufacturing a polyelectrolyte containing no halogen compound while preventing discharge of a large quantity of toxic wastes, and having larger molecular weight. It enables a solvent used in a sulfonating reaction of aromatic polymers to be recovered in a state where no water is contained and to form an efficient sulfonating system by recycling the solvent. It is capable of efficiently separating halogen flame retardant containing plastic waste.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for the following:    (a) a method of separating a halogen flame retardant from a plastic, comprising processing plastic comprising a halogen flame retardant with an acid in an organic solvent to introduce an ion group into a resin component of the plastic and to convert the plastic into a water-soluble polymer and to disassociate the halogen flame retardant from the plastic; and separating the halogen flame retardant from the organic solvent and water-soluble polymer;    (b) a polymer electrolyte comprising a water-soluble polystyrene polymer and a stabilizer, where the polymer electrolyte further comprises an ionic group comprising sulfonic acid, sulfonate, carboxylic acid, carboxylate, PO(OH)2 salt, CH2PO(OH)2, or CH2PO(OH)2 salt, the polymer electrolyte comprises 0.002-10 parts stabilizer/100 parts polystyrene polymer, and the stabilizer is a phenol oxidation preventive agent, a sulfur oxidation preventive agent, a phosphor oxidation preventive agent, erysorbic acid, erysorbic acid soda, and/or isopropyl citrate; and    (c) a method of manufacturing a polyelectrolyte composition so that polystyrene polyelectrolyte and stabilizer are mixed so that the polyelectrolyte composition is manufactured, comprising adding the stabilizer when ion groups are introduced into styrene polymers or when water soluble styrene monomers are polymerized or copolymerized to refine the polystyrene polyelectrolyte.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The figure is a flow chart showing a process for sulfonating aromatic polymers. Class A12, AN 1982-27954E, XP002298696,relevantClaims[1],relevantPassages[&lt;column&gt;A&lt;/column&gt;]	368-0-0-0 ; 7-0-0-0 ; 104-0-0-0 ; 2-1-0-0 ; 2211-0-0-0 ; 686-0-0-0 			R00708 ; R01714 ; R01675 ; R01514 ; R05085 ; R01966 		JP2018059064-A;  JP6526136-B2	Method for increasing flow of fluid e.g. thermoplastic fluid material passing along extruder, used in plastic manufacturing industry, involves selecting dimension of particle supplied in extruder	JOHNSON W L	ECOPURO LLC (ECOP-Non-standard);  ECOPURO LLC (ECOP-Non-standard)	201828676R	   NOVELTY - The method involves supplying fluid in a extruder. The processing amount of fluid passing along the extruder is measured. The motor output of the extruder is measured, when the fluid passes the extruder. The particles are supplied in the extruder. The dimension of the particle supplied in the extruder is selected, and either the processing amount which increased, or the motor output which reduced is stimulated.    USE - Method for increasing flow of fluid e.g. thermoplastic fluid material, plastics, polymer, coating material, adhesive agent, brake fluid, hydraulic fluid, fuel additive, and lubrication agent (all claimed) passing along extruder, used in plastic manufacturing industry.    ADVANTAGE - The plastic manufacturing cost is reduced by substituting expensive polymer to cheap structural material, by increasing capability to include many organic materials in plastics and by increasing productivity by high level organic and/or structural material. The reduction of friction coefficient on mechanical surface caused by the boundary layer effect by reaction substituted by rotational motion friction of hard particle in boundary layer is achieved. The increase in the amount of plastic manufacture is achieved. The surface quality with respect to plastics is improved. The stimulation of boundary layer removal by dynamic mixing is achieved. Improved heat transfer by dynamic mixing in boundary layer is ensured.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The dimension of the particle when making the surface quality of the fluid which achieves one side of the increase in distribution of the additive in the fluid, or comes out of the extruder increase is adjusted. The first motor output in first motor stirring speed is compared with the second motor output in second motor stirring speed. The filler is added to the fluid. The extruder is polished by the particle mixed in the boundary layer. The pump or process unit is provided with a connection which is a continuous path for an open end single path or recycle operation. The jet grinding of the particle is performed before the process of supplying the fluid in the extruder in order to crush the particles in the shape of a shellfish shell. The particle is selected from the group which consists of solid material, a porous material, a synthetic material, and a natural mineral. The additive is supplied in the extruder. The additive is a filler, pigment or fiber. A complicated three-dimensional surface area is provided with a smooth sharp blade-shaped surface. The particle collides with a fluid by dynamic rolling of the particle which arises with the fluid that flows through the surface top. The fluid exists between the screw in the extruder, and a barrel. The fluid is selected from the group which consists of plastics, a polymer, a coating material, an adhesive agent, brake fluid, a hydraulic fluid, a fuel additive, and a lubrication agent.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a graphical view illustrating the effect of sodium silicate potassium aluminum with respect to quantity of output of thermoplastic material which passes along extruder. (Drawing includes non-English language text) 			A32 (Polymer fabrication - such as moulding, extrusion, forming, laminating, spinning.);  A81 (Adhesives and binders - including chipboard.);  A82 (Coatings, impregnations, polishes - excluding textile finishing.);  A95 (Transport - including vehicle parts, tyres and armaments.);  A97 (Miscellaneous goods not specified elsewhere - including papermaking, gramophone records, detergents, food and oil well applications.);  ;  G03 (Adhesives - excluding dispensers. Polymeric adhesives are also classified in Section A (C09H, J).);  H07 (Lubricants and lubrication - this excludes self-lubricating surfaces e.g. PTFE coated surfaces and lubrication systems in general. Patent JP2018059064	JP178251    20 Sep 2017;  JP179851    20 Sep 2017										DE102006009450-A1;  DE102006009450-B4	Paper manufacturing quality assurance toxic measuring system for food grade paper has two measuring systems operating on different principles	CLUMPKENS M;  FURUMOTO H;  LAMPE U	SIEMENS AG (SIEI-C)	2006698029	   NOVELTY - In a paper manufacturing quality assurance process two measuring systems employ different measuring principles. One of the measuring systems is a sensor that detects the nature of toxic gas escaping from the dry paper on discharge from the process.    USE - Paper manufacturing quality assurance measuring system.    ADVANTAGE - The process provides more reliable toxic values than prior art for food-grade packing materials.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The gas sensor is a semiconductor device with an array of receptors including a metal oxide sensor, a gas-sensitive field effect sensor and/or an organic polymer gas sensor. The measuring principles include infrared spectroscopy, NIR spectroscopy, gas chromatography, mass spectroscopy and/or electrochemical sensors. The sensor signals are evaluated using a neural network. A further value measured is based on water discharged from the sieve (10). USE - The thermoplastic, biodegradable, polymer composition is useful for manufacturing solid articles, e.g. thin films, packaging films, tubes, wires, packets, bags and bottles, by printing or by film technology (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The thermoplastic polymer composition can manufacture a wide range of products that have been shown as completely biodegradable, compostable and as having performances and costs comparable to those of the traditional thermoplastic polymeric materials based on non-biodegradable polymers. Components of the composition, namely polycaprolactone and proteic hydrolysate, have shown mutual compatibility, in a wide range of ratios, giving rise to a polymer composition characterized by a high hot workability, for example much greater than the workability of the polycaprolactone only, to produce artifacts and films completely homogeneous and of high mechanical resistance, where all can be achieved without the addition of any compatibilizing additive. Particularly advantageous, the proteic hydrolysate of the compositions is a hydrolyzed animal collagen originating from a waste of the tanning industry, or a proteic hydrolysate from wastes and/or by-products of other industrial processes, whose reuse for the preparation of the compositions, in addition to not burden the manufacturing costs of the compositions, represents a valorization of a waste product or by product, otherwise to be treated as industrial waste, or having up to now limited possibilities of use or recycling.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) a process for preparing thermoplastic, biodegradable, polymer composition which involves hot extrusion of polycaprolactone and of a proteic hydrolysate in powder form having average molecular weight of not less than 10000 g/mol at a starting temperature, at the entrance of the extruder, which ranges between the melting temperature of the polycaprolactone and the degradation temperature of the proteic hydrolysate; and    (2) a solid article obtainable by printing or by film technology of the polymer composition. A flexible                membrane (14) is mounted on a bottom of tank and                covering opening. A light source (26) is configured                to emit collimated ultraviolet light towards a                bottom opening (11) of tank. A mask (25) is mounted                between flexible membrane and light source. An                extraction plate (20) is mounted within tank to                which an object (22) is formed from cured portions                are affixed. A height adjustor is configured to                control a vertical position of extraction plate. A                controller is configured to operate height adjustor                so as to adjust a displacement from a first surface                during printing of object. A resin circulatory                system (30) is configured to pump a first volume of                the photo-curing liquid resin out of the tank                through sidewall openings and into a reservoir and                to pump a second volume of the photo-curing liquid                resin into the tank from the reservoir under                control of the controller.    USE - Additive manufacturing apparatus for                three-dimensional (3D) printing system for forming                objects through photo-curing of liquid resin in                tank by selective exposure to radiation during                printing operation.    ADVANTAGE - The photo-curing liquid resin is recycled in                the fashion to manage the temperature of the liquid                resin in the tank. The controller is configured to                operate the height adjustor so as to adjust the                vertical displacement of the extraction plate                during printing of the object. The system is                provided for reducing or eliminating side effects                of localized heating by displacing the resin                relative to build area for the object. The thermal                imaging device provides feedback concerning                temperatures experienced in the build area, thus,                allowing control over the pumping arrangement to                control the rate at which resin is circulated                through the build area.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method                for forming objects through photo-curing of liquid                resin in tank by selective exposure to radiation                during printing operation.  US2013197134-A1;  IN201210447-P1;  BR112013018477-A2	Warm mix asphalt compositions useful for construction or maintenance of highways, roads, sidewalks, comprise coarse and fine aggregates, asphalt binders modified by organic and/or inorganic polymers, and organic chemical additives	LEAL J;  LEAL J F	QUIMIGEL IND&COMERCIO LTDA (QUIM-Non-standard);  QUIMIGEL IND & COMERCIO LTDA (QUIM-Non-standard);  QUIMIGEL IND & COMERCIO LTDA (QUIM-Non-standard);  QUIMIGEL IND & COMERCIO LTDA (QUIM-Non-standard)	2012N50141	   NOVELTY - Warm mix asphalt compositions comprise: (i) content of coarse and fine aggregates be in the range of 92% to 97% by weight based on total weight of the asphalt mix; (ii) content of asphalt binders modified by organic and/or inorganic polymers be in the range of 3% to 8% by weight based on total weight of the asphalt mixture; and (iii) content of at least one or more organic chemical additives be in the range of 0.0001% to 0.5% by weight based on total weight of the asphalt mix.    USE - The warm mix asphalt compositions are useful for construction or maintenance of highways, roads, sidewalks, parking lots, bridges, airport runways, sidewalks, parks, roofs, walls, service roads, waterproof membranes, asphalt recycling and any other bearing surfaces (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The invention provides preparation of composition of warm asphalt mixtures comprising at least the use of an organic chemical additive capable of increase the coating of asphalt binder on the aggregates surface, decreasing the surface tension and increasing the effect of lubricity of the asphalt binder. Both combined effects increase the workability of asphalt mixtures at temperatures up to 70 degrees C below those normally used in conventional hot mix asphalt.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Warm mix asphalt compositions comprise: (i) content of coarse and fine aggregates be in the range of 92% to 97% by weight based on total weight of the asphalt mix; (ii) content of asphalt binders modified by organic and/or inorganic polymers be in the range of 3% to 8% by weight based on total weight of the asphalt mixture; and (iii) content of at least one or more organic chemical additives be in the range of 0.0001% to 0.5% by weight based on total weight of the asphalt mix and these organic chemical additives are composed by: (a) the reaction result between one of amine compounds of formula 1 or 2 or its mixture and at least one fatty acid or mixture of fatty acids; and (b) one or more primary amines, secondary amines, tertiary amines, diamines, polyamines, quaternary ammonium compounds, amine acetates or its mixture.    R1=represents H, H2, CH3, CH2CH3, (CH2CH2NH)xH, (CH2CH2OH)y and/or CH2CH2NHCH2CH2OH;    x=1-10; and    y=1-3.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are:    (1) a process for obtaining warm mix asphalt compositions comprising: (i) adding to the asphalt modified by organic and/or inorganic polymers in solid, molten, dissolved or dispersed state one or more organic chemical additives capable of produce, manufacture, spread and compact asphalt mixtures at temperatures lower than 160 degrees C; (ii) optionally, but not necessarily, adding one or more components in the asphalt modified by organic and/or inorganic polymers, selected from adhesion promoters agents, acid adjuvants, cross-linking agents, fluxing agents, additives reagents, talc, carbon black and used scrap tires powder, where the order of addition between them and those organic chemical additives or mixture of those is irrelevant; (iii) adding to the composition, coarse and fine aggregates; (iv) mixing, preferably under mild agitation, by any mechanical process during a period of time sufficient to obtain a homogeneous mixture; and (v) obtaining a warm mix asphalt ready for use; and    (2) surface, characterized by being coated, in whole or in part with the composition of asphalt mixture.  MAGAB INMUEBLES SL (MAGA-Non-standard)	2011H35045	   NOVELTY - At least two starting bands of plastic material of different composition are longitudinally joined by their consecutive partial overlapping, throughout lines joined to one another by thermal bonding. The first and second starting bands, once joined, form wider final band from which bags are created by folding lines, thermal bonding and cutting. The first starting bands are made of polymers. The second starting bands have paper aspect and comprise polymers with polyethylene-based additive of high density and high molecular weight and titanium dioxide and calcium carbonate loadings.    USE - Manufacturing method for plastic bag (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - Features walls or pieces that present different aspect which simulates they were obtained from other materials, specifically from plastic and paper. Prevents problems during manufacturing as there is only one material to manipulate, and prevents problems during recycling since entire bag is made of same material. Enables printing texts or drawings with same printing process in any area of walls, allowing customization of bags with digital printings, using combinations of solvent printing and digital printing.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a schematic and longitudinal sectional view of a bag created from a final band.  JP2005289515-A   ;  US5091236-A   MOBIL OIL CORP (MOBI)   KELLER L E,  FROGNET J P,  PETITJEAN M;  US5226735-A   BELIVEAU D (BELI-Individual)   BELIVEAU D							US5872205-A;  CA2229273-A1	Producing segregated polymer structure from waste plastics mixture by melting mixture and inducing polymer migration - by increasing difference in viscosity of constituents using extruder with tubular extension	LO D P;  BALKE S T;  SAYAD M H;  KARAMI A;  JOSEPH S	JOSEPH S (JOSE-Individual);  KARAMI A (KARA-Individual);  LO D P (LODP-Individual);  SAYAD M H (SAYA-Individual);  BALKE S T (BALK-Individual);  BALKE S T (BALK-Individual);  JOSEPH S (JOSE-Individual);  SAYAD M H (SAYA-Individual);  KARAMI A (KARA-Individual);  LO D P (LODP-Individual)	1999166713	      NOVELTY - Constituents of polymer mixture are segregated by melting the mixture and inducing migration of the constituents relative to one another, transverse to a flow direction, by increasing differences in viscosity between them. The viscosities are changed by adding more of at least one polymer, selectively varying temperature in the flow direction, or chemically inducing a viscosity change in at least one polymer. After segregation, the polymers are resolidified.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Preferred features: The mixture is caused to flow using an extruder (24) which can have a heated tube extension (30) causing the different polymers to stratify in radial layers or a die for forming a layered solid. Migration of the constituents is induced by mechanically inducing shear in the mixture to vary flow velocity selectively at different points. A compatibiliser or adhesive tie-layer may be added to the mixture before or during processing to bind segregated polymer layers together.    USE -   In the recycling of mixed waste plastics including different polymers and additives to separate the constituents to provide layered structures. Mixtures suitable for processing include polypropylene and polyethylene terephthalate from waste carpeting, polyethylene and polypropylene from waste resulting from manufacturing disposable diapers, and polycarbonate and acrylonitrile-butadiene-styrene from waste automotive parts.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - Figure shows schematic of typical segregation apparatus. (24) extruder; (28) adaptor; (30) segregation tube; (32) segregated extrudate. 			A31 (Preliminary processes.) USE - Production of optical absorber-containing thermoplastic polymer (OACTP) particles for composition (claimed). Can be used for starting material for additive manufacturing, identifying objects, tracking objects, authenticating objects, and/or determining the health of objects.    ADVANTAGE - Carrier fluids and washing solvents of the systems and methods can be recycled and reused.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for method which involves depositing the OACTP particles optionally in combination with other thermoplastic polymer particles upon a surface in a specified shape; and once deposited, heating greater than or equal to 1 portion of particles to promote consolidation and form a consolidated body.  DHALLA A M;  CHAUHAN Y B	NAIK S N (NAIK-Individual);  DHALLA A M (DHAL-Individual);  CHAUHAN Y B (CHAU-Individual);  SABIC INNOVATIVE PLASTICS IP BV (SABI-C)	2011C68527	   NOVELTY - An anhydride compound (I) is reacted with an                aniline compound (II) in the presence of solvent                (A), to obtain a benzoisoquinoline-dione compound                (III). Compound (III) is reacted with a hydroxy                compound in the presence of a base and solvent (B),                to obtain a benzoisoquinoline-dione derivative                (IV).    USE - Manufacture of benzoisoquinoline-dione                derivative useful as fluorescent brightener in                polymer compositions used for various products                (both claimed) e.g. computer and business-machine                housings such as housings for monitors, handheld                electronic device housings such as housings for                cell phones, electrical connectors, components of                lighting fixtures, ornaments, home appliances,                roofs, greenhouses, sun rooms, swimming pool                enclosures, and automotive applications. Can also                be used as additive in textiles, papers and                detergents.    ADVANTAGE - The method enables manufacture of fluorescent                brighteners which impart a whiter-than-white                appearance to polymers pigmented with titanium                dioxide to produce a bluish tinge in clear                polymers, masking yellowness to make lightly                colored polymers appear more brilliant and/or to                aid in restoring whiteness to recycled                polymers.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An anhydride compound of formula (I) is                reacted with an aniline compound of formula (II) in                the presence of solvent (A), to obtain a                benzoisoquinoline-dione compound of formula (III).                Compound (III) is reacted with a hydroxy compound                of formula: R6-OH in the presence of a base and                solvent (B), to obtain a benzoisoquinoline-dione                derivative of formula (IV).    R1,R4,R5=H;    R2,R3=t-butyl;    R7,R8=halo, cyano, or 1-6C group;    n,m=0;    X=chloro or bromo;and    R6=2-4C aliphatic group or 3-20C aromatic                group. A polymer is covalently bound to the particle core via a linker. The polymer comprises a branched, amphiphilic cationic polyalkylene imine backbone having amine or amino functional groups.    USE - Antibacterial polymer-modified particles are used for removing bacteria from aqueous solution and in water treatment kit used for water disinfection (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The antibacterial polymer-modified particles have improved disinfection activity, antibacterial efficacy against Staphylococcus aureus, Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Escherichia coli. The particles exhibit high antibacterial activities against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. The particles can be used in water disinfection applications on a large scale without requiring chemical treatment. The antibacterial effectiveness of the antibacterial polymer-modified particles is maintained in a repeated application. The particles have an ability to remove viruses. The particles are recycled for further use.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the following:    (1) manufacture of polymer-modified particles, which involves (i) grafting a branched, amphiphilic cationic polyalkylene imine backbone polymer to a particles which has been surface functionalized with a linker, optionally reacting the product from step (ii) with an amphiphilic cyclic carbonate under ring opening to form a urethane bond, and (iii) acidifying the reaction product from step (i) or (ii) with an acid to form the amphiphilic cationic backbone; and    (2) water treatment kit, which comprises a container comprising antibacterial polymer-modified particles together with additives or fillers and optionally a container of dilute acid. The alkyl group                substituted by cyclic group is an alkyl group in                which the cyclic group is bonded to at least one                carbon atom among the 1-3 carbon atoms from the tin                atom. Uses                include but are not limited to polycarbonate raw                material, isocyanate raw material, chemical product                raw material, battery electrolyte for lithium ion                battery, additives for pharmaceutical and                agrochemical, raw material of deoxidation agent for                rustproofing of boiler piping, lubricating oil raw                material, gasoline additive for octane improvement,                carbonylation agent, solvent, etc.    ADVANTAGE - The alkyl tin compound has excellent thermal                stability and suppressed generation of deactivation                component at time of the repeated use in high                temperature. (including polycarbonates, polyesteramides); alkyds; other unsaturated polymers.);  E12 (Organometallics - ie containing other than H, C, N, O, S, halogens, Si and P.);  J04 (Chemical/physical processes/apparatus - including catalysis, catalysts (excluding specific e.g. enzymatic or polymerisation catalysts), colloid chemistry, laboratory apparatus and methods, testing, controlling, general encapsulation, detection and sampling (excluding clinical testing) (B01J, L).)
