The solid fraction                comprises 90-95 wt.% lithium metal oxide based                particulate electrochemically activatable material                (a), 2-6 wt.% water soluble acidic polyacrylate or                polymethacrylate binder material (b), 2-6 wt.%                conductive particulate carbon (c), and 0-2 wt.%                further additives (d) different from components                (a)-(c). The solvent/dispersant fraction comprises                5-25 wt.% organic alcoholic solvent (A), 5-30 wt.%                water (B), and 0-5 wt.% solvents/dispersants (C)                different from components (A) and (B).    USE - Slurry used for coating cathode for forming                coated cathode of lithium-ion battery (all claimed)                such as lithium-ion secondary battery.    ADVANTAGE - The slurry provides the cathode having                excellent electrochemical performance. The cathode                can be prepared by replacing toxic organic solvents                and PVDF with water and water-soluble polymers                respectively and low cost drying process. The                cathode particles can be recycled after used in                lithium-ion batteries for several charge-discharge                cycles.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the                following:    (1) manufacture of the slurry;    (2) manufacture of coated cathode;    (3) coated cathode;    (4) lithium-ion battery; and    (5) recycling of lithium-ion battery. 			A85 (Electrical applications.);  L03 (Electro-(in)organic - chemical features of conductors, resistors, magnets, capacitors and switches, electric discharge lamps, semiconductor and other materials, batteries, accumulators and thermoelectric devices, including fuel cells, magnetic recording media, radiation emission devices, liquid crystals and basic electric elements. Growing of single crystals of semiconductors and their doping are included, but semiconductor devices, where the manufacture is not claimed are excluded. Electrography, electrophotography, magnetography, electrolysis, electrophoresis, power plant, X-ray and plasma-techniques, ion exchange resins, polyelectrolytes, electroplating, metal electrodeposition, electroforming, anodising, electrolytic cleaning, cathodic protection and electrolytic or electrothermic production or refining of metals are all covered elsewhere (Sections G, J, K and M).); The partially crystalline polymer, the amorphous styrene polymer and the compatibilizer is present in the form of a polymer blend. The thermoplastic polymer powder has an average particle diameter D50 of 5-200 mu m.    USE - The thermoplastic polymer powder is useful for producing three-dimensional component by selective laser sintering or related methods of additive manufacturing (claimed), preferably component of vehicles and planes, ships, packaging, sanitary articles, medical products, input devices and operating elements, laboratory equipment and consumer goods, machine parts, household appliances, furniture, handles, seals, floor coverings, textiles, agricultural equipment, shoe soles, containers for storage of food and feed, dishes, cutlery, filters and telephone sets, and as a prototype and model in industry, design and architecture.    ADVANTAGE - The thermoplastic polymer powder shortens construction time, preferably the cooling time such that energy and time can be saved and a higher proportion of the polymer powder can be used again in the process (high recycling rate), and produces components with good mechanical properties and surface properties that tend to warp little.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for:    (1) producing thermoplastic polymer powder, comprising (i) providing a solid mixture comprising components A, B, C and optionally D, (ii) mechanically comminution of the solid mixtures to obtain thermoplastic polymer powder has an average particle diameter D50 of 5-200 mu m; and    (2) producing a three-dimensional component by selective laser sintering, comprising (x) setting a processing temperature Tx in an installation space and preparing a powder layer made of the thermoplastic polymer powder in the installation space, (xi) spatially resolved melting by a directed beam of electromagnetic radiation and subsequent solidification of the thermoplastic polymer powder in a defined area, where the steps (x) and (xi) are carried out several times such that a three-dimensional component is obtained in layers by connecting the regions of the melted and solidified polymer. TECHNOL., vol. 25, 2002, pages 401 - 405	395-0-0-0 ; 368-0-0-0 ; 129411-0-0-0 ; 7200-0-0-0 ; 1013-0-0-0 ; 1145-0-0-0 ; 107016-0-0-0 			R00817 ; R00708 ; R00806 ; R00479 ; R00326 ; R00964 ; R01694 		WO2008155463-A1	Patterning plastic surface for printed circuit boards involves forming coating with carrier liquid, focusing activating beam, and removing coating from area left outside range of action of beam, where surface comprises thermoplastic polymer	MINKKINEN H;  SARLIN J;  LAAKSO P	VALTION TEKNILLINEN TUTKIMUSKESKUS (VALW-C)	2009B24216	   NOVELTY - A plastic surface (1) is patterned by forming coating (2) with carrier liquid; focusing an activating beam (3); and removing coating from area left outside the range of action of beam. The plastic surface comprises thermoplastic polymer. The coating is formed through thermoplastic polymer dissolved or dispersed in water. The activating beam is directed to plastic surface.    USE - Method of patterning plastic surface for printed circuit boards. Uses include but are not limited to manufacture of microreactor structures, and implementing small markings, which are invisible to the eye, on plastic substrates.    ADVANTAGE - The method provides plastic surface with different polymer materials which can be patterned quickly with high precision to achieve durable patterns even in a very small scale; thus patterning can also be made at very high scanning speed to which unused additives can be recycled, and no additives are needed for removing coating that was not welded to substrate.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Patterning plastic surface (1) involves forming coating (2) with carrier liquid into plastic surface; focusing an activating beam (3) into the surface, and moving surface and activating beam in relation to each other so that point of action (P) of beam attaches coating into the surface; and removing coating from area left outside the range of action of beam by a treatment which leaves coating more firmly attached to surface. The plastic surface comprises thermoplastic polymer. The coating is formed through thermoplastic polymer dissolved or dispersed in water, and by applying aqueous solution or dispersion containing polymer, and evaporating water. The activating beam is directed to plastic surface so that at the point of action of beam, a component of plastic surface or coating absorbs electromagnetic radiation of beam which causes heating, fusing and mixing of thermoplastic polymers at interface of plastic surface and coating so that permanent bond (4) of their polymers is formed in the range of action of beam, corresponding to pattern.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing is a schematic view of patterning plastic surface.  US2004086674-A1   HOLMAN T J (HOLM-Individual)   HOLMAN T J;  US2007080146-A1   MERCK PATENT GMBH (MERE)   STOCKUM W,  KLEIN S							RU2768145-C1	METHOD FOR SPHEROIDIZATION OF POLYSTYRENE POWDER            PARTICLES USING A GAS DISCHARGE UNIT	KASHAPOV N F;  KASHAPOV R N;  FARAKHOV R R	UNIV KAZAN VOLGA REGION FEDERAL (UYKZ-Soviet Institute)	202255276D	   NOVELTY - Invention relates to a method for                spheroidization of waste polystyrene powders using                a gas discharge unit and relates to the processing                of polymer materials. The method for recycling                waste polystyrene powders can be used in additive                manufacturing, the construction, aviation and                machine-building industries, where recycling of                waste polymer materials and their preparation for                reuse is required. The method for spheroidization                of polystyrene powder waste consists in the fact                that polystyrene powder waste is crushed in a                cryogenic mill to a particle size of 50-80 microns,                then the resulting polystyrene powder particles are                placed in a plasmatron powder receiver, then a                plasmatron is launched, generating a plasma jet                formed by an inert gas flow with a temperature of                80-90C and a speed of 10-15 m/s, then the gate of                the plasmatron powder receiver is opened, while                polystyrene powder particles fall into the plasma                jet plasmatron, then polystyrene powder particles                fall into the discharge zone, in which 2-4 electric                independent DC arcs with a power of up to 1 kW are                generated, while polystyrene powder particles are                spheroidized by melting their surfaces, then                spherical powder particles are fed into a separate                chamber, where they cool down to room                temperature.    USE - Chemical industry.    ADVANTAGE - Providing a method for spheroidization of                polystyrene powder waste particles, making it                possible to obtain spherical particles with a                smooth surface without significant deviations in                the physical and chemical properties of                polystyrene. 1 cl, 4 ex 			A35 (Other processing and general - including vulcanisation, welding of plastics and adhesive processes. A methacryl type compound is added to the polymer solution and polymerized, to obtain a methacryl type polymeric block (B). The obtained copolymer solution is modified and purified to obtain an acrylic type block copolymer consisting blocks (A,B). Before modification and purification, polymerization solvent containing unreacted acryl methacryl compounds is recovered.    USE - Manufacture of acrylic type block copolymer used for molded products (claimed), such as sheets. The acrylic type block copolymer can also be used as additive for rubber and thermoplastic resin.    ADVANTAGE - The method enables efficient purification and recycle of solvent, and provides acrylic type block copolymers which form molded products having excellent mechanical properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An acrylic type block copolymer is obtained by atom transfer radical polymerization using a transition-metal complex as polymerization catalyst. An acrylic type polymeric block (A) is obtained by polymerizing an acrylic type compound in a polymerization solvent. A methacryl type compound is added to the polymer solution and polymerized, to obtain a methacryl type polymeric block (B). The obtained copolymer solution is modified and purified to obtain an acrylic type block copolymer consisting blocks (A,B). Before modification and purification, polymerization solvent containing unreacted acryl methacryl compounds is recovered. 			A14 (Polymers of other substituted monoolefins; including PVC, PTFE.);  A60 (Additives and Compounding Agents If the usage is very restricted it may be classified under the individual polymer or process involved.)	A02-A06;  A04-F01;  A10-C02	C08F-297/00;  C08F-006/10	JP2009051993-A   12 Mar 2009   C08F-297/00   200923Pages: 17   Japanese	JP2009051993-A    JP222423    29 Aug 2007		JP222423    29 Aug 2007					7200-0-0-0 			R00479 		WO2010086506-A1;  FI200905081-A;  US2011294909-A1;  EP2391490-A1;  CN102300690-A;  EP2391490-B1;  CN102300690-B;  US9254584-B2;  EP2391490-A4;  FI127330-B1	Manufacturing wood composite material containing fiber based material e.g. wood fiber and polymer based material e.g. plastic, comprises performing preliminary treatment process to form solid raw stock mixture using hot-cold mixing device	LAAKSONEN R;  LEHTINEN L;  PELTOLA P;  PELLOTA P	UPM-KYMMENE CORP (UPMK-C);  UPM-KYMMENE OY (UPMK-C)	2010K12751	   NOVELTY - The process comprises performing a preliminary treatment process to form a solid raw stock mixture using a hot-cold mixing device comprising a heating stage and a cooling stage. The raw stock containing lignin-free material and a coupling agent are fed to the mixing device to form agglomerates and raw stock mixture. The adhesion between fiber based and polymer based substances of the raw stock is ameliorated by the coupling agent. The raw stock mixture is heated in the mixing device to a temperature of greater than 185 degrees C.    USE - The process is useful for manufacturing a wood composite material, which contains lignin-free fiber based materials such as wood fiber, straw, reed or flax based or other plant fiber based materials and polymer based materials such as plastic based materials.    ADVANTAGE - The process is capable of easily and rapidly manufacturing a homogenous wood composite material with high mechanical properties in an industrially applicable manner, and ensures good adhesion between lignin-free wood fiber, coupling agent and polymer.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The process comprises performing a preliminary treatment process to form a solid raw stock mixture using a hot-cold mixing device comprising a heating stage and a cooling stage. The raw stock containing lignin-free material and a coupling agent are fed to the mixing device to form agglomerates and raw stock mixture. The adhesion between fiber based and polymer based substances of the raw stock is ameliorated by the coupling agent. The raw stock mixture is heated in the mixing device to a temperature of greater than 185 degrees C. The recycling material containing wood fiber based and/or polymer based material and an adhesive laminate waste are used as the raw stock. The raw stock is crushed to a predetermined particle size before conducting it to the mixing device. An additional plastic and an additive are fed to the mixing device. An organic material containing maleic anhydrides is used as the coupling agent. 			A35 (Other processing and general - including vulcanisation, welding of plastics and adhesive processes.  AU2017223287-B2;  EP3420005-B1;  ES2790400-T3	Terpolymer used for forming e.g. polymer            composition, comprises glyoxal monomer unit(s), primary            amide-containing monomer unit(s), and quaternary            ammonium alkyl (meth)acrylate salt as cationic monomer            unit(s)	TEKOBO S;  CASTER J	BUCKMAN LAB INT INC (BUCL-C);  BUCKMAN LAB INT INC (BUCL-C);  BUCKMAN LAB INT INC (BUCL-C)	201759373L	   NOVELTY - A terpolymer comprises a glyoxal monomer                unit(s), a primary amide-containing monomer                unit(s), and a quaternary ammonium alkyl                (meth)acrylate salt as cationic monomer                unit(s).    USE - Terpolymer e.g. glyoxalated polyacrylamide                terpolymer is used for forming polymer composition,                paper product e.g. paper sheeting, paperboard,                tissue paper, and wall board, and used as additive                for improving drainage in paper pulp (all claimed).                Uses include but are not limited to Kraft paper,                sulfite paper, semichemical paper, recycled paper                and paper produced from bleached pulp and/or                unbleached pulp.    ADVANTAGE - The terpolymer has excellent shelf life and                provides paper product with increased paper dry                strength and wet-end drainage or retention                rate.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the                following:    (1) base copolymer, which comprises a reaction                product of at least one primary amide-containing                monomer and at least one cationic monomer which is                copolymerizable with the primary amide-containing                monomer. The reaction product is a glyoxalated                copolymer in form of particles;    (2) preparation of terpolymer, which involves                copolymerizing from 20-45 wt.% primary                amide-containing monomer and 30-55 wt.% cationic                monomer, to form a base copolymer, and                copolymerizing the base copolymer with glyoxal to                form a terpolymer;    (3) polymer composition, which comprises the                terpolymer and an aqueous medium in which the                terpolymer is dispersed;    (4) manufacture of paper which involves                absorbing an amount of the terpolymer on cellulose                papermaking fibers in aqueous suspension, forming                the aqueous suspension into a web, and drying the                web. The amount of the terpolymer increases                retention, drainage rate, or paper dry strength as                compared to paper made with the suspension without                the terpolymer; and    (5) process for improving drainage in paper                pulp, which involves adding terpolymer as an                additive to paper pulp. 2118-0-0-0 ; 2033-0-0-0 ; 90356-0-0-0 			R00444 ; R00459 ; R21733 ; R00823 ; R01852 		KR2004036271-A;  KR494734-B1	Manufacturing method of vibrator for vibration motor of cellular phone	ARAI N;  HAN S J	HAN S J (HANS-Individual)	2005190400	   NOVELTY - A manufacturing method of vibrator for vibration motor of cellular phone is provided which reduces manufacturing cost, generates strong vibration, enables the vibrator to be recycled and prevents environmental pollution after disusing of the vibration motor.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The manufacturing method of vibrator(40) for vibration motor of cellular phone comprises a resin pellet molding step of molding roughly cylinder shaped resin pellet having diameter of 0.5 mm and length of 0.5 to 1.0 mm by extruding the molten thermoplastic resin composition after injecting a thermoplastic resin composition comprising 28.6 wt.% of thermoplastic polymer resin and 71.4 wt.% of elastic polymer into an extruder so that the thermoplastic resin composition is heated and molten in the extruder; a tungsten powder mixing step of mixing 30 to 70 wt.% of tungsten powder having a powder particle size of 1 to 3 mum for the total tungsten weight with 30 to 70 wt.% of tungsten powder having a powder particle size of 30 to 150 mum for the total tungsten weight; a tungsten and thermoplastic resin composition mixing step of mixing 92.7 to 96.5 wt.% of tungsten powder mixed in the tungsten powder mixing step with 3.5 to 7.3 wt.% of pellet of thermoplastic resin composition molded in the resin pellet molding step; an extrusion molding step of molding the mixture into a fan-shaped or semicircular shaped main body(42) from the extruder after mixing 82.15 wt.% of the mixture of tungsten and thermoplastic resin composition mixed in the tungsten and thermoplastic resin composition mixing step with 17.85 wt.% of additive; and a sanding step of removing burr adhered to the main body molded in the extrusion molding step. Patent KR2004036271	KR065229    24 Oct 2002										US2021206964-A1	Biodegradable fiber blend used e.g. to produce textile articles e.g. woven cloth, carpets, and other consumer products, comprises natural fiber, and biodegradable thermoplastic fiber blended with natural fiber and comprising mixture of thermoplastic polymer and biodegradable additive	CITRON M	EVERYWHERE APPAREL INC (EVER-Non-standard)	2021791961	   NOVELTY - Biodegradable fiber blend comprises: (a) a natural fiber; and (b) a biodegradable thermoplastic fiber blended with the natural fiber, where the biodegradable thermoplastic fiber comprises a mixture of a thermoplastic polymer and a biodegradable additive, and the biodegradable additive is configured to make the thermoplastic polymer biodegradable.    USE - The biodegradable fiber blend is useful in a biodegradable textile, and in a biodegradable textile yarn (all claimed), or for manufacturing a biodegradable textile yarn from recycled materials and textiles, which is useful for: producing textile articles e.g. woven cloth, carpets, and other consumer products (e.g. a tent, a carpet, a furniture cover, automobile covers, grill covers, tarps, umbrellas, or other upholsteries); producing fabrics, and other textiles; producing an interlacing or interlocking yarn network to form a textile e.g. T-shirt; and making garments or apparels including outerwear, coats, pants, dresses, skirts, suits, underwear, swimsuits, active-wears, belts, ponchos, trousers, shorts, footwear, fleece, tees, bottoms, socks, bag, hats, handkerchiefs, scarves, and gloves.    ADVANTAGE - The biodegradable fiber blend: provides textiles with biodegradable properties that are beneficial to the natural environment; provides a practically usable yarn with sufficiently high tenacity, and can be knitted with high speed industrial machines without excessive breakage to produce high quality garments having basic properties, as compared to that made from virgin materials, while also being biodegradable, sustainable, and environmentally friendly; can impart desirable characteristics e.g. strength, durability, softness, absorbency, ease of washing, resistance to wrinkling and/or tear, shape and/or color retention, and improved aesthetic effects; and reduces cost by combining expensive fibers with less costly ones, or may achieve special color or texture effects.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for:    (1) a biodegradable textile yarn (104) comprising many biodegradable fiber blends, where each of the biodegradable fiber blends comprise the components (a)-(b) as per se; and    (2) a biodegradable textile comprising a network of a biodegradable textile yarn, where the biodegradable textile yarn comprises the biodegradable fiber blends, and each of the biodegradable fiber blends comprising the components (a)-(b) as per se. The                extraction step is carried out in an extruder (10)                by adding a fluid or fluid mixture which                solubilizes the polymers, and the extracted                pollutant is evacuated under atmospheric pressure                or under vacuum during extrusion, prior to passing                through an extrusion head (24). The fluid is water                or a mixture containing water introduced into the                extruder under a pressure that is higher than that                present in the extruder.    USE - The method is useful for granulating polymer                such as polypropylene from a crushed post-consumer                material to manufacture a material for automobile                parts (all claimed) such as a bumper.    ADVANTAGE - The method is capable of manufacturing g the                material of automobile parts without appearance                defects when the parts are painted or coated with                another coating.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The method comprises extracting volatile                organic compounds, dissolved salts, and/or unmelted                materials present at a center of polymers. The                extraction step is carried out using an extruder                (10) by adding a fluid or fluid mixture, which                solubilizes the polymers, and the extracted                pollutant is evacuated under atmospheric pressure                or under vacuum during extrusion before passing                through an extrusion head (24). The fluid is water                or a mixture containing water introduced into the                extruder under a pressure that is higher than that                present in the extruder. The water is added in an                amount of: 30 g per kg of extrudate, when the                material to be extruded contains 0.4 wt.% of                volatile organic compounds; 50 g per kg of                extrudate, when the material contains 0.4-0.55 wt.%                of volatile organic compounds; and 60 g per kg of                extrudate, when the material contains 0.55-0.7 wt.%                of volatile organic compounds. The fluid or fluid                mixture is added after adding optional additives                and added to two thirds of the extruder. The                volatile organic compounds have molecular weight of                less than 400 g/mol. INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are                included for:    (1) a method of recycling polymers from                post-consumer materials; and    (2) an automobile part.  JP2000001502-A;  CA2269996-A1;  US6068705-A;  MX210620-B;  EP953578-A3	Manufacturing of low-DE starch hydrolysate useful in e.g. sweeteners or energy drinks, or for encapsulating ingredients	TANG D;  ZHOU L;  GERHARDT R;  ABOU-NEMEH I;  JAUNDOO C;  PARADY T;  IBRAHIM A N;  CARL J;  TOM P;  DAN T	ROQUETTE FRERES SA (ROQF-C);  ROQUETTE FRERES (ROQF-C);  ROQUETTE FRERES SA (ROQF-C)	1999621830	   NOVELTY - Manufacturing of a low-DE (dextrose equivalent) starch hydrolysate comprises fractionation of a starch hydrolysate with a DE of at least 18 using a nanofiltration membrane to produce a starch hydrolysate with a low DE (up to 25).    USE - The low-DE starch hydrolysate is produced thickeners or additives for e.g. synthetic sweetener, or as energy source in drinks for sportsmen. They are also used in emulsions for encapsulating e.g. oils, perfumes, colorants, insecticides or medicaments.    ADVANTAGE - The emulsion is thermally stable and stable in storage (claimed). The low-DE starch hydrolysates have no taste, low sweetness and low hygroscopicity. The liquid low-DE starch hydrolysates have also a low viscosity suitable for drying by atomization or extrusion.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The nanofiltration membrane is made of teflon, stainless steal, ceramic or polymer, and has a molecular weight fractionation of at least 4000 Daltons.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for:    (1) a starch hydrolysate with a DE of up to 25 and a polydispersity index of 5;    (2) the manufacturing of an emulsion comprising the low-DE starch hydrolysate;    (3) an emulsion comprising the low-DE starch hydrolysate and at least another ingredient;    (4) the manufacturing of an encapsulated dry ingredient comprising:    (a) producing a low-DE starch hydrolysate, preferably hydrogenated;    (b) mixing the starch hydrolysate with at least one ingredient; and    (c) drying the mixture; and    (5) an encapsulated dry ingredient comprising at least one ingredient trapped in the amorphous matrix of the product.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows schematic view of the nanofiltration process.    Feeding tank (1)    Membrane (5)    Permeate (6)    Retentate (7)    Recycling loop (8) 		   (JP2000001502-A)   NOVELTY - Manufacturing of a low-DE (dextrose equivalent) starch hydrolysate comprises fractionation of a starch hydrolysate with a DE of at least 18 using a nanofiltration membrane to produce a starch hydrolysate with a low DE (up to 25).    USE - The low-DE starch hydrolysate is produced thickeners or additives for e.g. synthetic sweetener, or as energy source in drinks for sportsmen. They are also used in emulsions for encapsulating e.g. oils, perfumes, colorants, insecticides or medicaments.    ADVANTAGE - The emulsion is thermally stable and stable in storage (claimed). The low-DE starch hydrolysates have no taste, low sweetness and low hygroscopicity. The liquid low-DE starch hydrolysates have also a low viscosity suitable for drying by atomization or extrusion. USE - For adhesive comprising natural or synthetic polymer and a resin, pressure sensitive adhesive (PSA) containing natural rubber, sealants, road marking materials, paper additives, inks and polymer compositions (all claimed). Also for rubbers, paints, floorings, hot-melt coatings/adhesives or contact adhesives including wood working, packaging, book binding or disposables, rubber compounds, pipe wrapping, carpet backing, tire construction or additives, and in applications such as tapes, labels, paper impregnation, release liners, polymeric foil and packaging tapes. Also used as modifiers in adhesives, sealants, inks, coatings, plastics, polymer films, construction applications, floorings and paper additives, as cleaning re-texturizing agents and as tackifiers in adhesive systems.    ADVANTAGE - The novel petroleum resin has good shear stability when used in PSA or metal and cardboard. The catalyst enables production of resins having 100% aromatic content which improves adhesive properties when used as a tackifier. The catalyst is effective in the presence of small amount of water in the feed and can be used without costly, rigorous drying of the feed. The catalyst provides greater control over acidity by varying the nature of support and the nature and amount of co-catalyst, for better control of resin properties particularly molecular weight and polydispersity which is important to ensure compatibility of resin with polymers. The catalyst is robust, stable and retain the activity over prolonged time thereby indicating its viable commercial utility. Fixed bed catalysts are preferred since they improve the color of resin by removing color formers to obtain resins of improved color. Because the acid sites are an integral part of the catalyst, contamination of the resin products or solvents with catalyst residues is minimized. The resins are substantially free of fluoride impurities. The catalyst can be regenerated and recycled to minimize waste disposal of spent catalyst, are non-hazardous and prevents generation of corrosive or hazardous liquid or gaseous acids on exposure to moisture. Ratio between equivalents of ionizable acid groups of polymer (P1) and compound (A), if any, and equivalents of ionizable amino groups of polymer (P2) and compound (A), if any, is 1.4-0.6, preferably 1.1-0.9.    USE - A composition for forming supramolecular adduct and used for coating a surface and manufacturing a formed article (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The compositions comprise ionic polymers and anthracene derivatives, which are simultaneously able to create ionic networks and which are able to undergo a cycloaddition reaction under certain stimuli, reversibly forming adducts endowed with improved or additional properties with respect to those of the starting composition. Covalent bonds uniting moieties derived from anthracene UV-induced dimerization can be broken on demand without affecting the ionic supramolecular structure nor the ionic bond of the anthracenes to the other constituting polymeric chains, so that the viscosity and/or mechanical properties can be tuned accordingly to specific needs.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) supramolecular adduct which is obtained by exposing the composition (C) to UV light at a wavelength range of 300-600 nm, preferably 350-400 nm;    (2) coating a surface which involves applying the composition (C) to a surface, where composition (C) optionally comprises liquid medium (medium (L)), and/or optionally comprises greater than or equal to 1 additive, and irradiating the surface at a wavelength range of 300-600 nm, preferably 350-400 nm;    (3) manufacture of a formed article which involves filling a mold with the composition (C) and irradiating the filled mold at a wavelength range of 300-600 nm, preferably 350-400 nm;    (4) recycling a coating or a formed article comprising the supramolecular adduct which involves submitting the coating or formed article to UV irradiation at wavelengths lower than 300 nm; and    (5) recycled material. CHEM., vol. 52, 1980, pages 2633 - 2648	129411-0-0-0 			R00806 		IN201921034708-A;  WO2021038512-A1;  WO2021038512-A8;  CN114599713-A;  US2022282036-A1	Making eco-friendly specialty polyesters and            co-polyesters from recycled bis-2-hydroxyethyl            terephthalate (rBHET), comprises e.g. melting rBHET            powder, adding catalyst and additive to powder, and            adding diols and/or comonomers to mixture	KULKARNI S T	KULKARNI S T (KULK-Individual);  KULKARNI S T (KULK-Individual)	2020C9656J	   NOVELTY - Preparing an eco-friendly specialty polyesters                and co-polyesters from recycled bis-2-hydroxyethyl                terephthalate (rBHET), comprises: e.g. (a) melting                rBHET powder in a reactor by increasing temperature                to 120 degrees C; (b) adding catalyst and at least                one additive to the melted rBHET powder; (c)                increasing temperature of the mixture of step (b)                gradually of 120-240 degrees C; (d) adding diols                and/or comonomers to the mixture of step (c) and                applying a pressure of 2.5 bar absolute to the                mixture for a 30-40 minutes followed by                depressurizing the reactor in 10 minutes and                evacuating the reactor gradually to a pressure of                100 mb in 30 minutes to distill the byproduct; and                (e) increasing temperature of the product to 290                degrees C and reducing the reactor pressure to 0.2                mb to obtain polymerized product having degree of                polymerization (DP) greater than 50.    USE - The process is useful for preparing                eco-friendly specialty polyesters and                co-polyesters, where the polyesters and                co-polyesters are used for textiles, packaging,                engineering and industry.    ADVANTAGE - The process: provides the high quality, clean                polyesters/co-polyesters from BHET derived from PET                waste; provides the product chemically recycled PET                made by using recycled BHET that is absolutely free                of contamination and hence can be used to 100%                extent for manufacture of specialty products                without any processing issues which will be as good                as products made from virgin raw materials for                applications in textiles and packaging; provides                the products that are green and support environment                protection and sustainability; provides the                recycled BHET that has very low acid end groups and                no esterification reaction to be carried out, make                high quality chemically recycled PET as compared to                virgin raw material process and conversion cost                lower than conventional process with virgin raw                materials; and is free of antimony catalyst, final                products which are free from heavy metals.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Preparing an eco-friendly specialty polyesters                and co-polyesters from recycled bis-2-hydroxyethyl                terephthalate (rBHET), comprises: (a) melting rBHET                powder in a reactor by increasing temperature to                120 degrees C; (b) adding catalyst and at least one                additive to the melted rBHET powder; (c) increasing                temperature of the mixture of step (b) gradually of                120-240 degrees C; (d) adding diols and/or                comonomers to the mixture of step (c) and applying                a pressure of 2.5 bar absolute to the mixture for a                30-40 minutes followed by depressurizing the                reactor in 10 minutes and evacuating the reactor                gradually to a pressure of 100 mb in 30 minutes to                distill the byproduct; (e) increasing temperature                of the product to 290 degrees C and reducing the                reactor pressure to 0.2 mb to obtain polymerized                product having degree of polymerization (DP)                greater than 50; (f) terminating the reaction and                granulating the polymer; (g) optionally upgrading                the granules by solid state polymerization (SSP)                process at 160-220 degrees C under vacuum in batch                reactor or in continuous SSP process operating                under nitrogen purge; and (h) cooling and packing                the polyester or co-polyester obtained as final                product. An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for                a specialty polyester/co-polyester obtained from                rBHET obtained from by the process having                characteristics of melt flow rate of 5-60 g/10                minutes at 270 degrees C under 2.16 kg weight,                intrinsic viscosity more than 0.25 dl/g and up to                1.6 dl/g, sulfonated salt content up to 50 wt.%                i.e. Sulfur content upto 50000 ppm, phosphorus                content up to 60000 ppm as reactive flame retardant                additive.  LANDSCHEID A;  LANDSCHEIDT A;  HARTAN H;  HARTAN G	CHEM FAB STOCKHAUSEN & CIE (CHFS-C);  CHEM FAB STOCKHAUSEN GMBH (CHFS-C);  CHEM FAB STOCKHAUSEN GMBH (CHFS-C)	1990261760	      Process is claimed for fixing interfering substances (I) in paper prodn. by adding as fixing agents, polymers (II) of 50-100 wt.% quaternised dimethylaminopropyl (meth)acrylamide (III) and 0-50 wt.% acrylamide, (meth)acrylic acid or acrylamidomethyl propane sulphonic acid or its mixt. (IV), with intrinsic viscosity below 150 ml/g.    Amt. of (II) is 0.05-1 (pref. 0.2-0.8) wt.% w.r.t. dry wt. of the paper produced; (III) is quaternised with dimethyl sulphate, MeCl, EtBr, dimethyl carbonate or benzyl chloride; the total amt. of (II) added is distributed to various addn. points; (II) is used in combination with normal cationic paper additives, with or without the addn. of aluminium sulphate; (II) is used in paper prodn. processes in which the water circulation is more than 90% closed.    ADVANTAGE -   The process enables interfering substances (dissolved or colloidal oligomers, polymers, etc.) to be fixed on the paper fibre without adverse effect on the action of the normal draining agents, retention aids, flocculating agents, etc. or on the whiteness of the prod. 		   (US5292404-A)      In the mfr. of paper, paper pulp is contacted with water and chemical resulting in the prodn. of by-product trash comprising dissolved or colloidally dissolved anionic oligomers or polymers and nonionic hydrocolloids. The trash is contained in the water and the water is recycled.    Excess build-up of trash is prevented in the recycled water by incorporating a polymer consisting of (a) 50-100 wt. % quaternised dimethyl aminopropyl acrylamide or dimethylaminopropyl methacrylamide and (b) 0-50 wt. % acrylamide, acrylic acid, methacrylic acid, acrylamide-methyl-propane sulphonic acid or mixts. of these monomers. The polymer exhibits an intrinsic viscosity of at most 100 ml/g determined 10 wt. % NaCl soln.    ADVANTAGE -   Trash is used in simple and economical way without using ammonium sulphate.    (JP2854072-B2)      Process is claimed for fixing interfering substances (I) in paper prodn. by adding as fixing agents, polymers (II) of 50-100 wt.% quaternised dimethylaminopropyl (meth)acrylamide (III) and 0-50 wt.% acrylamide, (meth)acrylic acid or acrylamidomethyl propane sulphonic acid or its mixt. (IV), with intrinsic viscosity below 150 ml/g.    Amt. of (II) is 0.05-1 (pref. 0.2-0.8) wt.% w.r.t. dry wt. of the paper produced; (III) is quaternised with dimethyl sulphate, MeCl, EtBr, dimethyl carbonate or benzyl chloride; the total amt. of (II) added is distributed to various addn. points; (II) is used in combination with normal cationic paper additives, with or without the addn. of aluminium sulphate; (II) is used in paper prodn. processes in which the water circulation is more than 90% closed.    ADVANTAGE -   The process enables interfering substances (dissolved or colloidal oligomers, polymers, etc.) to be fixed on the paper fibre without adverse effect on the action of the normal draining agents, retention aids, flocculating agents, etc. or on the whiteness of the prod. Auhorn "Das Storstoff-Problem bei Verringerung der spezifschen Abwassermenge", Seiten 37-48	448-0-0-0 USE					FR3055336-A1;  EP3290477-A1;  EP3290477-B1;  FR3055336-B1	Recyclable and biodegradable plastic composition            used to prepare article for food contact, comprises            first bioplastic polymer, mineral filler, plasticizer,            fatty acid, second bioplastic polymer, and optionally            e.g. additional mineral filler	GODET R;  CHAUVEL M	ICCI SEA SAS (ICCI-Non-standard);  ICCI SEA SAS (ICCI-Non-standard)	201816576A	   NOVELTY - Recyclable and biodegradable plastic                composition, comprises: 50-95 (preferably 76-85)                wt.% of a first bioplastic polymer, where the first                bioplastic polymer is poly (butylene succinate);                1-20 (preferably 5-15) wt.% of a mineral filler                having a microstructure in sheets; 1-10 (preferably                3-7) wt.% of a plasticizer compound; 0-10                (preferably 0-3) wt.% of a fatty acid; 0-5                (preferably less than 1) wt.% of a second                bioplastic polymer, where the second bioplastic                polymer is polylactic acid; and optionally at least                one other compound of e.g. a chain extender                compound and additional mineral filler.    USE - The recyclable and biodegradable plastic                composition is useful for the manufacture of                article for food contact, where the article is a                tide box or fish crate and the article is useful                for the storage or packaging of a product intended                for human or animal consumption, storage or                packaging of a product of the sea, storing or                packaging a seafood product comprising fish,                cephalopods, crustaceans and/or algae and storage                or conditioning of fish (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The recyclable and biodegradable plastic                composition exhibits resistance to aggressive                environmental conditions including high salinity,                high exposure to UV radiation and/or large                temperature change and exhibits improved mechanical                properties, preferably good tensile strength,                flexion and high impact strength.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Recyclable and biodegradable plastic                composition, comprises: 50-95 (preferably 76-85)                wt.% of a first bioplastic polymer, where the first                bioplastic polymer is poly (butylene succinate);                1-20 (preferably 5-15) wt.% of a mineral filler                having a microstructure in sheets; 1-10 (preferably                3-7) wt.% of a plasticizer compound; 0-10                (preferably 0-3) wt.% of a fatty acid; 0-5                (preferably less than 1) wt.% of a second                bioplastic polymer, where the second bioplastic                polymer is polylactic acid; and optionally at least                one other compound of a chain extender compound, an                additional mineral filler, fibrous reinforcements                comprising animal natural fibers, fibrous                reinforcements comprising natural plant fibers, a                biosourced flame retardant compound, an anti-UV                compound and/or an organoleptic property-improving                agent. INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included                for:    (1) manufacturing the composition, where the                process is injection (preferred), extrusion,                thermoforming, calendering and/or additive                manufacturing processes; and    (2) an article for food contact, comprising                walls having an average thickness of at least 0.5                mm, where the article is obtained from the                composition.  DORENGE J	TOTAL MARKETING SERVICES (PETF-C);  TOTAL MARKETING SERVICES (PETF-C);  TOTALENERGIES ONE TECH (PETF-C)	202112956F	   NOVELTY - Bitumen/heat-crosslinked and fluxed polymer composition obtained by the process comprises: (1) the supply of a heat-crosslinked bituminous composition obtained by the implementation of a preparation process characterized in that a bitumen/polymer composition is heated to a temperature of 100-200 degrees C comprising at least bitumen, an olefinic polymer adjuvant functionalized with at least one epoxy group, a first elastomer chosen from copolymers with heat-crosslinkable block (I), optionally a second elastomer comprising copolymers with heat-crosslinkable blocks (II), the heat-crosslinkable copolymer of (I) and the heat-crosslinkable copolymer of (II) being present in a mass ratio is greater than 3: 2-1:0, and optionally additives, the bitumen/polymer composition comprising less than 6 ppm of sulfur-containing crosslinking agent; and (2) mixing the bituminous composition with at least one fluxing agent.    USE - The composition is useful for asphalt, preparing surface coating material for roads, bituminous mix and waterproofing coating, vibration damping membrane or impregnation layer (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - The composition: exhibits excessively high pseudo-viscosity which is incompatible with road application or for the manufacture of industrial coatings, before and after prolonged storage at 160?C, which is too high to be used as a road binder or for preparation of industrial coatings; has equivalent manner directly after their preparation, after 3 days of storage at 160 degrees C or again after 10 days of storage at 160 degrees C; can be stored for several days at a temperature of 160?C without their viscosity being deteriorated; and has good mechanical properties and good elastic properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Bitumen/heat-crosslinked and fluxed polymer composition obtained by the process comprises: (1) the supply of a heat-crosslinked bituminous composition obtained by the implementation of a preparation process characterized in that a bitumen/polymer composition is heated to a temperature of 100-200 degrees C comprising at least bitumen, an olefinic polymer adjuvant functionalized with at least one epoxy group, a first elastomer chosen from copolymers with heat-crosslinkable block of formula (S1-B1) (I), optionally a second elastomer comprising copolymers with heat-crosslinkable blocks of formula (S1-B1-S1) (II), the heat-crosslinkable copolymer of (I) and the heat-crosslinkable copolymer of (II) being present in a mass ratio is greater than 3: 2-1:0, and optionally additives, the bitumen/ polymer composition comprising less than 6 ppm of sulfur-containing crosslinking agent; and (2) mixing the bituminous composition with at least one fluxing agent.    S1 = block based on monovinyl aromatic hydrocarbon monomers; and    B1 = block based on butadiene monomers.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for:    (1) asphalt comprises at least one heat-crosslinked and fluxed bitumen/polymer composition and mineral and/or synthetic fillers;    (2) bituminous mix comprises at least one heat-crosslinked and fluxed bitumen/polymer composition, aggregates, and optionally mineral and/or synthetic fillers;    (3) preparing a material comprising surface coating, a hot mix, a warm mix, a cold mix, a cold mix , a serious emulsion, comprising the mixing of at least one bitumen/heat-crosslinked and fluxed polymer with aggregates and/or recycling mills;    (4) preparing a vibration damping membrane, a thermal and/or sound insulation membrane, a surface covering, carpet tiles, an impregnation layer, comprising the use of at least one heat-crosslinked and fluxed bitumen/polymer composition;    (5) preparing surface coating, hot mix, warm mix, cold mix, cold-cast mix, serious emulsion, the bitumen/heat-crosslinked polymer composition being associated with aggregates and/or recycling mills; and    (6) manufacture of coatings for roads, pavements, sidewalks, roads, urban developments, floors, waterproofing of buildings or structures, comprising the application of at least one bitumen/polymer composition heat-crosslinked and fluxed or of an asphalt composition or of a bituminous mix.  ZHOU C;  ZHONG X	JIANGSU GUOSHENG PAPER IND CO LTD (JIAN-Non-standard)	202089341W	   NOVELTY - Manufacturing recycled paper comprises e. g.                (i) sending sorted and purified waste paper into                rough shredding device, shredding it into 2.5-3.5                cm pieces, where the waste paper comes from yellow                board paper, and crushing the fragments obtained                through the coarse shredding device by a shredder,                pouring the crushed pieces into a beater and mixing                with water for grinding, grinding the fragments                into pulp, and initially filtering the ground pulp                through the filter, stirring for 20-30 minutes,                filtering the regenerated pulp, and keeping the                finished regenerated pulp continuously stirred for                8-12 minutes; (ii) adding 0.2-0.6 g magnesium                hydroxide powder to 20-40 ml long-chain alkyl acid                ethanol solution, stirring at room temperature for                1-2 hours, filtering by suction and washing with                deionized water and ethanol to obtain magnesium                hydroxide flame retardant; and (iii) adding                waterproofing agent and magnesium hydroxide flame                retardant into the pulp and washing the pulp.    USE - The method is useful for manufacturing                recycled paper.    ADVANTAGE - The method makes the recycled paper achieve                water repellent and waterproof effects and                maintains the integrity of the recycled paper. The                recycled paper has high temperature resistance and                heat resistance.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Manufacturing recycled paper comprises (i)                sending sorted and purified waste paper into rough                shredding device, shredding it into 2.5-3.5 cm                pieces, where the waste paper comes from yellow                board paper, and crushing the fragments obtained                through the coarse shredding device by a shredder,                pouring the crushed pieces into a beater and mixing                with water for grinding, grinding the fragments                into pulp, and initially filtering the ground pulp                through the filter, stirring for 20-30 minutes,                filtering the regenerated pulp, and keeping the                finished regenerated pulp continuously stirred for                8-12 minutes; (ii) adding 0.2-0.6 g magnesium                hydroxide powder to 20-40 ml long-chain alkyl acid                ethanol solution, where the concentration of the                long-chain alkyl acid is 5 mM, stirring at room                temperature for 1-2 hours, filtering by suction and                washing with deionized water and ethanol to obtain                magnesium hydroxide flame retardant; (iii) adding                waterproofing agent and magnesium hydroxide flame                retardant into the pulp and washing the pulp; (iv)                adding plant pigment fragrance into the pulp, and                mixing uniformly using a mixer; (v) removing the                pulp, keeping the silk is on the bottom and wooden                frame is on the top, and covering the bottom with a                rag, pouring the well-stirred pulp and shaking                uniformly, and using the pulping machine to wash                the pulp in mass production; (vi) flattening the                finished recycled paper at temperature of 60-70                degrees C, where the pressure on the upper surface                of the recycled paper is 600-800 MP; and (vii)                drying the recycled paper using a dryer. An                INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for recycled                paper, comprising 86-88 wt.% waste paper, 3-5 wt.%                calcium carbonate, 2-3.2 wt.% water-soluble                polymer, 0.8-3 wt.% styrene butadiene latex, 1-1.6                wt.% starch, 0.4-0.6 wt.% additive, 1-1.4 wt.%                plant pigment, 0.5-0.9 wt.% theophylline, 0.5-1.1                wt.% flame retardant, where the starch includes                0.66-0.96 wt.% oxidized starch and 0.34-0.64 wt.%                native starch.  JANG M (JANG-Individual)	202174191G	   NOVELTY - Stamping foil comprises (a) base film which is removed after stamping transfer, (b1) wear-resistant release layer formed on the base film and containing polyurethane-based release agent, acrylic resin, and ethene-based polymer additive, (or) (b2) (i) polyurethane-based release layer formed on the base film and (ii) a wear-resistant layer formed on the polyurethane-based release layer and containing an acrylic matrix resin and an ethene-based polymer additive, (c) moisture penetration-preventing and metal-deposited heat-resistant cured coating layer, (d) metal deposition layer formed on the moisture penetration-preventing cured coating layer, and (e) optionally, thick film protective layer formed on the metal deposition layer for preventing the corrosion of the metal deposition layer.    USE - The stamping foil is useful for manufacturing adherend (claimed) and manufacturing eco-friendly paper packaging material recycled by separating transfer film and paper.    ADVANTAGE - The stamping foil blocks air pollution and saves energy by fundamentally preventing the generation of carbon dioxide generated when the existing laminated packaging materials are incinerated and discarded. The method blocks the contamination of the adherend during the transfer operation with paper, improves surface scratch problems occurring in the manufacturing process and handling of an adherend on which stamping foil is applied, prevents problem in which a transfer layer of stamping foil is separated at a portion that is bent when the adherend is folded, secures binding force in printing with various inks, and prevents powder generated during cutting according to a product standard in a stamping foil manufacturing process.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method of manufacturing an adherend to which a stamping foil is applied using the above-mentioned stamping foil, involving (I) applying an adhesive layer to the thick protective layer of the stamping foil or using a stamping foil in which an adhesive layer is formed on the thick protective layer, and (II) applying an adhesive layer to the entire surface or part of the adherend, stamping and transferring the stamping foil to the adherend, removing the base film of the stamping foil, and optionally printing on the surface of the release layer exposed by removing the base film.  KR1995215-B1   FUTURE TECHNOLOGY RES CENT INC (FUTU-Non-standard)   HO O K,  HYUN K D;  US20180215190-A1   		1145-0-0-0 ; 621-0-0-0 ; 1013-0-0-0 			R00964 ; R00338 ; R00326 		JP2005255635-A	Cleaning method of cyclic and/or chain shaped phospho nitrile acid ester, involves adding reaction liquid of phospho nitrile acid ester manufacturing process, to aqueous solution of hydration metal, and neutralizing by adding acid component	KUWATA K	ASAHI KASEI KK (ASAH-C)	2005728308	   NOVELTY - A reaction liquid obtained by reacting cyclic and/or chain shaped phospho nitrile dichloride, alkali metal acrylate, and alkali metal alcoholate, is cleaned in an aqueous solution of hydration metal, and then neutralized by adding an acid component such that the water phase side after washing the reaction liquid has pH of 1-9. An acid component is added to wastewater after rinsing, and recycled.    USE - For removing unreacted phenol, alcohol and metal salt from phospho nitrile acid ester. Pure phospho nitrile acid ester is used as additive for plastic, rubber, fertilizer and pharmaceutical.    ADVANTAGE - The amount of unreacted phenol, alcohol and metal salt is reduced and a phospho nitrile acid ester of high purity is recovered. The wastewater is recycled, hence reduction of wastewater treatment expense, is attained. The ester has excellent hydrolysability proof property and heat resistance. Physical property reduction of resin composition is suppressed, hence derivatives, oligomer and polymer of phospho nitrile acid ester, is efficiently manufactured.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A reaction liquid obtained by reacting cyclic and/or chain shaped phospho nitrile dichloride of formula (1), alkali metal acrylate of formulae (2) or (3), and alkali metal alcoholate of formula R7O-M (4), is cleaned in an aqueous solution (5-25 mass%) of hydration metal of formula: M1(OH)n, and then neutralized by adding an acid component such that the water phase side after washing the reaction liquid has pH of 1-9.    The concentration of unreacted phenol and/or unreacted alcohol is 1.0 mol or less with respect to 1 mol of cyclic and/or chain shaped phospho nitrile acid ester of formula (5), in the reaction liquid. An acid component is added to the wastewater after rinsing process, and the wastewater generated is recycled for acid cleaning process.    m=3 or more;    M,M1=alkali metal;    R1-R5=H or OM group, 1-10C aliphatic or aromatic hydrocarbon group;    R6=1-10C aliphatic or aromatic hydrocarbon;    R7=1-10C aliphatic hydrocarbon;    Q=aryloxy group or alkoxy group;    n=valency of the metal.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The figure shows the flow chart of recycle of waste-water. (Drawing includes non-English language text). The forming lifting platform                (2) is connected to the bottom of the loading                platform. The printing platform (3) is arranged in                the middle of the loading platform. The printing                platform is installed in the forming lifting                platform. The long fiber laying machine (4), laser                scanning system (5) and ultraviolet-light emitting                diode lamps are arranged above the printing                platform. The ultraviolet-light emitting diode lamp                is disposed on one side of the long fiber laying                machine. The scraper is also mounted on the loading                platform.    USE - Used as laser additive manufacturing                device.    ADVANTAGE - The long fiber reinforced layer has excellent                flatness.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is also included for                processing long fiber reinforced ceramic matrix                composite parts, comprising (i) (a) defoaming the                uniformly mixed ceramic slurry in a vacuum                defoaming machine for 1 hour, (b) applying an                interface improving material to the surface of the                long fiber; (ii) designing a three-dimensional                model of the part in three-dimensional modeling                software and importing the fiber laying path data                and the scraper motion path data into the additive                manufacturing device; (iii) setting the operating                parameters of the laser additive manufacturing                device, where the operating parameters comprises                laser scanning process parameters, equipment motion                parameters and slice thickness and initializing a                control system for the laser additive manufacturing                device according to the set operating parameters;                (iv) uniformly mixing and sealing agitation of the                ceramic slurry and transferring the stirred ceramic                material slurry from the storage tank to the                loading platform by a pumping system; (v)                controlling the scraper to perform horizontal                reciprocating motion, leveling the ceramic slurry                on the loading platform horizontally and flowing                excess ceramic slurry into the material recovery                tank of the recycling system; (vi) performing laser                scanning using laser scanning system on the ceramic                slurry on the loading platform according to the set                laser pulse width, power density and beam focal                spot so the ceramic slurry undergoes polymerization                cross-linking curing reaction to obtain a ceramic                solidified layer; (vii) coating the long fibers                with UV curing glue using the long fiber laying                machine and laying long fibers on the cured ceramic                substrate according to the set path; (viii)                emitting ultraviolet light by ultraviolet-light                emitting diode lamps in the process of laying long                fibers, illuminating long fibers using ultraviolet                light and curing long fibers coated with                ultraviolet curable glue on the ceramic cured                layer; (ix) controlling the loading platform to                descend according to the set processing speed using                lifting and lowering of the loading platform and                lifting the lifting speed and controlling the                printing layer thickness and the printing speed;                (x) repeating steps (iv) to (ix) until all the                layered slices have been printed to obtain formed                blank; (xi) controlling the loading platform to                rise to the initial position by the lifting                platform, cutting long fibers, removing the molded                blank, cleaning the shaped body with a cleaning                solution, placing the cleaned molded blank in a                degreasing furnace for degreasing and removing the                shaped blank of the polymer material in the formed                blank; and (xii) sintering the degreased formed                blank in a high temperature sintering furnace and                cooling the furnace body to room temperature and                taking out the parts.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a schematic representation                of the laser additive manufacturing device. EYAL A M;  WITZKE D;  FISHER R	YISSUM RES & DEV CO (YISS-C);  YISSUM RES & DEV CO (YISS-C);  YISSUM RES & DEV CO (YISS-C);  YISSUM RES DEV CO HEBREW UNIV JERUSALEM (YISS-C);  YISSUM RES DEV CO HEBREW UNIV JERUSALEM (YISS-C);  EYAL A M (EYAL-Individual);  WITZKE D (WITZ-Individual);  FISHER R (FISH-Individual);  YISSUM RES DEV CO HEBREW UNIV JERUSALEM (YISS-C);  YISSUM RES DEV CO HEBREW UNIV JERUSALEM (YISS-C)	1998467469	      Production of lactic acid (LA) and products from it, from a medium containing an alkaline earth metal (AEM) salt of LA, comprising: (a) reacting a conjugated base of an alkali metal from step (d) with the medium to form a water soluble alkali metal lactate (AML) and a basic compound of the AEM; (b) separating the AM LA salt and AEM basic compound; (c) splitting the water soluble AML to reform conjugated alkali metal base and a LA product, as LA, or its derivatives, or their combinations; (e) recycling the conjugated alkali metal base, or a product of it, in (a); and (f) recycling the basic AEM compound, or a product from it, to form a AEM salt of LA; is new.    USE -   LA is used in a variety of chemical and pharmaceutical applications, and as a food additive. Notable uses as for manufacture of its esters as solvents, and production of biodegradable polylactic acid polymers as a replacement for non-degradable plastics, or other uses in which biodegradability is desired. The process provides an efficient complete recovery process for LA in purity better than 95% from solutions of its salts. Operation can be in batch, continuous, or semi-continuous mode. The feed medium is normally that obtained by fermentation of carbohydrate, the standard method for LA production, and the AEM compound is used to neutralise the acidity and avoid inhibition of the fermentation by acid. AEM lactates are not very soluble, and it is preferred to convert to a more soluble AML.    ADVANTAGE -   The process runs without irreversible consumption of bases and/or acids and formation of waste products. All reagents can be recycled. By contrast, present common processes acidify the liquor with sulphuric acid, resulting in formation of large amounts of gypsum waste. Fresh AEM compound and sulphuric acid are required as reagents, and are consumed, not recovered. The other process, splitting by electrochemical action, is energy intensive and expensive. 		   (EP970035-A1)      Production of lactic acid (LA) and products from it, from a medium containing an alkaline earth metal (AEM) salt of LA, comprising: (a) reacting a conjugated base of an alkali metal from step (d) with the medium to form a water soluble alkali metal lactate (AML) and a basic compound of the AEM; (b) separating the AM LA salt and AEM basic compound; (c) splitting the water soluble AML to reform conjugated alkali metal base and a LA product, as LA, or its derivatives, or their combinations; (e) recycling the conjugated alkali metal base, or a product of it, in (a); and (f) recycling the basic AEM compound, or a product from it, to form a AEM salt of LA; is new.    USE -   LA is used in a variety of chemical and pharmaceutical applications, and as a food additive. Notable uses as for manufacture of its esters as solvents, and production of biodegradable polylactic acid polymers as a replacement for non-degradable plastics, or other uses in which biodegradability is desired. The process provides an efficient complete recovery process for LA in purity better than 95% from solutions of its salts. Operation can be in batch, continuous, or semi-continuous mode. The feed medium is normally that obtained by fermentation of carbohydrate, the standard method for LA production, and the AEM compound is used to neutralise the acidity and avoid inhibition of the fermentation by acid. AEM lactates are not very soluble, and it is preferred to convert to a more soluble AML.    ADVANTAGE -   The process runs without irreversible consumption of bases and/or acids and formation of waste products. All reagents can be recycled. By contrast, present common processes acidify the liquor with sulphuric acid, resulting in formation of large amounts of gypsum waste. Fresh AEM compound and sulphuric acid are required as reagents, and are consumed, not recovered. The other process, splitting by electrochemical action, is energy intensive and expensive.  DE3810027-A;  DE3810027-C;  EP334075-B1;  DE58909334-G;  ES2077567-T3	Eraser rubber with good resistance to heat, light and ageing - comprises block copolymer of styrene! with butylene and-or propylene	WEISSMANN K H;  SCHMIDT F;  KRUGER D;  WEISSMANN K;  KRUEGER D	PELIKAN AG (PELI-C);  PELIKAN GMBH (PELI-C);  PELIKAN AG (PELI-C);  PELIKAN GMBH (PELI-C)	1989279483	      Eraser rubber (I) contains a styrene block copolymer (II), fillers and, opt., other additives. The novelty is that (II) is a thermoplastic elastomer in the form of (a) a styrene-butylene and/or propylene-styrene block copolymer and/or (b) a styrene-butylene and/or propylene block copolymer.    Specifically copolymer (a) also has ethylene units in the middle block, and is pref, a styrene-ethylene-butylene block copolymer; (I) contains 5-35 (pref. 15-25) wt.% (II); (I) also contains a thermoplastic flow-improver, pref. a thermoplastic (III) and an external plasticiser and/or mineral oil (IV); (I) contains 15-25 wt.% (IV) and up to 15 wt.% (III); (III) is a polyolefin, e.g. PE, PP or poly-isobutylene, a polycarbonate, a polyamide, a vinyl polymer, e.g. polystyrene, a polyacetal, a polyester and/or a polyurethane; (I) also contains a factice, pref. 2-25 wt.%.    ADVANTAGE -   Incorporation of (III) and (IV) enables prodn. of (I) by extrusion, injection-moulding, etc. without the need for vulcanisation, and scrap (I) can be recycled without further processing; (I) has high thermal stability and resistance to light and ageing. 		   (DE3810027-C)      Rubber eraser contains a) 5-35 (pref. 15-25) wt.% of a styrene- butylene/ethylene-styrene block copolymer; b) fillers; and opt. c) further additives.    Pref. the eraser contains an agent for improving the thermoplastic flow properties, esp. a thermoplast and an external plasticizer and/or a mineral oil. Pref. the thermoplast is a polyolefin, esp. polyethylene, polypropylene or polyisobutylene, a polycarbonate; a polyamide; a polyacetal; a polyester; a polyurethane; and/or a polyvinyl cpd., esp. polystyrene.    ADVANTAGE -   the starting materials for the eraser, in the form of manufacturing waste, can be directly subjected to a recycling. 129788-0-0-0 USE;  USE; 89827-0-0-0 USE					WO2004113238-A1	Absorption element used in treating liquid spillage in e.g. concrete surfaces, is made from polymer foam formed from reaction of component including isocyanate, and component including aromatic polyester polyol and Mannich base polyol	POSTMA C J;  SMITH M F	CHC URETHANE PROD PTY LTD (CHCU-Non-standard);  ORANGE DIAMOND ABSORBENTS PTY LTD (ETFR-C)	2005081407	   NOVELTY - An absorption element is made from a polymer foam formed from the reaction of a first component (10) including an isocyanate, and a second component (12) including an aromatic polyester polyol and a Mannich base polyol.    USE - The inventive absorption element is useful as sheet, block, pad or comminuted smaller particles used in treating liquid spillage e.g. petrol, sunflower oil, vegetable oil, diesel, fuel oil, aviation fuel, engine oil, paraffin, methylene chloride, acetone or alcohol (claimed) in roads, paved and concrete surfaces as well as soil or sand, and organic spillages into storm water drains, dams, canals or rivers and into the sea or harbors such as fuel spills. The compressed foam absorption element can be used as fuel source or as an additive to asphalt systems.    ADVANTAGE - The inventive absorption element can be compressed to approximately a one hundred and twentieth of its original volume, thus ensuring a good recovery of the absorbed liquid and a minimized waste volume. at most 98% of the liquid absorbed by the inventive absorption element can be recovered and recycled. It floats in water and is highly compressible, permitting excellent recovery of absorbed liquid. Its manufacture does not deplete natural resources such as peat or other organic materials.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for:    (a) a method of forming a polymer foam, including reacting a first component including an isocyanate and a second component including an aromatic polyester polyol and a Mannich base polyol; and    (b) a method of treating a liquid spillage, comprising providing at least one absorption element of low density plastics foam, contacting the spillage with the at least one absorption element to absorb the liquid from the spillage, and compressing the at least one absorption element to express the absorbed liquid.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a schematic diagram of manufacturing process of foam and absorbent elements. 107016-0-0-0 ; 129788-0-0-0 ; 2211-0-0-0 ; 2211-0-0-2 ; 104333-0-0-0 			R01740 ; R01694 ; R01949 ; R05085 ; R01778 ; R00975 		US2013040092-A1;  US9221104-B2	Composite building product useful for e.g. hoarding boards for construction, sheeting for construction and flooring systems comprises exterior skin comprising particulate carpet waste materials, and foamed core surrounded by exterior skin	MOORE D A;  REES J J M	MOORE D A (MOOR-Individual);  REES J J M (REES-Individual);  COLUMBIA INSURANCE CO (CIUR-C)	2013C17332	   NOVELTY - A composite building product (1) comprises: exterior skin (3) comprising particulate carpet waste materials; and foamed core (5) surrounded by exterior skin.    USE - As composite building product (claimed) useful in applications ranging from residential and industrial construction, multitude of consumer oriented goods, and other industries requiring desired physical characteristics and properties such as dimensional stability in varying thermal and moisture level conditions, varying levels of structural strength, graffiti resistance, recyclability, and other properties appropriate for application of particular composite product e.g. hoarding boards for construction use, vertical and horizontal sheeting for structural construction, flooring systems, interior paneling such as countertops and bathroom stall walling, cladding construction products, non-sheet building product, sculpted facia, sculpted cladding, posts, and columns.    ADVANTAGE - The composite building product allows recycling of particulate carpet waste materials in exterior skin and further in foamed core, and provides solution for waste material inflow into resource limited landfills which is strained by voluminous amount of post consumer carpet (PCC) waste produced by carpet distributors, carpet installation contractors, and post industrial carpet (PIC) waste produced by carpet manufacturers, which can have substantial economic and environmental impact and is not environmentally beneficial. Recycling carpet, however, is difficult because its major components are chemically and physically diverse. Reclaimed carpet waste material has unique advantage over other recycled materials in that it provides thermoplastic fibrous polymer sources and high percentage of self contained filler materials within single waste stream. The composite building product makes effective and efficient use of reclaimed carpet waste materials in new composite products. The need for virgin material can be kept to minimum, in order to decrease costs and increase amount of old material that is converted into new carpeting. In addition, such broad-based recycling methods can also potentially help to comport with National Sanitation Foundation (NSF) 140/2007 recommendations, which encourage carpet industries to develop sustainable carpet manufacturing and recycling programs for social, economic, and environmental benefits. The reclaimed carpet waste based, foamed composite building product obtained is light weight, fully recyclable at end of life, and is able to incorporate highly contaminated raw material.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - A composite building product (1) comprises: exterior skin (3) comprising particulate carpet waste materials; and foamed core (5) surrounded by exterior skin. The particulate carpet waste material comprises post consumer carpet materials. The exterior skin is comprised of particulate carpet waste material (10-100%); and further comprises particulate mixed plastic waste materials (10-100%) comprising at least one polymeric material selected from recycled container materials, recycled plastic bottle waste materials, and virgin polymer materials; at least one additive (1-15%) selected from UV stabilizers, flame retardants (FR), antifungals (AF), polymeric compatibilizor, colorants/dyes, and anti odor materials; and thermoset materials. The composite building product further comprises at least one layer coupled to top surface of exterior skin; at least one layer coupled to bottom surface of exterior skin; and at least structural layer disposed in foamed core, where structural layer is selected from fibrous pads, woven fabrics, non-woven fabrics, post consumer carpet pieces, metal reinforcing members, pipes, wood boards or strips, metal fencing, and/or bubble wrapping. The foamed core is comprised of post consumer carpet material (1-99%), particulate mixed waste material (1-80%), and chemical blowing agents (1-10, preferably 1-5, especially 1-2)%; and further comprises natural or manmade fibers, and the additive(s). USE - The method is useful for manufacturing ethylene vinyl acetate foam to form marble pattern.    ADVANTAGE - The method has the effect of breaking away from a uniform design and creating a vivid and beautiful marble pattern uniquely; is eco-friendly and reduces the cost.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Manufacturing ethylene vinyl acetate (EVA) foam to form marble pattern comprises (a) taking 95-100 wt.% ethylene vinyl acetate copolymer (EVA) as a resin modifier, 0-5 wt.% polyolefin elastomer (POE) or low-density polyethylene (LDPE) as a filler in magnesium carbonate (MgCO3) or calcium carbonate (CaCO3) as a filler to 100 pts. wt. resin, adding 0-5 pts. wt. mixture of at least one of MgCO3 or CaCO3 as a filler to 100 pts. wt. resin, adding 0-1 pts. wt. mixture of one from ZN/ST or ST/A as an activator and mixing 0-3 pts. wt. zinc oxide, adding 0-1 pts. wt. dicumyl peroxide (DCP) as a crosslinking agent, 0-3.5 pts. wt. foaming agent, and 0.5-4 pts. wt. pigment, rolling and extruding to prepare a base resin in the form of a sheet or pellet; (b) preparing color matching pigment resin for each color in the form of a sheet or pellet by mixing an additive with a polymer resin having a softening point higher than that of the base resin by 20-40 degrees C; (c) preparing mixed resin comprising 90-95 wt.% base resin and 5-10 wt.% color pigment resin, kneading with a miller or kneader, and then extruding into a sheet or pellet; and (d) using press or injection machine for pressing mixed resin for 6-50 minutes at a temperature of 130-180 degrees C and a pressure of 100-150 kg/cm2; where preparing color pigment resin comprises polyolefin elastomer (POE), low density polyethylene (LDPE), linear low density polyethylene (LLDPE), high density polyethylene (HDPE), styrene ethylene butadiene styrene (SEBS) and ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) with any one of first polymer resins from the group, EVA, LLDPE, LDPE, HDPE, SEBS, UHMW-PE, any one second polymer resins from the group of TPE and TPU, and EVA foam, LLDPE foam, LDPE foam, as pre-foamed recycled resin, HDPE foam, SEBS foam, UHMW-PE foam, TPE foam, TPU foam group, and any one third polymer resin comprising 10-50 wt.% mixture of second polymer resin and third polymer resin, 0-5 pts. wt. filler, 0-1 pts. wt. crosslinking agent, 0-1 pts. wt. activator, 0-3 pts. wt. zinc oxide, 100 pts. wt. resin containing 50-90 wt.% first polymer resin, 0-3.5 pts. wt. blowing agent, 0.5-4 pts. wt. pigment, (i) mixing mixture of the second polymer resin and third polymer resin and then mixing the mixture with a first polymer resin and an activator, a pigment, and a mixing agent; (ii) mixing a crosslinking agent and a blowing agent in the mixture of step (i); (iii) rolling and extrusion processing the mixture of the second step into sheets or pellets; (iv) compressing and pulverizing the sheet or pellet of the third step by pressing foaming, foaming at room temperature by gas heating or steam heating, or by crosslinking electron beam foaming with a roll mill; and (v) obtaining a metal nanoparticle-deposited resin in which the metal of the nanoparticles is deposited on the surface of the pulverized product in a vacuum deposition tank using the pulverized product of step (iv) by a vacuum deposition method.    DESCRIPTION OF DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a side photograph of a shoe midsole manufactured according to method of manufacturing an EVA foam forming a marble pattern.
