RB3UC6 K M; R00351 ; R00370 ; R00798 		DE102004059156-A1	New 9-iodo-perylene-3,4-dicarbonic acid imide compounds are useful e.g. as a fluorescence dye to color polymer; as vat- or corrosion dye to color nature materials such as paper; in chemi-luminescence system and as tracer in biochemistry	LANGHALS H;  BUETTNER J	LANGHALS H (LANG-Individual)	2006649814	   NOVELTY - 9-Iodo-perylene-3,4-dicarbonic acid imide compounds (6), are new.    USE - (6) is useful as: a fluorescence dye, to the mass coloring of polymer such as polyvinylchloride, celluloseacetate, polycarbonate, polyamide, polyurethane, polyimide, polybenzimidazole, melamine resin, silicon, polyester, polyether, polystyrol, polymethylmethacrylate, polyethylene, polypropylene, polyvinylacetate, polyacrylnitril, polybutadiene, polychlorobutadiene or polyisoprene and/or its copolymer; vat- or corrosion dye, to the coloring of nature materials such as paper, wood, straw, leather, fur or natural fiber materials such as cotton, wool, silk, jute, sisal, hemp, flax or animal hair (e.g. horse hair) and its transformation product such as viscose fiber, nitrate silk or copper rayon (reyon) (where the salts to be corroded are aluminum-, chrome- and iron salt); coloring material or pigment dye, to the coloring of colors, varnishes and other painting materials, paper colors, printing colors, inks and other colors for printing- and writing; pigments in the electrophotograph: for dry copier system (xerox procedure) and laser printer (non-impact-printing); safety marking (where large- and photochemical constancy and fluorescence of the substance are important), preferably in checks, check cards, money coupons, documents or identification card, to obtain special or clear color printing; color additive, for obtaining color shades, preferably illuminating shades; for object marking for the machine recognizing the objects over the fluorescence, preferably the machine recognizing the object for sorting, also for the recycling of plastics; fluorescence dye for machine readable making, preferably alphanumeric imprints or bar codes; to the frequency conversion of light to obtain light with short-wave length and visible light; in notice elements for multi-side notice-, reference-, and marking e.g. passive notice elements, reference- and road signs, like traffic lights; in ray printing inks, preferably homogeneous solution as a fluorescing ink; leaving material for supra-leading organic materials; for solid material fluorescence marking; for decorative purposes; for artistic purposes; for tracing in the biochemistry, medicine, technology and science (where the covalent dye is connected with substrates or over a valence and hydrogen bridging bond or hydrophobic interactions (adsorption)); fluorescence dye: in high sensitive proof procedure (according to C.Aubert, J. Funfschilling, I.Zschokke-Granacher and H.Langhals, Z.Analyt.Chem, 1985,320,361); in scintillators; in optical light collection systems; in fluorescence solar collector (according to H.langhals, Nachr.Chem.Tech.Lab,1980,28,716); in fluorescence activated displays (according to W.Greubel and G.Baur, Electronics 1977,26,6); in cold light source to the lightly induced polymerization to the preparation of plastics; for material test, in the manufacture of semiconductor control; to the investigation of microstructures of integrated semiconductor component; in photoconductor; in photographic procedures; in notice, illumination or image sensor systems in which the stimulation results through electrons, ions or UV-radiation e.g. in fluorescence notice, brownish tubes or in lamp material tubes; in an integrated semiconductor control as dye or in combination with other semiconductors in the form of epitaxy; in chemi-luminescence system, in chemi-luminescence lamp rods, in luminescence immunoassays or post-luminescence procedure; as signal colors, preferably for optical emphasizing of writing and designing or other graphical products, for marking of paint and other objects in which a special optical color printing is reached; in dye laser as Q-switch, preferably in the production of laser ray; as active substances for non-linear optics, for the doubling frequency and the tripling frequency of laser light; as an improved rheology improver; and in the density test of closed systems (claimed).    ADVANTAGE - (6) exhibits a high non-fading coloring ability.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - 9-Iodo-perylene-3,4-dicarbonic acid imide compounds of formula (6), are new.R1 = H or 0-4 (preferably 0-3) residues of e.g. aromatic isocyclic group, mono- to tetra-cyclic group, particularly mono- or bicyclic group, phenyl, diphenyl naphthyl or anthryl, hetero-cyclic aromatic, preferably mono- or tricyclic group e.g. pyridyl, pyrimidyl, pyrazinyl, triazinyl, pyrrolyl, (iso)quinolyl, coumarinyl, (benzo)furanyl, (benz)imidazolyl, benzoxazolyl, (di)benzofuranyl, (di)benzothiophenyl, indolyl, carbazolyl, pyrazolyl, oxazolyl, isoxazolyl, indazolyl, (benz)thiazolyl, pyridazinyl, quinolyl, quinazolyl, quinoxalyl, phthalazinyl, phthalazindionyl, phthalimidyl, chromonyl, naphtholactamyl, benzopyridonyl, ortho sulfobenimidyl, maleinimidyl, naphtharidinyl, benzimidazolonyl, benzoxazolonyl, benzthiazolonyl, benzthiazolinyl, quinazolonyl, pyrimidyl, quinoxalonyl, phthalazonyl, dioxapyrinidinyl, pyridonyl, isoquinolonyl, isothiazolyl, benzisoxazolyl, benzisothiazolyl, indazolonyl, acrydinyl, acrydonyl, quinazolindionyl, benzoxazindionyl, benzoxazinonyl or phthalimidyl.    Full definitions are given in the "DEFINITIONS - Full Definitions:" field. INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) the preparation of (6); and    (2) the preparation of 9,9'-bis-(perylene-3,4-dicarbonic acid-3,4-imide) of formula (8) comprising obtaining (6) by using metals such as nickel (Ni) (Ni2+ salt, nickel(II) chloride or nickel(II) sulfate) in the presence of a reducing agent, zinc, complexing agent and triphenylphosphane; or nickel-chemical oxygen demand, copper powder, or palladium(0) in the presence of an auxiliary material and a base.    R1 = R2. R01079 ; R00338 ; R00708 ; R00479 ; R00326 ; R00964 ; R00835 ; R00817 	1687-S; 1714-S U; 1726-S; 1803-S; 1408-S	DE102010006182-A1	New polyvinyl alcohol acetal compounds, useful e.g. for producing nanoparticles in liquid or polymeric phase, as pigments and colorants for dyeing purposes, for decorative and artistic purposes, in coatings and as pigments in lacquers	LANGHALS H;  PUST T	LANGHALS H (LANG-Individual)	2011J80137	   NOVELTY - Polyvinyl alcohol acetal compounds (I), are new.    USE - (I) are useful: as pigments and colorants for dyeing purposes; for decorative and artistic purposes, such as for distemper and related colors such as watercolor paints and water colors and inks for inkjet printers, printing inks, inks and other colors for painting and writing purposes, and in coatings; as pigments in lacquers, which are synthetic resin lacquers such as acrylic or vinyl resins, polyester lacquers, novolacs or nitrocellulose lacquers, or natural substances such as zapon lacquers, shellac or Qi lacquer (China or Japan varnish or lacquer of East Asian lacquer), for the mass-coloration of polymers, which are made of polyvinyl chloride, polyvinylidene chloride, polyacrylic acid, polyacrylamide, polyvinyl butyral, polyvinyl pyridine, cellulose acetate, nitrocellulose, polycarbonates, polyamides, polyurethanes, polyimides, polybenzimidazoles, melamine resins, silicones such as polydimethylsiloxane, polyester, polyether, polystyrene, polydivinylbenzene, polyvinyl toluene, polyvinylbenzyl chloride, polymethylmethacrylate, polyethylene, polypropylene, polyvinyl acetate, polyacrylonitrile, polyacrolein, polybutadiene, polychlorobutadiene, polyisoprene or their copolymers; as mordant dyes for coloring natural products e.g. paper, wood, straw or natural fiber materials such as wool, hair, animal hair, bristles, cotton, jute, sisal, hemp, flax, or their conversion products such as viscose, rayon, or copper nitrate silk (rayon), preferably for pickling salts such as aluminum, chromium or iron salts; as a coloring agent for staining of painting and decorative paints, varnishes and other coatings, paper coatings, printing inks, inks and other colors for painting and writing purposes; and as additives to other colors to obtain a specific color shade, preferably luminous shades. (I) are useful for marking, security and display purposes, preferably by considering its fluorescence, e.g. as dyes or fluorescent dyes for signal colors, for optical highlighting of text and drawings or other graphic products, for marking signs and other objects and display elements for a variety of display, notice and marking purposes, in which a particular visual impression of color is to be achieved, for passive display elements, billboards and traffic signs, such as traffic lights for security marking purposes, where the large chemical and photochemical stability and also the fluorescence of the substances are important, for checks, credit cards, bills, vouchers, documents, identification papers, where a special, unmistakable color impression is to be achieved, for marking objects for machine recognition of objects via the fluorescence, preferably, the machine recognition of objects for sorting, e.g. for recycling of plastics, as fluorescent dyes for machine-readable markings, preferably alphanumeric prints or barcodes, as dyes in ink jet printers in homogeneous solution, preferably as fluorescent ink, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in display, illumination or image converter systems, where the excitation is carried out by electrons, ions or UV radiation, e.g., fluorescent displays, Braun tubes or in fluorescent lamps, for tracer purposes, e.g. in biochemistry, medicine, engineering and natural science, where the dyes can be covalently linked to the substrates or via secondary valences, such as hydrogen bonding or hydrophobic interactions (adsorption), as dyes or fluorescent dyes in chemiluminescence systems, e.g. in chemiluminescent glow sticks, in luminescence immunoassays or other luminescence detection processes, or as a material for leak testing of closed systems. (I) are useful as functional materials in data storage, preferably in optical storage devices such as compact disc or digital versatile discs, in organic LEDs, in photovoltaic systems, as pigments in electrophotography e.g. for dry copier systems (xerox process) and laser printer (non-impact printing), to make the frequency of light from short wavelength light to longer wavelength visible light, as a starting material for superconducting organic materials, as fluorescent dyes in scintillators, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in optical light collection systems, such as the fluorescence or fluorescence-activated displays solar collector, for deflecting light in liquid crystals, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in cold light sources for light-induced polymerization for the representation of plastics, as dyes or fluorescent dyes for materials testing e.g. in the manufacture and testing of semiconductor circuits and semiconductor devices, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in photoconductors, photographic processes, as dyes or fluorescent dyes as part of an integrated semiconductor circuit containing dyes as such or in combination with other semiconductors, for example in the form of an epitaxy, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in dye lasers, preferably as fluorescent dyes for generating laser beams and Q-switch switches, and as active substances for a non-linear optics, such as frequency doubling and frequency tripling of laser light, and for producing nanoparticles in liquid or polymeric phase (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - (I) have strong light absorption, and provide highly fluorescent nanoparticles to the aqueous phase from pure organic material.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Polyvinyl alcohol acetal compounds of formula (I), are new.    Y1 = a structure that absorbs light in the wavelength of 350-3500 (preferably 400-750) nm, e.g. nitro-, nitroso-, diphenylmethane-, triphenylmethane-, acridine-, indigoid-, quinoid vat-, indigosol-, sulfur-, stilbene-, xanthene-, azine-, methine-, quinone imine-, anthraquinone-, thiazole-, azo-, phthalocyanine-, porphyrin- or squarylium-dyes; and    m, n = 1-1000, preferably 10-350.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) nanoparticles obtained from (I) in liquid or polymeric phase, preferably in liquid phase, which is water; and    (2) the preparation of (I). 0760-S	DE102009008661-A1	New micellar nanoparticle comprising anthra(2,1,9-def;6,5,10-d'e'f')diisoquinoline-1,3,8,10-tetraone compound useful e.g. in data storages, preferably in optical storage e.g. compact disc or DVD discs, organic-LED and photovoltaic device	LANGHALS H;  PUST T	LANGHALS H (LANG-Individual)	2010K32759	   NOVELTY - Micellar nanoparticle comprising at least 2-1000 molecules of anthra(2,1,9-def;6,5,10-d'e'f')diisoquinoline-1,3,8,10-tetraone compound (III) is new.    USE - The micellar nanoparticle is useful: in data storages, preferably in optical storage e.g. compact discs or DVD discs, organic-LED, photovoltaic device; and display elements for multifarious display, reference- and labeling purpose, e.g. passive display elements, reference sign and traffic sign, such as traffic lights; and for: mass coloring of polymers e.g. materials from polyvinyl chloride, polyvinylidene chloride, polyacrylic acid, polyacrylamide, polyvinyl butyral, polyvinylpyridine, cellulose acetate, nitrocellulose, polycarbonate, polyamide, polyurethane, polyimide, polybenzimidazole, melamine resin, silicone, polydimethylsiloxane, polyester, polyether, polystyrene, polydivinylbenzene, polyvinyltoluene, polyvinylbenzylchloride, polymethylmethacrylate, polyethylene, polypropylene, polyvinyl acetate, polyacrylonitrile, polyacrolein, polybutadiene, polychlorobutadiene or polyisoprene and/or its copolymer; for safety labeling purposes (where large chemical and photochemical stability and appropriate fluorescence of the substances are important) preferably checks, check cards, bank note certificate, documents, identification card papers; labeling of objects for the machine detection over the fluorescence, preferably the machine detection of objects takes place for sorting purpose, e.g. also for recycling of plastics; the frequency conversion of light, e.g. short wavelength light to long wavelength to form visible light; solid fluorescence labeling; decorative and artistic purposes; tracer-purposes, e.g. in biochemistry, medicine, technology and science, where the dye is covalently connected with substrates or low valent, hydrogen bridges or hydrophobic interactions (adsorption); for leak testing of closed systems; and as a corrosion dye e.g. natural materials e.g. paper, wood, sisal, or natural fiber materials such as cotton, jute, hemp, flax and/or its conversion product e.g. viscose fiber, nitrate silk or rayon, where the corroding salts are aluminum salt, chromium salt or iron salt, dye to color lacquers and other coating materials, paper colors, printing colors, inks and other colors for writing purposes, pigment in electrophotography e.g. xerox and non-impact printing process; additive to other colors with which certain color shade is supposed to be obtained, preferably illuminating shades; a fluorescing ink in inks jet printers in homogeneous solution; starting materials for supraconductive organic material; a part of an integrated semiconductor circuit or in connection with other semiconductors to form an epitaxy; active substances for a non-linear optics, e.g. frequency doping and frequency triplication of laser light; and as a rheology modifier. The micellar nanoparticle is useful as fluorescent dye: for machine readable labeling, preferred alphanumeric imprints or barcodes, in highly sensitive detection procedure, scintillators, light collector systems, fluorescence solar collectors, fluorescence active displays, cold light source for light induced polymerization to produce plastics, for material testing e.g. in the manufacture of semiconductor circuit, for detecting microstructures of integrated semiconductor component, in photoconductors, in photographic process, in lighting or image converter system with which the stimulation takes place through electronic, ionic or UV radiation, e.g. in fluorescence display, oscilloscope or in fluorescent tube, in chemiluminescence system, e.g. in chemiluminescence-light sticks, in luminescence immunoassays or other luminescence detection process, as signal colors for optical emphasizing of writing signs, drawings or other graphic products with which a special optical color prints are obtained, for labeling of signboards and other objects and as Q-switcher in color lasers, preferably to produce laser ray (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - (III) exhibits high photostability, chemical resistance and low toxicity. The micellar nanoparticle exhibits high fluorescence with approximately 100% quantum yield.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Micellar nanoparticle comprising at least 2-1000 molecules of anthra(2,1,9-def;6,5,10-d'e'f')diisoquinoline-1,3,8,10-tetraone compound of formula (III) is new.    R1-R6 = H, alkyl with at most 37C, in which 1-10 CH2-units are optionally substituted by carbonyl group, O, S, Se, Te, cis or trans -CH=CH-groups (in which a CH unit is optionally substituted by N), acetylenic C?=C-groups, 1,2-, 1,3- or 1,4-substituted phenyl, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5-, 2,6-, 3,4- or 3,5-disubstituted pyridine, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5- or 3,4-disubstituted thiophene, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5-, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 2,3-, 2,6- or 2,7-disubstituted naphthalene, in which 1 or 2 CH groups are optionally substituted by N, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5-, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 1,9-, 1,10-, 2,3-, 2,6-, 2,7-, 2,9-, 2,10- or 9,10-disubstituted anthracene, in which one or two CH groups are optionally substituted by N, up to 12 single H of the CH2-group are optionally substituted by F, Cl, Br, I or CN, up to 18C-alkyl, in which 1-6 CH2 units are optionally substituted by carbonyl group, O, S, Se, Te, cis or trans-CH=CH-groups, in which a CH unit is optionally substituted by N.    In the residues R1-R6 instead of having substituents, the free valency of the methine group and/or quaternary carbon atoms are pair wise connected to form rings e.g. cyclohexane, and the residue R1-R16 further comprises F, Cl, Br or I. An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for the preparation of nanoparticle solution. USE - (Q) are useful: as fluorescent labels for marking various substrates such as for quality control or for the investigation of diffusion processes; as pigments and colorants for dyeing purposes; for decorative and artistic purposes, such as for distemper and related colors such as watercolor paints and water colors and inks for inkjet printers, printing inks, inks and other colors for painting and writing purposes, and in coatings; as pigments in lacquers, which are synthetic resin lacquers such as acrylic or vinyl resins, polyester lacquers, novolacs or nitrocellulose lacquers, or natural substances such as zapon lacquers, Shellac or Qi lacquer (China or Japan varnish or lacquer of East Asian lacquer), for the mass-coloration of polymers, which are made of polyvinyl chloride, polyvinylidene chloride, polyacrylic acid, polyacrylamide, polyvinyl butyral, polyvinyl pyridine, cellulose acetate, nitrocellulose, polycarbonates, polyamides, polyurethanes, polyimides, polybenzimidazoles, melamine resins, silicones such as polydimethylsiloxane, polyester, polyether, polystyrene, polydivinylbenzene, polyvinyl toluene, polyvinylbenzyl chloride, polymethylmethacrylate, polyethylene, polypropylene, polyvinyl acetate, polyacrylonitrile, polyacrolein, polybutadiene, polychlorobutadiene, polyisoprene or their copolymers; as mordant dyes for coloring natural products e.g. paper, wood, straw or natural fiber materials such as wool, hair, animal hair, bristles, cotton, jute, sisal, hemp, flax, or their conversion products such as viscose, rayon or copper nitrate silk (rayon), preferably for pickling salts such as aluminum, chromium or iron salts; as a coloring agent for staining of painting and decorative paints, varnishes and other coatings, paper coatings, printing inks, inks and other colors for painting and writing purposes; and as additives to other colors to obtain a specific color shade, preferably luminous shades. (Q) are useful for marking, security and display purposes, preferably by considering its fluorescence, e.g. as dyes or fluorescent dyes for signal colors, for optical highlighting of text and drawings or other graphic products, for marking signs and other objects and display elements for a variety of display, notice and marking purposes, in which a particular visual impression of color is to be achieved, for passive display elements, billboards and traffic signs, such as traffic lights for security marking purposes, where the large chemical and photochemical stability and also the fluorescence of the substances are important, for checks, credit cards, bills, vouchers, documents, and identification papers, where a special, unmistakable color impression is to be achieved, for marking objects for machine recognition of objects via the fluorescence, preferably the machine recognition of objects for sorting, e.g. for recycling of plastics, as fluorescent dyes for machine-readable markings, preferably alphanumeric prints or barcodes, as dyes in ink jet printers in homogeneous solution, preferably as fluorescent ink, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in display, illumination or image converter systems, where the excitation is carried out by electrons, ions or UV radiation, e.g., fluorescent displays, Braun tubes or in fluorescent lamps, for tracer purposes, e.g. in biochemistry, medicine, engineering and natural science, where the dyes can be covalently linked to the substrates or via secondary valences, such as hydrogen bonding or hydrophobic interactions (adsorption), as dyes or fluorescent dyes in chemiluminescence systems, e.g. in chemiluminescent glow sticks, in luminescence immunoassays or other luminescence detection processes, or as a material for leak testing of closed systems. (Q) are useful as functional materials in data storage, preferably in optical storage devices such as compact disc or digital versatile discs, in organic LEDs, in photovoltaic systems, as pigments in electrophotography e.g. for dry copier systems (xerox process) and laser printer (non-impact printing), to make the frequency of light from short wavelength light to longer wavelength visible light, as a starting material for superconducting organic materials, as fluorescent dyes in scintillators, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in optical light collection systems, such as the fluorescence or fluorescence-activated displays solar collector, for deflecting light in liquid crystals, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in cold light sources for light-induced polymerization for the representation of plastics, as dyes or fluorescent dyes for materials testing e.g. in the manufacture and testing of semiconductor circuits and semiconductor devices, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in photoconductors, photographic processes, as dyes or fluorescent dyes as part of an integrated semiconductor circuit containing dyes as such or in combination with other semiconductors, e.g. in the form of an epitaxy, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in dye lasers, preferably as fluorescent dyes for generating laser beams and Q-switches, and as active substances for non-linear optics, such as frequency doubling and frequency tripling of laser light (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - (Q) have improved stability and fluorescent properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Substituted imidazolonaphthalene compounds (Q) of formulae (I) and (II), are new.    R1-R14 = H, halo or 1-37C-linear alkyl, in which 1-10 CH2 units are optionally replaced by carbonyl groups, oxygen atoms, sulfur atoms, selenium atoms, tellurium atoms, cis- or trans-CH=CH-groups, in which a CH-unit is optionally replaced by N, acetylenic CC-groups 1,2-, 1,3- or 1,4-substituted phenyl group, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5-, 2,6-, 3,4- or 3,5-disubstituted pyridine group, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5- or 3,4-disubstituted thiophene group, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5-, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 2,3-, 2,6- or 2,7-disubstituted naphthalene group, in which one or two CH groups are optionally replaced by N, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5 -, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 1,9-, 1,10-, 2,3-, 2,6-, 2,7-, 2,9-, 2,10- or 9,10-disubstituted anthracene, in which one or two CH are optionally replaced by N.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the preparation of (Q). R00817 ; R00835 ; R00964 ; R00326 ; R00479 ; R00708 ; R00859 ; R01853 ; R00444 ; R00446 ; R00360 ; R00338 	2002-U; 1783-U	DE102010023469-A1	New substituted benzoperylene tetracarboxylic acid imide anhydride derivative useful e.g. as energy donor groups in bi- and multichromophoric compounds for achieving a broadband light absorption, e.g. in fluorescent dyes	LANGHALS H;  BOECK B	LANGHALS H (LANG-Individual)	2011Q18340	   NOVELTY - Substituted benzoperylene tetracarboxylic acid imide anhydride derivative (I) is new.    USE - (I)-(IV) are useful: as energy donor groups in bi- and multichromophoric compounds for achieving a broadband light absorption, e.g. in fluorescent dyes or in systems for light-driven charge separation and in bichromophores comprising perylene-3,4:9,10-tetracarboxylic acid bisimide derivatives or corrole derivatives; as pigments and dyes for dyeing purposes and for decorative and artistic purposes, e.g. in distempers and related dyes, preferably e.g. watercolor paints and in coating compositions; as pigments in lacquers, preferably synthetic resin lacquers e.g. acrylic or vinyl resins, polyester lacquers, novolacs, nitrocellulose lacquers or natural substances e.g. cellulose lacquer, shellac or Qi-lacquers; for mass dyeing of polymers, e.g. materials made of polyvinyl chloride, polyvinylidene chloride, polyacrylic acid, polyacrylamide, polyvinyl butyral, polyvinylpyridine, cellulose acetate, nitrocellulose, polycarbonates, polyamides, polyurethanes, polyimides, polybenzimidazoles, melamine resin, silicones e.g. polydimethylsiloxane, polyester, polyether, polystyrene, polydivinylbenzene, polyvinyl toluene, polyvinylbenzyl chloride, polymethyl methacrylate, polyethylene, polypropylene, polyvinyl acetate, polyacrylonitrile, polyacrolein, polybutadiene, polychlorobutadiene or polyisoprene, or the copolymers of these monomers, and for dyeing natural products e.g. paper, wood, straw, or natural fiber materials e.g. wool, hair, animal hair, bristles, cotton, jute, sisal, hemp, flax or their conversion products e.g. viscose fibers, nitrate silk or copper rayon; as mordant dyes e.g. for dyeing natural products, where salts for mordant comprises aluminum-, chromium- or iron salts; as dyeing agent e.g. for dyeing paints, lacquers and other paints, paper coatings, printing inks, inks and other dyes for painting and writing purposes; as an additive for other dyes for achieving a specific color shade, preferably bright colors; for marking-, safety and display purposes, preferably under the consideration of their fluorescence e.g. as dyes or fluorescent dyes for signal colors, preferably for visual highlighting of writings and drawings or other graphical products, for marking of signs and other objects and in display elements for various display-, information- and marking purposes, where a special optical color impression is required, for passive display elements, information symbols and traffic signs e.g. traffic lights for security marking purposes, where a large chemical and photochemical stability and optionally the fluorescence of the substances is important, for checks, credit cards, bank notes, coupons, documents and identity cards, where a special, unmistakable color impression is required, and for marking of objects for machine recognition of these objects by fluorescence, preferably machine recognition of objects for sorting, and for recycling of plastics; as fluorescent dyes for machine readable markings, preferably alphanumeric imprints or bar codes; as dyes in inkjet printers in homogeneous solution, preferably as fluorescent ink, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in display-, lighting- or image intensifier systems, in which the excitation is carried out by electrons, ions or UV radiation, e.g. in fluorescent displays, cathode ray tubes or fluorescent lamps, for tracer purposes e.g. in biochemistry, medicine, technology and natural science, where the dyes can be covalently linked to substrates by secondary valences such as hydrogen bonding or hydrophobic interactions; as dyes or fluorescent dyes in chemiluminescence systems e.g. in chemiluminescent glow sticks, luminescence immunoassays or in other luminescence detection methods; as a material in leakage testing of closed systems; as functional materials e.g. in data storage, preferably in optical storage e.g. compact discs or DVD discs, in OLEDs, and in photovoltaic systems; as pigments in electrophotography e.g. for dry copying systems and laser printers, and for frequency conversion of light e.g. conversion of light from short wavelength light to longer wavelength visible light; as starting materials for superconducting organic materials; as fluorescent dyes in scintillators; as dyes or fluorescent dyes in optical light collecting systems e.g. fluorescent solar collector or fluorescence activated displays, and in liquid crystals for deflecting light; as dyes or fluorescent dyes in cold light sources for light induced polymerization for preparing plastics; as dyes or fluorescent dyes for material testing e.g. in the manufacture and testing of semiconductor circuits and semiconductor devices; as dyes or fluorescent dyes in photoconductors and photographic processes; as dyes or fluorescent dyes as a part of integrated semiconductor circuits, which dyes as such or in combination with other semiconductors e.g. in the form of epitaxy; as dyes or fluorescent dyes in dye lasers, preferably as fluorescent dyes for generating laser beams; as Q-switch interruptor; and as active substances for a non-linear optics e.g. for frequency doubling and frequency tripling of laser light (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - (I) exhibits: longer wavelength absorption at 477 nm and also more intense shorter wavelength absorption at 439 nm, and thus the fluorescence spectrum of (I) is less structured and is the mirror image of the longest wavelength absorption band; and a high fluorescence quantum yield, preferably 60%.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Substituted benzoperylene tetracarboxylic acid imide anhydride derivative of formula (I) is new.    either R1-R9 = linear 1- not greater than 37C alkyl (in which 1-10 CH2 units may be replaced e.g. by C=O) or H; or    R1-R9 = F, Cl, Br or I.    Full definitions are given in the DEFINITIONS (Full Definitions) Field. INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are also included for:    (1) a substituted benzoperylene tetracarboxylic acid imide of formula (II);    (2) a substituted benzoperylene derivative of formula (III);    (3) a substituted perylene dicarboxylic acid bisimide of formula (IV);    (4) preparing (I); and    (5) preparing (II), comprising carrying out condensation reaction of (I) with primary amines, in presence of condensation auxiliaries comprising quinoline, imidazole or mixtures of chloroform, trifluoroacetic acid and dichloro cyclohexyl carbodiimide.    R10 = R1;    X = upto 12 CH2 units (in which at least one CH2 unit may be replaced e.g. by C=O), linear upto 18C alkyl (in which 1-6 CH2 units may be replaced e.g. by C=O); and    Y1 = substituted aldimine group of formula (-CH=N-R1).    Full definitions are given in the DEFINITIONS (Full Definitions) Field.  HOFER A	LANGHALS H (LANG-Individual)	2013R22772	   NOVELTY - Imidazoloterrylene bisimide compounds are new.    USE - (I) are useful as pigments and colorants for dyeing purposes, in lacquers, preferably synthetic resin lacquers such as acrylic or vinyl resins, polyester lacquers, novolak resins, nitrocellulose lacquers or natural substances such as cellulose lacquer, shellac lacquer or Qi lacquer (Chinese or Japanese lacquer paint or East Asian lacquer), as additives to other colors, where a particular shade is achieved, preferably brilliant colors, mordant dyes e.g. for dyeing natural substances, natural fiber materials or their conversion products, preferably salts for the mordant, which are aluminum, chromium and iron salts, and colorant e.g. for coloring paints, lacquers and other coating compositions, paper colors, printing colors, inks and other colors for painting and writing purposes; for decorative and artistic purposes, such as for distemper and related colors such as watercolor paints and water colors and inks for inkjet printers, printing inks, inks and washes, mass coloration of polymers and silicones, coloring natural substances such as paper, wood, straw, or natural fiber materials such as wool, hair, animal hair, bristles, cotton, jute, sisal, hemp, flax or their reaction products such as viscose, nitrate silk or copper rayon (rayon), labeling, security and display purposes, e.g. as dyes or fluorescence dyes for signal color, preferably for optical emphasize of writing and drawings or other graphic products, to identify signs and other objects and in display elements for a wide variety of display, information and marking purposes for which a particular visual color impression is achieved, for passive display elements, information and traffic signs, such as traffic lights for safety marking purposes for which high chemical and photochemical stability and fluorescence of substances are required, preferably for checks, credit cards, bills, coupons, documents and identity papers, where it requires a special, unmistakable color impression, for marking objects for machine recognition of these objects on the fluorescence, preferably machine recognition of objects for sorting purpose, e.g. for the recycling of plastics, as fluorescent dyes for machine-readable markings such as alphanumeric markings or barcodes as colorants in inkjet printers in homogeneous solution, preferably a fluorescent ink, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in display, illumination or image conversion systems, in which excitation takes place by electrons, ions or UV radiation, such as fluorescent displays, Braun tubes or fluorescent tubes, for tracer purposes, such as biochemistry, medicine, technology and science, where the dyes are covalently linked to substrates or weak interactions such as hydrogen bonds or hydrophobic interactions (adsorption), as dyes or fluorescent dyes in chemiluminescence systems, e.g. in chemiluminescent flashlights, in luminescence immunoassays or other luminescence detection processes, and system as material closed for leak testing, as functional materials such as data storage, preferably optical storage including compact disc- or digital optical disc-disks, organic light emitting diodes and photovoltaic systems, and as pigments in electrophotography (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - (I) can be safely manufactured with high quality in an environmentally-friendly manner.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Imidazoloterrylene bisimide compounds of formula (I) are new.    R1-R18 = H or linear alkyl having at least one carbon atom or less than 37 carbon atom, in which up to 1-10 CH2-units are optionally replaced by carbonyl, O, S, Se, Te, cis- or trans-CH=CH-groups, where CH-unit is optionally replaced by Q, 12 single H of the CH2-groups are replaced by F, Cl, Br or I or CN, or linear 18C-alkyl, 1-6 CH2-units are optionally replaced by T, 12 single H of the CH2 groups of the alkyl are optionally replaced by F, Cl, Br or I or CN or linear 18C-alkyl, and 1-6 CH2-units are independently replaced by T;    Q = N, acetylenic-CC-, 1,2-, 1,3- or 1,4-substituted phenyl, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5-, 2,6-, 3,4- or 3,5-disubstituted pyridine, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5- or 3,4-disubstituted thiophene or 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5-, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 2,3-, 2,6- or 2,7-disubstituted naphthalene in which one or two CH-groups are optionally replaced by N, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5-, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 1,9-, 1,10-, 2,3-, 2,6-, 2,7-, 2,9-, 2,10- or 9,10-disubstituted anthracene in which one or two CH-groups are optionally replaced by N;    T = carbonyl, O, S, Se, Te, cis- or trans-CH=CH-groups, and CH-unit is optionally replaced by N, acetylenic -CC-, 1,2-, 1,3- or 1,4-substituted phenyl, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5-, 2,6-, 3,4- or 3,5-disubstituted pyridine, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5- or 3, 4-disubstituted thiophene, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5-, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 2,3-, 2,6- or 2,7-disubstituted naphthalene (in which one or two carbon atoms are optionally replaced by N, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5-, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 1,9-, 1,10-, 2,3-, 2,6-, 2,7-, 2,9-, 2,10- or 9,10-disubstituted anthracene in which one or two carbon atoms are optionally replaced by N), where substituents carrying the free valency of methine group and quaternary C atoms are pair-wise coupled to form a ring e.g. cyclohexane ring;    R1-R9 = halo including F, Cl, Br or I; and    X = linear alkyl having at least one carbon atom or less than 37 carbon atom, where up to 1-10 CH2-units are optionally replaced by carbonyl, O, S, Se, Te, cis-or trans-CH=CH group and the CH-unit is replaced by Q, 12 single H of the CH2-groups are optionally replaced by F, Cl, Br or I or CN, or linear 18C-alkyl, 1-6 CH2-units are optionally replaced by T, 12 single H of the CH2 groups of the alkyl radical are optionally replaced by F, Cl, Br or I or CN or linear 18C-alkyl, and 1-6 CH2-units are optionally replaced by T.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:    (1) preparation of (I); and    (2) temperature measurement using temperature dependence of UV/visible-absorptions-, fluorescence and fluorescence excitation spectra, preferably fluorescence spectra of imidazole terrylene compound of formula (II) and of perylene bisimides compound of formula (III), where the spectra show a maximum displacement of the fluorescence. RAKSVI K U; RA1TFF K U; R01783 K S; R00712 K S; R00868 ; R00001 ; R01861 ; R24076 ; R24077 ; R01852 	1783-S; 0712-S	DE102010008613-A1	New substituted perylene compounds, useful e.g. as pigments and colorants for dyeing purposes and for decorative purposes, as watercolor paints, water colors and inks for inkjet printers, and as material for leak testing of closed systems	LANGHALS H;  PUST T	LANGHALS H (LANG-Individual)	2011K79711	   NOVELTY - Substituted perylene compounds (Q) comprising perylenetriazoline compounds (I), perylenetetrazine compounds (II), perylenespirothiirane compounds (III) and perylenetetracarboxylic acid bisimide compounds (IV), are new.    USE - (Q) are useful: as pigments and colorants for dyeing purposes; for decorative and artistic purposes, such as for distemper and related colors such as watercolor paints and water colors and inks for inkjet printers, printing inks, inks and other colors for painting and writing purposes, and in coatings; as pigments in lacquers, which are synthetic resin lacquers such as acrylic or vinyl resins, polyester lacquers, novolacs or nitrocellulose lacquers, or natural substances such as zapon lacquers, shellac or Qi lacquer (China or Japan varnish or lacquer of East Asian lacquer), for the mass-coloration of polymers, which are made of polyvinyl chloride, polyvinylidene chloride, polyacrylic acid, polyacrylamide, polyvinyl butyral, polyvinyl pyridine, cellulose acetate, nitrocellulose, polycarbonates, polyamides, polyurethanes, polyimides, polybenzimidazoles, melamine resins, silicones such as polydimethylsiloxane, polyester, polyether, polystyrene, polydivinylbenzene, polyvinyl toluene, polyvinylbenzyl chloride, polymethylmethacrylate, polyethylene, polypropylene, polyvinyl acetate, polyacrylonitrile, polyacrolein, polybutadiene, polychlorobutadiene, polyisoprene or their copolymers; as mordant dyes for coloring natural products e.g. paper, wood, straw or natural fiber materials such as wool, hair, animal hair, bristles, cotton, jute, sisal, hemp, flax, or their conversion products such as viscose, rayon, or copper nitrate silk (rayon), preferably for pickling salts such as aluminum, chromium or iron salts; as a coloring agent for staining of painting and decorative paints, varnishes and other coatings, paper coatings, printing inks, inks and other colors for painting and writing purposes; and as additives to other colors to obtain a specific color shade, preferably luminous shades. (Q) are useful for marking, security and display purposes, preferably by considering its fluorescence, e.g. as dyes or fluorescent dyes for signal colors, for optical highlighting of text and drawings or other graphic products, for marking signs and other objects and display elements for a variety of display, notice and marking purposes, in which a particular visual impression of color is to be achieved, for passive display elements, billboards and traffic signs, such as traffic lights for security marking purposes, where the large chemical and photochemical stability and also the fluorescence of the substances are important, for checks, credit cards, bills, vouchers, documents, and identification papers, where a special, unmistakable color impression is to be achieved, for marking objects for machine recognition of objects via the fluorescence, preferably, the machine recognition of objects for sorting, e.g. for recycling of plastics, as fluorescent dyes for machine-readable markings, preferably alphanumeric prints or barcodes, as dyes in ink jet printers in homogeneous solution, preferably as fluorescent ink, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in display, illumination or image converter systems, where the excitation is carried out by electrons, ions or UV radiation, e.g., fluorescent displays, Braun tubes or in fluorescent lamps, for tracer purposes, e.g. in biochemistry, medicine, engineering and natural science, where the dyes can be covalently linked to the substrates or via secondary valences, such as hydrogen bonding or hydrophobic interactions (adsorption), as dyes or fluorescent dyes in chemiluminescence systems, e.g. in chemiluminescent glow sticks, in luminescence immunoassays or other luminescence detection processes, or as a material for leak testing of closed systems. (Q) are useful as functional materials in data storage, preferably in optical storage devices such as compact disc or digital versatile discs, in organic LEDs, in photovoltaic systems, as pigments in electrophotography e.g. for dry copier systems (xerox process) and laser printer (non-impact printing), to make the frequency of light from short wavelength light to longer wavelength visible light, as a starting material for superconducting organic materials, as fluorescent dyes in scintillators, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in optical light collection systems, such as the fluorescence or fluorescence-activated displays solar collector, for deflecting light in liquid crystals, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in cold light sources for light-induced polymerization for the representation of plastics, as dyes or fluorescent dyes for materials testing e.g. in the manufacture and testing of semiconductor circuits and semiconductor devices, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in photoconductors, photographic processes, as dyes or fluorescent dyes as part of an integrated semiconductor circuit containing dyes as such or in combination with other semiconductors, for example in the form of an epitaxy, as dyes or fluorescent dyes in dye lasers, preferably as fluorescent dyes for generating laser beams and Q-switch switches, and as active substances for non-linear optics, such as frequency doubling and frequency tripling of laser light (all claimed).    ADVANTAGE - (Q) have improved stability and improved fluorescent properties, preferably red fluorescent properties.    DETAILED DESCRIPTION - Substituted perylene compounds (Q) comprising perylenetriazoline compounds of formula (I), perylenetetrazine compounds of formula (II), perylenespirothiirane compounds of formula (III) and perylenetetracarboxylic acid bisimide compounds of formula (IV), are new.    R1-R8 = H, halo or 1-37C-linear alkyl, in which 1-10 CH2 units are optionally replaced by carbonyl groups, oxygen atoms, sulfur atoms, selenium atoms, tellurium atoms, cis- or trans-CH=CH-groups; and    X = 1-12 CH2 units, in which one or more CH2 units are optionally replaced by carbonyl groups, oxygen, sulfur atoms, selenium atoms, tellurium atoms, cis- or trans-CH=CH-groups, in which a CH-unit is optionally replaced by N, acetylenic CC-groups 1,2-, 1,3- or 1,4-substituted phenyl group, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5-, 2,6-, 3,4- or 3,5-disubstituted pyridine group, 2,3-, 2,4-, 2,5- or 3,4-disubstituted thiophene group, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5-, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 2,3-, 2,6- or 2,7-disubstituted naphthalene group, in which one or two CH groups are optionally replaced by N, 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-, 1,5 -, 1,6-, 1,7-, 1,8-, 1,9-, 1,10-, 2,3-, 2,6-, 2,7-, 2,9-, 2,10- or 9,10-disubstituted anthracene, in which one or two CH are optionally replaced by N.    INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for the preparation of (Q).
